fBxmsAbBV7pkZbw4yDTPTg.text: Wow.   Went in for Sunday Brunch and noticed a terrible sewage rotten eggs smell and tried to move away from the door. Decided to get a table instead of sit a the bar and were told they were on a wait because servers weren't coming in and they didn't want to back the kitchen up.  I kid you not, it was probably 10:15 a.m. and there were maybe, 2 tables in the front that were occupied and about 3 in the back.  They "just got off of a wait," the hostess told us. I was dumbfounded.  You never place blame on your FOH staff like that and say we can't seat you because people haven't shown up. If you need to pull the bartender off of the bar because NO ONE is sitting there, then do so, ask a manager to help, and then attack service as a team which is what you are in the SERVICE industry.  Way to stick up for the BOH but come on, you can walk real slow to the table. You can make conversation about the menu before departing, suggest dishes, ask if we've been before, etc. All of these things add time, give your staff a little breather, and then you move on.  Really disappointed.  Ended up not staying because of the disgusting smell because we couldn't take it and, we couldn't sit anywhere else.

jqYlB9xCEmpQ3VW0c5I2Wg.text: This must be a newer restaurant because it seemed to have a lot of buzz.  Tex Mex food, chips, sales, Fajitas, etc.  Didn't have a reservation so had to wait about 30 minutes. Bar was packed so grabbed a drink and headed outside to the side alley to wait. When we got in service was decent and the food was very good.

n-mzUK8Gsu3dsB8a1oVXnQ.text: This place is amazing! We had a little surprise party of 8 and had just the best service! The queso appetizer, fontina, and bottomless rice and beans for the table was a hit! These puffy tacos were amazing, both the chicken tinga and the spicy beef.  The lomo sampler platter was amazing too, great flavors! For preggo moms ask for their agua fresca, delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

4nq0aaAYTd_-5TBiYUk_5Q.text: A proper shout out to Michael & his staff of seasoned professionals behind the bar at my go to neighborhood Tex-Mex restaurant nestled here in the SouthEnd of Charlotte .. the service never disappoints! I highly recommend the frozen Cadillac margarita which of course comes with a shot of Grand Marnier up top .. the chips & salsa are always on point and the entrees are simply delicious. If you haven't been to Superica you owe it to yourself to drop in for the friendly atmosphere & an overall great experience! Absolutely no shame in their game at this vibrant dining establishment. Cheers!

QNFY5w_3TWHqxH6fLJYbHw.text: Superica has great food and is in a really great, funky space. The waiters/waitresses are always really nice and competent, also.  But what in the world is going on with the management here? We have been to Superica eight times, and each time there have been no less than twenty open tables, but still a wait. And the kitchen is constantly backed up. It always takes us at least 45 minutes to get our food. I could understand if they just opened, but Superica has been open for 7 months. Come on guys! Figure it out. Our opinion is not an anomaly, either. Everyone we talk to has the same sentiments. It's a real shame because the food is great, and I can tell the employees work hard.   We won't be visiting any time soon after our experience this morning (we spent 2 hours as a party of 2 at the restaurant due to the kitchen being backed up again). I hope some changes are made so we can try it again in the future.

XXPoq2YQExzzNeOho-kBYA.text: Date night last week was at the new Tex Mex place  in Southend. Nice atmosphere.. good food!  Our order was - Chilli corn queso, crisp shrimp tacos and vegetarian fajitas! All very yummy. Even the chips and salsa served at the table also very good.  Go prepared to wait a bit.. they do not take reservations, but have a nice patio and good bar to wait it out. For dessert the Tres Le Ches looked heavenly, saved it for next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

8hbQbaHyXpaycvRdvwx_jQ.text: Really awesome Mexican food place in South End. It has lots of personality and great varied menu. Several times I've been here it has been very busy, but they work you through quickly. I had some great Salsa here, Queso, Tacos, Tamale. The fare isn't the typical menu that you see in almost all mexican restaurants, but more upscale. Pricier also, but if you want a nice Mexican dinner and something a little different, this is your place. It has a hopping popular vibe, a great bar, great food, a cool interior in an old refurbished building. And you can find excellent parking right across the street.

Z8NQn-z4KNRStPets1KZFg.text: The most amazing mex ever!! Cannot get enough of this place. Steak fajitas are mind blowing... especially with their Mexican butter. Homemade flour tortillas, delicious salsas, and I love their hot tamales. Do not skip this restaurant!   PS... their weekend brunch was just as amazing! It will be hard to eat Mexican OR Bruch anywhere else... this place tops all.

rI_Lul2jLFLTqnTzJN8qTg.text: Damn. Good. Tex-mex.  That's not just the margaritas talking- this place has some seriously good grub. Not only did I devoured my El Pastor tacos but I started stealing bites of my boyfriends Barbacoa tacos too. 10/10 would recommend.

zlmIbMv0xWSS_pdu_d5kQg.text: Really enjoyed this place for a weekend lunch with the famsquad.   Everything we had was delish. My son may have learned his lesson with the peppers that made him cry.   Cocktails were also on point. Great from top to bottom

_p-pcX9lbGQPh6y8yO1_mA.text: While open a while now, Superica is a fantastic new addition to Southend that fits right in with warehouse-style district. The place is large, bright and airy with two dining areas, one with a view of the kitchen. There is also a large bar and a sofa if you're chilling after your meal.  You'll be greeted with the house chips and two salsas; they give you a green salsa and roasted salsa and both are delicious and packed with flavor.  Try the nachos, chicken or beef, they are a must and are not what your expecting. The flautas appetizer is my favorite.   Every time I've been Charlie has been behind the bar and the service has been amazing.   It's just a good place to visit.

gMAT9cEUwRQbOBUleL6HPA.text: Come here for my birthday & Joanna provided an excellent experience! She was down to earth, helpful with drink recommendations, and the food was wonderful.  My group laughed that we would actually want to be her friend in real life.  I highly recommend Superica and ask for Joanna!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

XS1YWeiBPSepAChTucEaGw.text: My go-to brunch spot, whether it's pickup or to sit down. This place gets busy really quick so get there as soon as you can and early if possible! Made one mistake on a pickup once, I was double charged. The GM quickly fixed that and refunded the extra charge.

hKBcUw2q7VIrJ8Hm9b_VCw.text: I appreciate the business manager being active... but to be clear 3 stars is fair and nothing said changes what was originally presented by me. Dropping chicken in salt water, throwing short ribs in a cooker overnight, and making tortillas is not hard. If you google the difficulty to prepare the food Superica serves, relative to the price point, it is "designed to separate money from millennials." Maybe I'm just poor and can't afford to eat here.

8VunSrIbeQT7ZpkklrYp1Q.text: basic b$#@!. over priced and generic. It's not bad, just not good. Their "hot" sauce is as basic as their menu and atmosphere. This place should not have as many stars as it does. This place neither represents Texas nor Mexico. #whitewashed

2yw5qvdWtTYerw5DVmHw-g.text: I really go here for the atmosphere. The dining room is very expansive with high ceilings and great lighting.   The food is good but I feel a bit overpriced.  The drinks are very good.

nP07LWnJQCbea2xDnXa6Ug.text: I visited this restaurant over the summer when it first opened last year.  The service was not awesome, but the General Manager took care of myself and guest.  I would give this location a second try only because I feel like management was still working out some kinks with staffing, etc.  The food was pretty good and the drinks were awesome..not amazing though.  I am hoping things have improved over time since this restaurant has some great potential!

WuXgzjerDYBMI8uBtcYPxA.text: Awesome place. Food and service were tremendous. Best Mole poblano in Charlotte! Brunch looked pretty delicious too.

2UwF7FCf14DtWCx6L_3BUA.text: Great Tex mex place - they are working out the kinks as they just opened recently, but it seems promising!  We wanted to sit on the patio, but it wasn't available/open yet. The service was excellent once we tracked down a waiter (this is where it was apparent that they're new :) ) . . . The atmosphere is fun and light and open.  I ordered the OG margarita, and be warned - it's small but strong! We also opted for the queso fundido after reading reviews which was good, but I wish I would've gone with my gut and ordered guac. The queso was delicious but hard to eat since it's so thick.  I ordered the camaron tacos which were flavorful but a bit on the salty side. I would definitely come back!

TJ4qy6w0n5ZyxMtOqQyorA.text: The enchiladas here are absolutely incredible, the guac we had before dinner was so fresh. The horchata is freshly made in house. The service here is super friendly and didn't have to ask for anything, great anticipation of my needs. Jon the manager came by and ensured our complete satisfaction

nBueGmDfd-9CRh1Vww8xXw.text: Since moving to Charlotte in June from Texas - this was the only place that we found that served excellent Tex-Mex! We will definitely come back here and you should too! Our server Joanna was great - Ask for her if you end up here, you won't be disappointed.

xMAWhZDLP1RLoh_HTWin0g.text: Upscale tex-mex without the high prices. Outstanding food, ambiance, and service! Best in Charlotte.

JAC6HvEV5h9otV3LCn6ulw.text: The food was very good but inconsistent. For example, I ordered the pork tacos carbon and the first two were great but the third taco had half the contents of the first two. It just had a few pieces of pork, very dissappointing. Guess they forgot to fill that one, oh well. We also ordered a chicken fajita which was real good but only had onions and the tortillas that came with it were totally dried out. However, the enchiladas entree was prepared well. They give you unlimited rice and beans to share but they put it in really small plates which is barely enough for 2. In addition, the entree plates are so small you need to ask for extra plates just to hold the rice and beans. The service was excellent. Was getting really crowded at 630 so expect a wait on sat nites. We got in at 530 and were seated right away. Not sure if I'll go back.

sCIM3QZqWOLU5VbC5_UIxw.text: The atmosphere is great. The restaurant is large and airy. The service was excellent! Our waitress did a great job explaining menu items and gave us great recommendations. The food was by far the best Mexican (Tex-mex) I have had in Charlotte. We started with the five cheese queso and it was really good. The house made tortillas that came with it were amazing. I got a crispy shrimp taco and a vegetable enchilada (our waitress let me get them a la carte as i couldn't decide between the two) and both were super tasty. My friend got chicken enchiladas and said they were the best she has had. I got plantains for desert and they were good but could have used a little more of the sauce they drizzle on top. We will absolutely be back!

uFUJk7WyEaIWm4Z5_Kg3fg.text: AWESOME! Absolutely love the decor and ambiance. We sat at the bar however i was also interested in the table seating. Everything and everyone is very inviting and warm. The bartender Mandy is AWESOME. The food was fresh. Everyone was happy to be there. Highly recommend and can't wait to return.

1qf8kVp7qYFbTMK3LqwLSA.text: After moving from Texas I found it impossible to find good Tex Mex .... quo angels singing. This place is out of this world!!! Flavors are unreal! Do your self a favor and go now! Handmade tortillas make all difference, some of the best tacos I have ever had!

_O5HgwK3KfqA_SdWhkUdrA.text: This was probably wasn't the worst experience I've had here but I wasn't the best, they didn't know how to make a Texas marg. The margs were crappy. Like gross. The food was over priced for such a small amount that honestly didn't even taste good. The food was bland and over cooked. I was no impressed. I was excited for a place to eat near my home, but was soon mistaken for an over priced crap taco place.

0kDpMwKDey0uSOECdWrmqw.text: The fundito had great flavor and texture. The chips where light and salsa delicious. Tacos we had were OK but fajitas delicious. Great craft cocktails. Recommend the mescal old fashioned for sure. Our server Cory was fantastic!

p59vA0pVRqpR9Px5XthLmw.text: I would give it 10 Stars if I could. Easily my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I've been here 5 times since it opened and every time has been well worth the wait. Everything from the food to the drinks to the service to the vibes is on point.   The homemade tortilla chips with red and green salsas the second you sit down is great. The queso fundido with chorizo as an appetizer is an absolute must. They serve it with freshly made warm flour tortillas to make mini quesadilla wraps. The flavor is out of this world, to the point where it's almost indescribable. I've had the chicken and steak fajitas, brisket tacos, and beef enchiladas for dinner. All were amazing, but the fajitas were my favorite.   They have an outdoor seating area that they are not serving at yet. However, you can sit out there and enjoy some chips and salsa and margaritas as you wait for your table. Once they start seating and serving out there, this place will be even better.   I'd also like to call out the incredible service we have had there each time.  The main server is always cool, friendly, and on top of their game. It seems like they always have several backup servers as well that frequently stop by the table to clear plates, refill chips, salsa and margaritas, and make sure everything is all good.   Overall, as you can tell, I can't say enough positive things about this Atlanta based Tex Mex joint. The place is always packed and rightfully so. Every time we have visitors in town, we bring them here and they echo our reviews.

JinFOuuK9CyunN7ue6Z24w.text: Great Tex mex, very nice and friendly staff. I had the Huevos Rancheros and a El Frio for brunch. The sauces were top notch. Mo the bartender was very nice and provided super service. It was a team effort from all staff.

HuNbetFp0heLutQLys5R3Q.text: Delicious food with generous portions. My husband and I are both vegetarian, and our waitress was knowledgeable about the options and substitutions. My husband had the puffy tacos and I had the chili relleno, and we were pleased with our choices. I should add that the salsa is amazing too. We will definitely be going again.

3kOkmSLRFFsdzV80XXfgbg.text: I had lunch there recently andvitvwas very good.  The restaurant has s great look.  I will return soon.

Neo9Oi0yYtdAIZrNOWUG6A.text: Definitely go on a weekday early in the week, since it's brand new the weekends have been packed and I finally got a chance to go on my second try without waiting 2 hours. Their queso is AMAZING. twice Re-fried beans amazing, salad amazing, beef brisket tacos amazing. I had 0 complaints about the food and cocktails. It was decently fast as well. My waitress could have been a little more friendly but otherwise I had a great experience and will definitely be back.

VMteMBZZ2ylZt86YNVR4vA.text: O.M.G. This place is amazing!!! The queso fundido alone is worth traveling from Florida to NC for. The Chile relleno, margaritas and roasted tomato salsa were all on point. I will be back very soon.

KDiJVvNeCFvaY1RDzHjMOg.text: I just had lunch there. There aren't enough superlatives. Seriously. The food is to die for, and while the portions appear small at first, trust me- it's comfortably filling. The food is so fresh, flavorful, it borders on extravagant for lunch, nearly too elegant for simply being labeled Tex-Mex! But, it's just that they do it SO WELL, each little bit.The freshly roasted tomatillo salsa, the creamy avocado-cilantro salsa, the beans and rice brought out family style for the table (sufficient for just a few people at lunch!). The decor is artsy without being in your face. It's just tasty and tastefully done. The service- FANTASTIC! EVERY PERSON THERE was so pleasant, truly must love working there, and believe in the place. Seriously, this is a hidden gem, and it gets packed quickly. Mind you, I see that said in the other reviews as well, so I had thought maybe it was a small place. Noooooo, no no no. IT IS HUGE IN SIDE! And yet, at lunch, I think EVERY table was full, and the seats at the bar will filling up quickly! I did eye a special spot in front of the frozen margarita machine that looked promising for my next visit. Very attractive place, beautiful food, nice people. Don't quibble about the cost, it's worth it. Treat yourself!

pzj-R1ASKoZJgGcjapE8ag.text: Best Mexican food in Charlotte hands down!  The brisket barbacoa tacos are insanely good. Chicken fajitas are the best I've ever had anywhere. Great atmosphere!

uv7Xpxv6lixrJ5Lp4Qxq2A.text: The food and atmosphere are PERFECT! We started our girls night here and Joanna was the funnest and best server ever! I will definitely be coming back to try everything else on the menu! Thanks Joannna!

qHcs35tRC7EI2GzKGyybew.text: The food was amazing. My margarita was great. Service excellent. It was a touch pricey though.

w9eeEcLOqmvEpZF_bBA0Zw.text: One of the best dinners I've had in a while. It's a little pricey, but I thought the food was made exceptionally well. I ordered the el Lopez which is a lot of food, so maybe a good order to split.

sMdYmt18Y_aKF73i0qItWQ.text: Everything was incredible about this place. Environment, staff, service and food were above and beyond. Our waitress Sadie took great care of us and made sure our first experience would definitely have us back. Don't know what was our favorite part, the cowboy gringo hot sauce i put on everything or perfectly made OG Margarita. Thanks Sadie.

1jD6395DkDVIxJpWP-ltZQ.text: This joint is awesome. The last few times I have come to Asheville, I have hit this spot. Well-priced Mexican food in a super casual and convenient setting. Could not love it more. Gotta go.

vFcRmetE2NUMSRhvG5lhZw.text: Kim S was an amazing server. She was very attentive and realized that I did not care for my food just because it was spicy. She took it off for me! It was so sweet and made me feel better for struggling to eat great food. It was delicious but my tummy was not agreeing with the spice. I will def be back and will order non spicy food :)

KUukxOJx2Ko1FLPsvopU1A.text: Very impressed. Love the style and decor of this restaurant. We went on a Thursday around 7 and were seated right away. The bar was very busy. Seems like a popular after work place.  The food was good. The house made salsas were amazing! We also got he queso which was good but not the best I've ever had.  I got the steak tacos and they were excellent. My boyfriend had the chicken nachos and said were fine but nothing special.  Our friends got the enchiladas and were very happy with their choice.  Our server was Jessica and she was excellent. She answered all of our questions and offered great suggestions.

Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enchiladas

Ag2kDX9wxVQSmwBw6EkVhg.text: Great ambiance and food! A little pricey but quality ingredients and cool vibe. Good for groups or dinner and drinks.

DROLeA0vj7oampqTY5BQrw.text: Really solid Mexican/SouthWestern style food, tastes great, service and drinks are always on point, I just think that it costs a little much for what you're really getting.

TfCvh6gra-UnrUzuHRu07g.text: Calling all people who came from Texas, New Mexico or Arizona!  I have a major announcement.  When someone asks you "where can I go to get good Tex Mex in Charlotte?", you will no longer have to tell them to "go to the airport...where you can catch the next flight out to the South/Southwest".  Instead, you can drive on over to Superica to get your fix.  Let's discuss...  First off, the dishes have a slightly modern flare to them, but the authentic flavors are there.  I happened to enjoy the smoky salsa, while my boyfriend enjoyed the mild avocado based salsa.  They keep a stash behind the bar, so if you have a long wait, just ask for a basket and they will give it to you for free.  Next we got the Tampaquena and the Picadilla enchilada.  The entree comes with unlimited rice/beans.  Rice flavors were very authentic.  I had to try the puffy queso taco.  Totally not a traditional Tex-Mex dish, but it looked so funny that I had to try it.  Corn masa was made from scratch and on point.  Queso was super yummy.  Second, the place is huge and the decor certainly has a southwest feel to it.  Pictures and deer/horse sculls make you feel like you're in one big Georgia O'Keeffe painting, just more updated.  Third, don't skip the drinks.  They have a nice selection to choose from, and right now, their huge back patio is just for overflow waiting.  Until they get the back area organized for table service, grab some drinks and chips and relax with some friends while you wait for your table.  The real test of success or failure will be on their fajitas and Carne Guisada.  I'm excited and skeptical all at the same time, and I'll absolutely be back to give it try!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. The puffy queso taco
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Need enchiladas come with unlimited rice and beans
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tampaquena

ooDM2BA8hA53QeuzE3iWVg.text: My family and I tried to come here a few Saturdays ago for dinner: mistake!! Two hour wait and we were starving, so we went elsewhere. HOWEVER. The following weekend my husband and I were in the area running errands and were needing a good brunch (who doesn't need a good brunch..?!). So he looks online and says "hey Superica actually serves brunch starting at 10, let's go there!" no mistake there!!   At 10:06 am we were the only people in the restaurant (for a while- it picked up by the time we left). We were promptly served two salsas and they were each explained to us (one spicier, one smokier- both made in house). The waitress also informed us that while it was time for brunch, the entire menu was available as well.   We ended up getting queso with chorizo and splitting the steak and eggs. We both loved them!! The steak was cooked perfectly (medium rare), the eggs were wonderfully runny but not under done, and the peppers, onions, Mexican butter, and fixins were perfect. They even brought out a third salsa which complemented the breakfast expertly.  I'm the kind of customer that will enjoy a meal experience more if service is attentive and the decor is appropriate. Superica should know that both service and the restaurant as a whole were excellent. The decorations hit Tex-Mex spot on and they committed to the theme all the way throughout the space, including bathrooms. My husband and I both chatted with two waitresses who, even at 10 am, were bright and happy and had no problem carrying a conversation with us.   So 5/5 stars for food, decor, service. We will definitely be back!

16fzQ2HLQiCxgjiwUpYdyA.text: This is my favorite Tex-Mex spot in the QC. The exposed brick & endless natural light create a beautifully inviting & festive atmosphere.  Food & drinks are delicious--the pork carnitas taco al carbon are a must have!

ARhI7bQ50w7CVilMl_d1Ng.text: This place is really cool, and a huge space! We came here for a co-workers birthday and our waitress was wonderful. She surprised our co-worker with a tree leches cake.   I ordered from the lunch specials menu and it was a great deal and a good amount of food too.   My only complaint is that the tables are a bit too close together. We were seated between two other parties and we could easily hear their conversations and it made it awkward to slide out of the booth right beside strangers.

YeyU_wbeP3C7gjSvcaGWwQ.text: This place is interesting. The interior is definitely lovely and I like the bar, projector and overall ambiance. It was packed for a Tuesday night.   My server Mary was a pleasure and very knowledgeable. Her service was 5/5.   The menu is quite extensive and some items are very Tex mex while other would appear to be authentic. I ordered a ceviche which had aguachile in it. Agua Chile is an authentic ceviche style dish with pickled onions, cucumber and lime cured shrimp in a spicy lime juice. Their version of that was horrible. I didn't eat 1/3 of it. I also ordered queso fundido as an app. The queso fundido was quite good and I like that it came with tortillas in True Mexican style fashion.   For drinks I thought it was cool they carried authentic glass bottled "squirt." That stuff is good. I also ordered the OG margarita which was disgusting to me. It was a plain lime juice tequila and a lil agave. It was stern. Maybe I am a sissy / cuck but I prefer margs to be a tad sweeter.   What was also disappointing was how long the drinks take to get made. I waited an easy 10 minutes for each drink.   If not for the service this would have been a 2/5 max. The food is largely overrated but the establishment is in a prime location and I guess people like pseudo authentic Mexican and Tex mex!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ceviche

bz1an98pyMgy51_EKAioxw.text: Some of the best Tex mex I've ever had! The atmosphere was great- service was a little slow but it was still a great time. They even had a outside area.

TcB0t5Qc9zzY2u5Kp8UKzQ.text: There has been so much hype around this place and it definitely lives up to it! I can here on a weekday for their lunch special since I was in the area and sat down at the bar. Service was excellent! The place was comfortably full and starting to get their lunch rush in. The chips and salsa they give out are amazing! Definitely not your typical "Mexican" restaurant chips and salsa- the chips are airier and perfectly crunchy, paired well with the creamy avocado salsa or the other pepper salsa (can't remember what's in it but it's good!). I ordered the salad and the taco al carbon, which comes with rice and beans for their lunch special of $11.99. Such a huge portion! I definitely took half home. The salad is well dressed and perfect for the hot weather. I would have been fine with just the salad- that's how large the portion was. But let me tell you about the rice- it was to DIE for!! The best rice and beans I've ever had hands down! The taco al carbon wasn't what I expected it to be like but it tasted really good as well.

Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taco al carbon with rice and beans

cQHMkAS7Jce6cfoZLL9_Nw.text: I wasn't exactly stunned by Superica. Their vegetarian options are definitely limited, which is always a bummer. The only hearty options are the fajitas or enchiladas - the tacos are a joke (lettuce, tomato, cheese, and guacamole). And the cost is just nuts - $20 for fajitas! You could get cheaper food in NYC. That's just ridiculous.   The restaurant itself is aesthetically pleasing and the venue is pretty expansive. Since it's still a new spot, the wait can be long, so plan accordingly.  I'm curious to try their house cocktails, guacamole, and pancakes. But, not sure I'll be back considering I really don't find this place to be worth it (or that it fulfills the hype!).

MbyqCWnkI_O7SBMJp_Hzhg.text: I was torn on whether to leave four or five stars for Superica, as after much consideration, I'd prefer to award it 4.5 stars.  Since Yelp doesn't allow for that, I decided to go with the five.  It's a pretty new, happening restaurant in the rockin' South End area of Charlotte, where it seems like something new is popping up every other week.  Other reviews made me wary of the wait times (two hours?!) but we decided to forge on and try the place.  Charlotte's Mexican food scene is rather weak in my opinion, so we decided to tough out the 45-60 minute wait time we were given.  Fortunately, some other folks must have decided that the wait was longer than they were willing to bear, so we were seated after only about 30 minutes.  We were given freshly fried tortilla chips and two different salsas to try, one of which was a slightly smoky green salsa, the other a creamier, mild one made with avocado.  Both were tasty, and neither was terribly spicy.  We ordered chili con queso to start, and it was delicious.  The chili was more or less invisible, but overall it was tangy and delicious like good queso should be.  The few ribbons of cilantro sprinkled on the top were welcome and a nice bright herbal foil to the richness of the cheese.  For my entree I ordered tampiquena, a marinated grilled skirt steak served with cheese enchiladas and a fried egg.  The steak was expertly grilled to a medium rare and came with some sort of compound butter that while not advertised on the menu, was rich and delicious after melting all over the steak.  The fried egg had a perfectly runny yolk with crispy lacy whites, and the cheese enchiladas were delicious.  They were made with corn tortillas bursting with corn flavor, which I appreciated.  My wife ordered the veggie fajitas, and I was impressed that the server asked if she was a vegetarian, as the refried beans the entrees are served with are cooked in pork stock, and the rice is cooked in chicken stock.  She's not a vegetarian so it was fine, but good on them for asking.  Her entree was absolutely beautiful, with nicely charred cauliflower, cabbage, carrots, radishes, corn, sweet potato, and poblano peppers.  Everything about the preparation of our meal was well-executed.  The main issue was the service time.  We're leisurely diners but it took 90 minutes from start to finish, and it's not because we were loafing.  Several managers came by to apologize for the wait for our entrees.  In the end, they did us right by comping our entrees as well as one of my drinks, and they did so without a single complaint from us and without solicitation.  I get they're new and want to make a good impression to ensure repeat business, and they did exactly the right thing during our visit.  Our server, Raul, was excellent and had some great suggestions for our meal, so we made sure to take care of him when paying the bill.  The pacing would have knocked off a half-star, but since they made it right and were very conscientious our whole meal, they earned five stars and our repeat business.

oxwe32aUnjdTX9hD3lxAgQ.text: Love this place!! If you are looking for a dinner and drinks at a cool hangout place , this is it. Always buzzing with people and yet the food and drinks are always delivered on time. They have good options and their salsas are super tasty! Perfect for a get together with friends or even for a date

TtnWJNin75PrVwT2rsSI-w.text: So Superica quickly became my go to for good times & good vibes awhile back in the historic SouthEnd in the Queen City of Charlotte .. always a really warm reception from their staff for me & my buddies from the moment we walk in the door there at 101 West Worthington Ave.  While at the bar I highly recommend a frozen concoction called a "Lambo Margarita" .. it isn't on the menu but the bar staff is happy to pour you one! It consists of their frozen margarita with a shot of Grand Marnier on top .. sure it costs a little more but it's money well spent! Let me just say I needed a cigarette after my first Lambo and I don't even smoke ha!  As good as the drinks are .. the food is even better! The staff is very knowledgeable about every option on the menu. Feel free to ask questions .. I'm pretty confident they will have all the answers including ones concerning any issues with food allergies.  This Tex-Mex establishment deserves more than 5 Stars based on my experiences there. You owe it to yourself to give it a try.

JIU_InCWFs2KM9vCXGoKVw.text: Best thing about Superica? ..the kinda cool bathroom doors..  Wow this place is overrated beyond compare!   Yes, bar tenders were friendly and fun-- but, when you look at quality of food in comparison to the price-- ya. No.   "Caramelized  onions" were really five cuts w a tiny bit of brown..  No green peppers in my fajita.   Hot drop something drink? -- cool; it's cava and one slice of cucumber. Not worth $11.  And topping on the cake was that my $30 shrimp fajitas-- I HAD TO PEEL MY OWN TAILS OFF AND THEY WERE SOOOOO DRY- way over cooked!   And, didn't event come out sizzling -- just a disappointment for that fajitas experience. Oh, also not enough lettuce  !   Won't be back unless I have to..

nRmofyhDf4CMfq9uOUJTcQ.text: Best Tex Mex in CLT (and we're from LA)!  Lovely OG margaritas and the Chicken enchiladas with mole sauce are fabulous.  My husband loves the shrimp tacos.  One night our dishes came out cold but staff promptly brought out fresh hot entrees and to our surprise our meals were comp'd.  Really not necessary but such a wonderful gesture.  Thank you Superica...We'll definitely be back!!

qSCWfjlXMwp4LEMeZP-C4w.text: Holy Mole, this place was great! I don't know what I was expecting, but I think I stayed away from Superica because I thought it was going to be pretentious? I was wrong, I'll admit it. It takes a lot for me to admit that, but I was.   We arrived at Superica on a Sunday night, pretty early. Easy to find and lots of street parking around the corner, we walked in and were greeted with... a family environment? Huh? Yes, Yelp readers, Superica is host to a fantastic Sunday night meal with the grandparents *and* grandchildren. We were seated quickly (Superica does not take reservations) and tended to quickly.   The menu is small, and relatively sophisticated, but doesn't shy away from mexican/tex mex favorites like quesadillas and tacos. We were served with chips and salsa, both of which were freshly made. There were two types of Salsa, neither of which were really spicy, but both of which were intensely flavorful. And best of all, it's free. Free refills too!  For the main course, I ordered enchiladas, which come with two. Anytime I see Mole on a menu, I'm intrigued, because good mole takes a LOT to make. It takes ingredients, and time. And I kind of use it as a test. I ended up ordering one Mole and one Chicken Suizas, just in case the mole didn't work out.   It did. Wonderful mole they've got here - not super sweet and has a great smoky, peppery, roasty back flavor. Very complex, very very well done. Bravo, guys. The manager even came over at the end of the meal to chat with us and alongside helping The Lady pack up her leftovers, he actually brought us more chips and salsa that he had pre-packaged up for us. Talk about service!   Between the service and the quality of the food here, Superica is definitely a place I'll recommend to anybody! I didn't even think the prices were horrendous (yes, it was more expensive than you usually pay, but not outrageously so!). Go see for yourselves :)

LbWkBwLUDO9Pmu-vw4wa6A.text: Superica saved the snow day. The restaurant wasn't busy when we arrived which was around 7:30pm. We were seated quickly and received a tequila and regular menu. Me and my friend both ordered chicken fajitas and she ordered guacamole as an appetizer. The guacamole was just okay to me. I think it was missing salt but my friend loved it. We also received complimentary fresh chips and 2 salsas. I lovedddddd the avocado salsa and she like the fire roasted salsa because it had a kick. Although the wait was a little longer than expected, it was well worth the wait. I even had enough for leftovers. Lil Kim was our waitress and she was awesome. I can't wait to go back when I'm craving fajitas.

Cx7-eQpe1TAAMCuZzm5e4A.text: So good.  Seriously... SO GOOD! We went about 5:30-6:00 before it got really crowded.  We mentioned that it was our first time there and they gave us a few option for a free side or app.  My margarita was also perfect.  It's a bit pricey but worth it.

U6EbjsRzQSAKzKd7OzsiIA.text: $11.99 lunch special is a great deal. portions bigger than expected, quality of everything pretty high.  Great chips and salsa included.  Cool place, very friendly people.  Parking a bit of a pain, but found free street parking a couple blocks down.  May be tougher at night.

4c-THZW7TEaCVpD26HfI2Q.text: Just underwhelming.  Kitchen needs some retaining and someone overseeing and correcting mistakes as they come out of the kitchen.  The send back to fix process is annoying as hell and hard on servers.  The good: Atmosphere Service was friendly Mostly tasty flavors in the food  The bad: Parking Lukewarm hostess Server was too busy to do a GREAT job Management on floor, visible but not helping Kitchen not paying attention to food going out Portion size Price for portion Slow kitchen  I ordered the flautas, there were literally two.  They were oily as hell and the kitchen forgot my guacamole.  Our server was hustling and by the time I got my guacamole, my two pitiful $13 flautas were cold (and still oily.)  My husband ordered tamale and eggs with a side of beans.  He got the worst plated dish I saw the entire time I sat there (over 40 mins waiting for food.). It looked like a Jimmy Dean version of a tamale.  Half empty, hard, melted soggy cheese on top in a plate swimming with refried beans.  They forgot his eggs.  He ate it because by then he was starving and he too had to wait until our server got his eggs.  His breakfast was supposed to come with fresh tortillas, he never got a single tortilla.  The menu says no charge for refried beans, we were charged $3.  We paid it and left, but it's another "wtf??"  Just....messy.  Not pulled together.  Not focused on making sure the plate is right, looks yummy.  Then the server should be checking it before she brings it out, she knows TAMALE AND EGGS HAS EGGS! Instead of letting us find the issues, the people being paid to work should be looking to fix and never let us see there was a problem.  The table behind us ordered one order of fajitas to share and waited over 30 mins, they must have asked our server three times if their food was coming.  It's not servers fault, it's kitchen and management fault.  We won't be back.

4vKd2ZERXYgFGk9jJ-HeEA.text: MOST INCREDIBLE TEX MEX! If you're looking for good salsa, better margs, & great vibes check out this spot. The enchiladas were awesome, especially the vegetable! If you double down on the apps & drinks like we did, just one enchi would be enough. Recommend x 10!

yeu8ghX8QqLA_3JGADyGKA.text: I really struggle with this review.  I want to love it so much, but....  This place is like a ChuckECheese for  uppity housewives and their tool boyfriends. pGpoeQue6sTh9DnETxB_7g.text: I was hesitant to go to this place because I had heard that it was super expensive. We went with a group of five. And like most places now is very noisy because of cement floors and no roof. But we had wonderful drinks with wonderful service and the puffy tacos are just amazing. You must try them when you go. MMpnU67F-CiQCUAtQgfJuA.text: After a 1.5 hour wait.. It wasn't worth it. While waiting I ordered a frozen margarita and there was no alcohol. Well at least I couldn't taste it. They were so packed and there is not a waiting area so we sat outside on the steps. Good thing the weather cooperated that day or I would have went home. Got to the table there are a couple of salsa they put down. One is avocado based. Which I really enjoyed. The second was spicy. I didn't taste that one as I don't like spicy food but my friends enjoyed it. We had about 3 servings each. We also order the queso fundido and when I tell you this is a must have. It was good. I should have stopped there. But I didn't. I ordered chicken fajita and was disappointed. The chicken was flavorless and was a little soft. I didn't finish it. I gave the rest to my boyfriend at home who eats anything and he wasn't impressed. needless to say the almost 2 hour wait for weak drinks, good cheese and flavorless chicken. I heard their brunch was good so I may give that a try.

XIfAUGa6FRkD4Nu78GxgLw.text: What was my biggest take away after my first trip to Superica? I'm just gonna come out and say it but this place is clearly Mexican food for white people...I mean just look around the packed restaurant at at the patrons at 6:30pm on a Friday and its very obvious that this is where the squares (I'm bringing that word back from the crypt in this case) of Charlotte go to get their international cuisine fix. Its basically the sit down full serve answer to Chipotle. But at least here the chips and salsa are complimentary (and really good). The chips you might seem familiar if you ever got the chips and salsa from Chili's super thin and super crispy. The two salsas, an avocado (tomatillo) salsa verde and a roasted tomato salsa, will leave you feeling little need for a starter of guac. We ordered the whole fried snapper to share which came with unlimited refried beans and rice. The snapper, which was presented beautifully didn't quite deliver on taste. My friend and I agreed, almost simultaneously as we took the first bite, that it was very fishy tasting, especially for a snapper and it was underseasoned. The salsa verde they had it laying in had taken away most of the crispiness of the top half of the fish and sogged up the bottom half. The salsa was a bit of a throwaway for me, didn't offer much aside from wetness and when put up next to the ones served with the chips, the one on the fish didn't stand a chance. The tortillas served with the fish however were great and homemade, the beans were delicious too, but melt a bunch of cheese on top of anything and it will be delish, the rice totally forgettable. Want a good whole fried fish, get the one off the authentic menu at Azteca. We also got some frozen margaritas which were excellent, not very sweet with housemade mix, just as it should be. The service was a high point, friendly while not being overbearing. Bottom line is I doubt I would come back here for the food cuz as good as the service was, if the food isn't great what is the point? I MIGHT come back for the drinks and chips if I find myself in the area. Thing is, I PERSONALLY see no reason for a place like this when I can get better versions of nearly everything on the menu at a better price at a local or family owned joint. But then again I don't think I'm the kind of person this spot is really catering to..

fbAf0FLpdqp-u8gVLLebKw.text: Very good salsas and fresh chips! Whole snapper very good! Drinks are way too small and expensive. Stick with the beer. Usually over an hour wait! Not a huge meanie but tacos are good

r8SpSZEJfNyVoJi0BwWNZw.text: Firstly the food is an absolute 5 stars. I've tried the ceviche, the guacamole, the fajitas and the chorizo queso dip and all were very good. The service however was an abomination. If it was based alone on service I would give it 1 star. It was my friends birthday and we had a party of 8. We all are very chill people and rarely ever complain - all of us have been servers so we are more than understanding of the position but this was beyond unacceptable. The drinks took 20 minutes per round at times, we had empty drinks pretty much the entire time, it took almost 2 hours to get our food and a couple peoples order was wrong. I could maybe give some leeway if the restaurant was slammed but it was a Wednesday and it was at half capacity. The manager took over the table and the server was very apologetic so that made up for it but it was pretty disappointing especially since it was someone's birthday dinner. I will be returning because of the food so I am hoping this is a one off...

EwOPu36x07vU_1PLeCCwaA.text: Average food that is overpriced. I'd go here more for the drinks and ambiance than the food. oAN-r0ly42y62acMxlEdyg.text: Love this restaurant.  Have had brunch twice now and finally came for dinner this evening. We all loved what we ordered and two of us are vegetarian and found delicious options. Dishes came out hot and exactly how we ordered them. Bonus was we had the best waitress. I think her name was Katelyn (Caitlyn)?  Did not get spelling of her name but was told by one of the hosts that she was brand new.  She was amazing and made dinner even better.  Patiently went through all our questions regarding drinks and description of food options.  In addition she was funny, and knowledgeable and clearly loves her job. If the manager reads this, give that girl a raise. She is a keeper...rare if ever that I'm happy with waitstaff.  Just ask my husband.  Anyway...thanks for a fun evening that included yummy food and great drinks!

cDpflD7VqKdUm_i6n-TEcQ.text: Really good food and cool revamped spot. Location is perfect for light rail riders and uptown residents.   The salsas brought to the table were fresh and full of flavor. One was toasted tomatillos and the other a creamy cool avocado  salsa. Chips always make or break a Mexican place for me and this we're perfectly cooked, light and then with the perfect amount of salt.  The lunch menu has plenty of options and some make a combo choices. Everything came out hot and the rice and beans were served family style.   5 stars and just need them to open a spot in Bally

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

SpPIgyFYh2BY3PKmSuPBvw.text: Does Superica live up to the hype? In my experience, I say yes. Sometimes Charlotte goes ape-shit over mediocre places, so I walked in really not expecting to be writing a 5 star review right now. I have to admit, I was pretty impressed.   My friend and I came in for lunch on Saturday. We went before noon because we weren't sure just how busy it would be. The smiling hostess sat us immediately. Chips and two housemade salsas were delivered to the table. One was a smoky red sauce, the other a green avocado sauce. I thought both were great. I kept going back and forth on which one was my favorite.   We started with queso fundido (added chorizo) and michaladas (beer, tomato, and lime juice). I'm from Nebraska, so I'm a huge red beer fan.  And of course, I had to do the infamous cheese pull. We ordered Picadillo enchiladas and chicken suiza enchiladas. We opted to add a puffy queso chicken tinga taco for $4. I thought everything was delicious. I like that they do the beans and rice family style and it's bottomless. I thought everything was delicious. I loved the chili gravy on the picadillo enchiladas. The side of green sauce that came with the puffy taco was amazing. I would put that on everything (different than the salsa).   Note: they have an $11.99 lunch special menu Monday-Friday, you pick two items (nachos, enchilada, hard shell taco, salad, soup, taco al carbon).  The space is beautiful. I didn't really realize how large it was (TWSS). Our server was training and we were only his 2nd table. So, shout out to Caleb. I thought he did a terrific job. People keep asking about parking, drive around and look for street spots. There's also a paid lot across the street.   Superica, welcome to Charlotte. I'll definitely be putting you in my eating rotation.

4ui54lwWYFKyUSpxYGVHPQ.text: Superica became a favorite spot of mine when it first opened. The food was delicious! We always had the Queso and Tamal appetizers. The tamale was AMAZING and tasted the most authentic. Their unlimited twice refried beans were delicious as well. It was great up until 6 months ago when the menu began changing. The Fajita sides changed. Unlimited beans and rice ended. Pricing increased as food quality declined.   We went for brunch on 1/27 and had a disappointing experience. The tamale recipe changed, our meals arrived cold and service was slow. The server did a good job handling the situation though.  It's a good place to try for new people. Foodie regulars... it has changed. The chips and salsas are still delicious though!

29losDBx44SAR5tKLJsCFw.text: Another great lunch at Superica! I suggest the lunch special if you go at that time because you're able to choose two different types of food so your able to satisfy your curiosity. The free chips come out warm and the green salsa is great. I could eat the chips all day!

Q3GVzyoZfwIW4CwO-jRd6w.text: I think your staff needs to be trained better. After stopping in to try and get a table, when it's sunny outside, your hostess refused to seat me inside. There were people sitting on the patio, pictured here so I don't understand why. Her reason was that the weather was bipolar. Seems like a legit reason to turn away business when there aren't any rain clouds in the vicinity. Will go where business appreciate their customers from now on. Only giving 2 stars because of the good service I previously received.

SbWAlOmAi43wg09s6F4D5Q.text: Superica has the best cheese dip I have had in Charlotte! However it falls short of the quality of food for the price.   I think the place is more focused on appearance from a food perspective than taste. I order the brisket  street style tacos and cheese dip for the appetizer.   Everything in the meal looked nice but I it was lacking something that I couldn't put my finger on but I realized the better Mexican places marinate their meats longer. The meat (brisket) was just good not great.   The atmosphere is the nicest thing here. I would definitely go back for the cheese dip alone but the prices seem a little steep for the quality. I would choose Cantina 1511 over this place based on price point.   This place is definitely worth a try though. Happy eating!

I8AB61gnx1JJq_JyBO9H9Q.text: We love love this place! The atmosphere, service, and food are wonderful. The staff is extremely accommodating...we just hosted a family dinner of (20+ people) there for my daughters second birthday and we couldn't have had a better experience. They even made a card and had all the staff sign it for her... it's a regular spot for us...we crave the tacos and the OG!

__0SGdnT__-ZCXNlH_ig2w.text: Similar to the other restaurants in the Design Center, Superica is a great restaurant to head to for a great, urban, upscale vibe with friends to enjoy cocktails and good food. Elevated Tex Mex is hard to come by and Superica delivers with delicious salsas, great margaritas, and tender, juicy fajita dishes. The tortillas are warm and soft and pair great with any dish on the menu.  The brunch is under-the-radar as well with chorizo and egg dishes and a giant pancake on the menu. It's extremely filling so don't plan for anything active right after but it's a great change of pace compared to any other brunch cuisine in Charlotte!  The only negatives here are that the food can be extremely salty at times to the point that the chips are inedible and we've also found that the margaritas sometimes fall well short of being filled to the top of the glass.

miexh_fCt9S2TuJMPhbYuA.text: Worth the hype (and that's coming from someone who is a harsh Mexican food critic having lived in So Cal, Tucson and Dallas)! We came here for dinner with another couple and were not disappointed! There was a 45 minute wait (to be expected for a Saturday night around 7) but they were very organized when it came to gathering our information and texting us when our table was about ready. We grabbed margaritas at the front bar and headed to the side patio while we waited. My skinny, spicy margarita was delicious and our friends enjoyed their classic margaritas as well.   Once seated, we were quickly greeted by our server and another employee who dropped off chips and described the two house salsas to us (both delicious!). We ordered guacamole and traditional queso to start and both were great. Various entrees were ordered by the table but the beef and shrimp tacos really stood out. Very well done and solid portions for the price. I also love that they serve rice and beans family style for the table.   Great atmosphere, food and drinks. The patio will be awesome once the weather cools down a bit too! Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front room/bar

Si6FQo3ttyfo1i2Kz-0U0Q.text: Excellent Tex-Mex food! We had a wonderful dinner with six people, our delightful appetizer of the queso was the group's favorite. Based on the server's recommendation we had the queso with three--guacamole, chorizo, and pico. Everyone loved it!! It was the perfect mix of savory and creamy goodness!   (I want to return for the queso fundido extra cheese pull next time.)  They had good beer selection and good margaritas too!  I liked my entree--the puffy tacos. They are unusual texture and kind of awkward to eat but very flavorful. I had the sampler of tacos( ya get three)--chicken morita, beef and veggies. They are small but filling. I think they're a great quality, the chicken was my favorite.  My husband liked the tacos al pastor and said they're awesome. Our friends liked the fajitas for one and the enchiladas suizas entrees too. We also tried the tres leches cake and it was delicious! It was creamy and sweet!  The pay parking lot across the street was our parking spot. It's $5.  They have a big crowd at dinner so we went early around 5:45 pm on a Saturday to beat the wait. I'm glad we tried the queso and I want to try another visit.

TuIxsVXjMguT1J-Bw_2r5A.text: So we read on City Notes that this was the #1 place for Mexican food, and they were right lol!  So tasty.  Loved the guacamole, and the patio. But the best thing of all its seriously the pancakes! Lord Jesus, they have them on the weekend for brunch!

84UZRaDoRyFXK3yeyaC5eg.text: Food (yay, meh, nay): yay Ambiance (yay, meh, nay): yay Service (yay, meh, nay): meh  Would I go back: yes  Add'l notes: tacos come on corn tortillas unless you specifically ask for flour

dpwSIqV02f9yCGne5ttalg.text: Came here on a Sunday for brunch with some friends. The wait was an hour, so we left and came back when our table was ready. There wasn't much room around the bar to hang out and wait for our table. Started with a spicy margarita. Their chips and salsa are addicting. The chips are perfect! I ordered off of the regular menu instead of the brunch menu which I wish I hadn't. Should have ventured out for something unique. I ended up getting the El Pastor tacos which were pretty good. Not the best tacos I've ever had, but the pork belly was pretty decadent. Will definitely hit this spot up again when I'm craving tex-mex.

x-NQdH-xEuUe-vaphvlJzA.text: Expected better honestly. Charlotte has a pretty stout brunch scene, and this, sadly, didn't compete. Our drinks took just over 15 min from order, with the place at about 15-20% capacity. The Huevos Rancheros (far and away my favorite breakfast dish worldwide) were bland and couldn't stand on their own. The table salsas were delicious and helped the dish out. Service was prompt (not our servers fault the drinks took so long) and the ambience is great, was just hoping for better food. The 1/3 of a sausage link for $5 was the highlight. Will have to come back and try dinner, from what friends have told us it's delicious. Just didn't hit the mark this time.

TOhnhueJCFYfrScAtT5Ylg.text: I am so happy that this opened up in walking distance to my office! Street parking only and it's metered from 9-5PM I think there is a pay-lot next to it, but like I said, I walk, so not so sure.  Atmosphere: Nice, laid back design, they have a bar and different styles of seating (tables, banquettes/booth style) So ideal for small or large parties. Music isn't too loud, you can have a conversation across the table without shouting. They play some weird nature videos / slides from a projector on a screen - funky and goes well with the tex-mex eclectic vibe of the place.  Food: I still have to try this place for dinner and brunch. BRUNCH! the menu looks amazing!!!! Micheladas calling my name. But I always come here for lunch at work. So during peak lunch hours! Service and wait have always been quick and on-point.  The table gets free chips and 2 styles of salsa, spicy tomato and a refreshing avocado/cilantro one. I always mix them together. They do taste delicious separately. too   Best deal is the lunch menu, and you may think the items are small, they fill you up. You get to pick two items and it comes with a family style rice and beans to share, but unlimited refills.   So far I have tried on the lunch menu  Hard Shell Taco -Chicken Tinga...taco shell seems fried, it's extra crispy and i like it! Chicken is well seasoned  Enchilada  - Chicken Suizas...sauce and the soft shell mix well with the seasoning of the chicken - Chicken Verde...creamy sauce and different seasoning on this chicken then the suizas, I LIKE THIS ONE BEST!  Taco Al Carbon - Pork Carnitas...delicious marinated pork belly...MY GO TO HERE! - Steak...done medium, juicy flavors  Soup (portion is larger than your average cup, the soup itself fills me up!) - Tortilla Soup...delicious that brings me back to being in TX - Pozole Verde...love regular pozole, verde is a creamy version of it. Just as good, with pork belly bits in it!  Yes, this tex-mex place is worth the hype. Coworkers and I do the walk perhaps 1-week here in this recent heat wave. It's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sign along street
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pozole Verde and chicken tinga Taco on taco-tuesday!

Pr_DhBsnNCqDxp-jA44DFA.text: Have you ever had an ant farm when you were little and all the ants were doing a job in Harmony. This place is it. We always wanted to know what was going on at this place as folks would come in and out with big joker smiles as they left. No disrespect to the amazing staff as they were in perfect harmony moving doing a specific job to keep the food coming out hot fresh and with a smile. The ambiance is busy not too flashy but the food will kick you into next week. Bold rich flavors that remind me of True authentic Mexican flavors from San Diego. Well done our server was spot on even with a full house took excellent care of us. The fire roasted salsa is a winner as you can put that on a stale rotten egg and still be something special. We tried the enchiladas that were full flavored and amazing. The rice is just as dire as the salsa.

l3YJfamNupY0gWPHNfkYfg.text: Megan was able to go over the menu in detail with us and gave us great recommendations on food. We had the chorizo queso, shrimp tacos and it was delicious! Also she made the cocktails too how cool! They were so yummy!

iKohmfWbJB1-ZVCqXbnsKw.text: Really enjoyed this place, atmosphere was fun. Food was good, large portions for sure. And margaritas were even better. Give this place a try!!

YYXxb1bXmmYQqcsdD4l5oA.text: Not your average Tex-Mex!  I was so pleasantly surprised by how the hype was on point for this place.  We went on a Friday night, which we thought was a mistake but it turned out great-the wait for 2 people at 7 pm was only about 30-45 minutes, and ended up only being about 20 (though I suspect that wasn't the case for Jeni's, which had a line around the block when we were seated at the restaurant, and even longer when we left).  We ended up walking to a bar while we waited, and the hostess kindly said that they'd hold the table for a reasonable amount of time as long as we responded to the text telling us our table was ready, which was great and surprising for a busy Friday night.    Service was great, our waitress took the time to tell us the favorites, including the drink specials.  Although the Matador is a popular choice, I didn't like it.  The skinny girl marg was better.  At one point I think our waitress accidentally put in an order for chorizo queso for us, but we ate it anyway and it was DELICIOUS.  Along with the 2 salsas they give you, and the house made hot sauce, that was basically a meal in and of itself.  Fajitas Mixtas were also amazing, and the butter sauce that comes with it was the icing on the cake.  Cannot wait to go back and try it again!

3FM1iw55f_Fv-kZdcjcaiw.text: Loved this place!!! Everything we tried was amazing. Salsas, guac, quest, multiple tacos.....def have to go here! You'll be glad you did. And the restaurant is very large so you shouldn't have to wait!

mnjp2rIsMdz9ESO8Z4kE3A.text: Worth the wait! Everything here was amazing and the location is very cool as well. This is nicer than your average Mexican place so be prepared to spend a little more (it's beyond worth it).

wGnTr-L4JM5KrUfpyNbSaw.text: A little pricey but good bang for your bucks. Be prepared to have a wait time almost any time you go!

0x8DXLaoUqh3grbgZzZhjQ.text: Everything I have had has been great! Tacos , brunch, fajitas, margs, service are awesome. Highly recommend this place!

qsgeUkUHjxqp6km5TO7fVA.text: I thought this new place was pretty good. Big enchiladas fan and these hit the mark. Rice and beans were average. Will have to go back when I am not pregnant for the margarita

q-TljREVkjWXSl6mlHytlw.text: I checked out Superica on their opening day, and honestly expected it to be pricy with small portions. I was very wrong! The menu is more expensive than most Mexican restaurants, but it turned out to be a steal for what you get. The extras that come with meals make a $11.99 lunch special more than worth it.  You get chips and two salsas to start out with. They're free! The chips were crispy, fresh, and plentiful. The two salsas were a green tomatillo/avocado (fresh, light, tangy) and a more traditional cantina salsa (with just a little heat). You can turn up the heat to your liking with their addictive house hot sauce.  Lunch specials give you the option of two items for $11.99. Ther are enchiladas, soft and hard tacos, soup, salad, and more to choose from. I opted for a beef enchilada with a brown chili gravy and chicken mole enchilada. Both were divine - a serious step up from your run of the mill Tex Mex, and a decent size too. On top of that, you get bottomless refried beans (which are made with pork, btw) with melted cheese, and rice. If you enjoy it as much as I did, you'll end up mixing the leftover enchilada sauces with the beans and the rice, and using a few chips to scoop! There really isn't any need for the beans and rice to be bottomless if you are eating by yourself, because they are both huge sides served in separate dishes than your entree (they may be shared when eating in groups, but I was by myself).   I will certainly be putting Superica in my regular rotation for lunch. The staff were welcoming, friendly, and attentive. And the service was very fast (in and out in 30 minutes). The food is step above what you'd expect from most Tex-Mex joints, and the servings aren't chintzy - you will leave very full! And this was on opening day, which was impressive!

DyXVQUfJe-kDvrryyqmprQ.text: High 4 stars for this one. We had a few of their margaritas and it's the only thing holding back from a full 5 star review. Their OG marg was pretty standard but sub par compared to some of our favorite Mexican spots. The Matador was better in flavor, but all around their margs lacked in the strength department. The food and service was excellent. You'll get Tracy if you're lucky. All the host staff and managers we encountered were well trained and friendly but Tracy was our server for the evening and was superb. We tried the queso, guac, chicken verde enchiladas and carnitas tacos and everything was delicious.

rxY8GKi9ZRgSLPDp3b6wlw.text: Excellent service, chicken suizas was fantastic, fundito was delicious. My only gripe is the price. But since I'm not from the area, I don't know if it is overpriced compared to other local businesses.

q_0FwkZUWBq5Y3i38WLNCA.text: Visited Superica on Saturday with a group of friends. The food was fantastic, I loved the family style sharing of sides. I got the enchiladas and they were great. I'm giving a 4 because service was slow and took forever to get a table (due to slow service, I believe). We sat forever untill our waitress actually took our orders. Will definitely return as I would assume service will get better the longer they are open

emOS9TFB6R0WuapiA71lJA.text: Chips and salsa are great, not your regular. Chips are the thin and crispy type and 2 types of salsa are served. Appetizer Fondita was great!! Would order again and again. Appetizer came out very fast. We ordered the carne asada and was enough to share for 2. It took a little longer than normal to come out. It was more like a T-bone steak than a thin skirt steak. The flavors were good and we asked for extra tortillas as the tortillas were very good! Unlimited rice & beans were also served with the meal. The price is higher than you would expect for Mexican/Tex Mex but the food was very delicious and a great addition for Charlotte.

g8VV8gwV3g6hAHgQtRnVvA.text: I have been here twice, once for brunch and the second time with our dinner club. Brunch was definitely better as Friday night the place was packed! The food was still good but it was sitting around waiting for the big order to get delivered to the table. Will definitely go again. Be prepared to wait. Sure wish they had call ahead.

7e6znp6NRbdesRF7bfX2wQ.text: Such a great concept! Loved the interior and freshness of the food! Great service and not a long wait for a Thursday night! Staff was friendly and all. Food was made pretty efficiently and guacamole was . The ONLY thing I really didn't like was how expensive everything was... $24-$30 for fajitas?? That's a little steep in my opinion. Also, you can't order individual tacos, which is a bummer for people like me who can eat a WHOLE meal. Will definitely go back, but split my meal with someone next time!!:)

7xBfyV1Q334EpQHrSr1ajA.text: After stopping once for lunch and leaving after looking at the $18 salad menu, I got talked into going for BRUNCH. The prices were a little more reasonable and the food was almost great.   The chips and two salsas served gratuitously were really delicious. The chips were thin and crispy. The green salsa had a bit of heat but also that tomatillo tartness balanced with creamy avocado. My table mates enjoyed the chipotle salsa more than I, simply because I'm not a fan of the smokiness of chipotle. But I could tell it was well done.   The HORCHATA was the best I've ever had. I sucked it down too quickly. This should not be missed.   My HUEVOS RANCHEROS (minus the beans to make it vegetarian was adequate. Would've been a bit bland without the green salsa but fortunately could add that. It was technically executed well, though. Just didn't have a ton of flavor on its own.   My mom loved the BBQ BRISKET SANDWICH and kept stuffing herself with it, despite being super full. Sister has had the CHILE RELLENO multiple times and loves it every time.   The plain QUESO was also pretty good. Different than at your standard Mexican restaurant but flavorful and nice.   The interior is gorgeous. Service was ok. A bit slow and drawn out but that was ok. We were enjoying ourselves. The only thing I don't like is how pretentious it feels with the attitudes and pricing. But the food really is pretty good and the ambience is great.

RhNcgherM6iroEddnw9JUA.text: Have been looking forward to visiting Superica since the opening. Leaving the airport we discovered that Supercia was a mere 5 miles away so we set GPS and boom arrive just before the crowds around 4:45.  Dining room is expansive with bar seating up front, a large dining hall and outdoor area.    Not many local beers on tap and actually only a handful of draft beers offered at all, but they seem to more bent on offering custom drinks and have an extensive tequila menu. Wife went with Tommy's margarita while I opted for a bottle of Modelo. Service was on point with fresh chips and 2 great salsa's brought out at seating. Both salsas were kick ass with one being a roasted tomato and the other being a Verde.   For dinner expect to spend some bucks if you opt for a house specialty. We were not starving so we opted for the puffy tacos with chicken ( 3 to an order) and the tamales from the app menu.  Tacos were good but not sure if I would order them again. The tamales are a good start with 3 to a serving and served with a side of mole sauce. Entree's are accompanied by rice and beans served family style. Beans are covered in cheese and rice was tasty with corn nibbles and peppers.  I look forward to bringing friends here as the atmosphere is certainly conducive to larger groups.  Food: 4 Sporks Service:  5 Sporks Atmosphere: 4 Sporks  Local Beer: 2 Sporks Value: 3 Sporks

-0RuA1SlZPu0Qt5xMr5u1g.text: First timer and I definitely recommend especially for brunch! I love how open the area is and the unique decor of a rustic spanish vibe. Our server was very nice and pleasant. They probably have the best chips and salsa I've ever had. One of the salsas was an avocado base. I ordered the pork belly tacos and they were AMAZING with the perfect hint of spice. My friend ordered a pancake stack and it was literally the biggest pancake i've ever seen. It was 14 inches long and definitely the best pancake we've ever had. My other friend ordered an omelette with beans and cheese and it was tasty! I'm not much of a bean eater but this exceeded my expectations. I will be coming back!

IjnOrEmFQmx9Ce6CVSCwZQ.text: If this post was solely about the food, it would be five stars for sure. However, we entered the establishment and were told we had a 1 hour and 15 min wait. We tried the bar area but no luck. So we went outside to the patio. We were told that we would be able to have chips and salsa and drinks only. We waited 25 mins on our chips and salsa even though we had servers walk by us numerous times and no one took our order. Once we flagged down a server and placed drink orders- we waited 49 mins but got no drinks. We finally went inside to enjoy our food and our server was kind and helpful. The food was flavorful and filling. Best refined beans ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

UI_HdDoUqv5xGfI2-lFYUQ.text: This is really a 3.5 rating, but more of a 3 than 4. After much hype, a group of friends and I decided to give Superica a try. For a group of 10, the wait was 2 HOURS, even when we said we would be fine with 2 tables of 5. To say I was HANGRY is an understatement. Once we were seated, things began looking up. Our waitress, Samantha, was amazing! She constantly tended to us and removed plates, cups and etc. from our table as quickly as possible to ensure we would be comfortable.   We ordered a plethora of appetizers to share including the Guacamole, Queso, Chicken Fajita Nachos and Campechana de Mariscos. I highly recommend the Queso, definitely best Queso I've ever had! I also really love their house made sauces for the complimentary chips. For dinner, I tried the Gulf Red Snapper and the Gulf Shrimp and Snapper Ceviche. LOVED the Gulf Red Snapper and the presentation was amazing! They deep fried a giant red snapper and simmer it under verde sauce and avocado. We devoured the entire fish! Market price was $34 I believe, which I thought was a good value. Sadly, the ceviche was extremely underwhelming. It lacked flavor and the shrimp/Snapper were overpowered by the ingredients in the dish. Strange that it was both overpowering and lacked flavor? While our overall experience was enjoyable, most of the dishes didn't live up to 2 hours worth of expectation. Also, prices are pretty high for a Tex-Mex spot (in my opinion). Not sure I'd come back for that kind of wait time, but was worth the try.    Recommend: 1. Queso 2. Red Snapper  Don't Recommend: 1. Campecchana 2. Ceviche   Heads up - a good amount of the dishes had quite a kick to them. While I love spicy food, I know a lot of people do not. If you're sensitive to spicy food, I would recommend informing your server.

BrkMPFsDRqtfwxt95Cqbhw.text: On theIr game today I'll tell ya!!! Everything was great food and service. I highly recommend Suprica
