XuSLRHv5_rympW7n71VIFw.text: The food was tasty but the service was challenging to say the least.  This place has soooo much potential, but is obviously still working through some of the new crew jitters.   The wife and I stopped in for what we thought  would be a quick and easy lunch. On top of our server making recommendations that weren't available, our food came out wrong twice. Then were uncharged for the stuff that we thought was standard lol.  What a cluster.   Given the amount of time they got my wife's food right, we had to ask for a to go box so we could get back for work.   I won't say we wouldn't go back here, but it would definitely have to be later down the road once they've worked out the kinks.

tptfTIcMrpOxyDarR8lmGA.text: Sunday night, sat at the bar. Amazing salsas with the complimentary chips. Especially the avocado one!   Drinks are small and on the pricy side but nonetheless good! Hubby got a Noda hop drop 12oz for $6 bucks and my Tommy's margarita was $10. My drink was 3 good sips and done! I could of drank 3+! But unfortunately not for $10+.   Hubby and I shared the puffy chicken tacos with endless, yep! I said endless rice & beans. The Refried beans smothered in cheese were amazing. Rice with small chopped vegetables was good as well. Puffy tacos are a must try as they are unlike a soft or a hard shell taco. It's almost a puff pastry filled with taco ingredients fried. It's delicious!! Puff tacos were $14, but after filling up on the fresh salsa and chips, we left plenty on our plates.   Wish I had room for more of the endless rice & beans!  Will be back for food, drinks are NOT justifiably but food was worth it!!

zumfpP-VcxtWlIXY0f09mw.text: This is my favorite place for fajitas. The best fajitas I've ever had. They start you off with salsa and chips, of which the lime avocado one is really good. And if you like hot spice... there is a bottle of some really spicy sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fajitas

VLbu1aqjKLxck2v-MQ-4aQ.text: I had been given a heads up by friends in Atlanta that I was going to love this addition to the Queen City.   Finally went on a Monday night before a NC Music Factory concert. There is a cool bar seating area when you walk in that has a cool vibe and it is pretty large. There is a huge dining room behind the bar area too. It's was busy but got a seat right away.   Went with the OG margarita which wasn't too sweet. Loved it. The chips and salsa options on the table were very good and I loved the squeeze jar of hot sauce. Couple of drops will do it. We had friends who wanted the guac so we got that and also the chorizo quest fundido. The fried chips that come with the guac are superb. Crispy but not heavy. The queso fundido was a stringy spicy bowl of goodness with the tortillas it comes with we're perfect. Of course eating your weight in chips and salsa plus apps meant I couldn't order the fajitas I saw going out constantly from the kitchen so will have to go back.   I had the tacos Al pastor which has sweet grilled pineapple and pork belly. 3 small tacos that were a perfect sized entree after all of those chips. Wife had the shrimp salad which was pretty sizeable too and she loved it. Can't wait to go back. Best Tex Mex in Charlotte no doubt. And wife lived in Austin for a time and remembers the original Chuy's.

NLx8sxToq-vSSERwYpE28w.text: Pro tip: Come during non-peak times because this place is BOMB.  I am in love with their veggie enchilada. In. Love. The tortillas melt in your mouth and the flavor profile is really top notch. Many tex-mex restaurants shine in the meat department (carnitas, steak, etc.), and it's difficult to find a truly phenomenal veggie option. Superica wins.  Their nachos were also really loaded, which I was a huge fan of. They have lots of melted cheese, green onion, and more.  We were able to be seated right away at 2pm on a Friday, but we tried another time at 6:45pm and were told it would be an hour and a half wait. So, plan accordingly, or you can try to wait until the hype dies down. I'm not convinced that it will!

0PcbYdp3b5YMMZQ6tceOag.text: I had a good mind to take a pic but like many places, I'm quite sure what I ordered is already in the line up of pics.   I met friends here for lunch and it wasn't crowded. Parking across the street is $5, so if you're unlucky enough to not find some free parking during lunch time then you're sol and will need to pay. Unless you want to walk 3 blocks like my buddy did. I circled around a couple times before lucking out on a space right by the place.   It's pretty spacious, and we were there for 2 hours. Who knows, it could have been the day of the week, but it was pretty slow.   So I order an Arnold Palmer and our waitress is from Colorado so she gives me unsweetened tea and some homemade lemonade. Living in the south, you get used to sweet tea and lemonade. So I asked her to supe this up for me cause baby needs some sugar. She even added some extra simple syrup... I think. Cause it was still lightly sweetened but better than the tart drink I had initially. Would not prefer again for the $3 I was charged.   Food was eh. Hence the reason for the 3 stars. I had a beef taco which had decent flavor. I added some guacamole sauce to it, which is aight. And I had the lunch nachos which is literally 4 chips. Instead of the cheese that typically comes on it, I asked for the queso. I mean isn't that what nachos should have anyway? Who wants shredded cheese on nachos???   Soooo I guess lunch special means tapas. Thank god the beans and rice are bottomless, cause I would have left hungry and cranky. I mean for $11.99, it's just aight.   I'd rather go to one of those cheap Mexican joints and get a dish exactly the way it is rather than change things up. But I guess that's what happens when you go to a Tex mex joint? Iono.   The service was cool. There were a couple times Colorado lady came to the table and had the opportunity to refill my drink, buuuut didn't. Another lady came and asked if I could get a refill. Not a big deal but rarely have to ask for a refill for my drink.   Bonus: it was supposed to be an extra $1.50 for the queso on my chips but I wasn't charged. Maybe it made more sense to them in the kitchen to add that than shredded cheese.

VTd579Iq6asC4gJsFxKM7A.text: DELICIOUS! I love Mexican food and this is some of the best I've had in Charlotte. My friend and I sat at the bar which was super fun, and the cocktails are incredible! I love how they do the beans and rice family style. Everything my friend and I ate tasted delicious. I've attempted to come back multiple times, however the wait has just been too long. Wouldn't suggest coming here with a big party unless you're ready to wait a couple hours. Overall, delicious place!

7L9mzG28dCeJwoN3xRlKvQ.text: Wow - where to start... as usual, we sat at the bar and split a meal. The bartender (think he's a manager) took the time to tell us about the history of the restaurant, how the food is made, and made perfect recommendations. Homade salsas. We had their huevos rancheros and a seafood carbon taco. Flavor explosion overall. I want to come back!

jEg2SmofMpnbdpnKgjPx4A.text: New Pretty good Mexican restaurant in Southend.  We came in from out of town and our hosts thought that this was the best new hot spot to take us too! It was a Friday night and the wait was set for over and hour but I think it ended up being half that time. Drinks were good, craft cocktails and food was yummy. I got the basic quesadillas because I'm not a huge Mexican fan.

odPXKODJi_e9A1GJNhMvoA.text: I have only ever been to Superica for brunch, but I've ordered off both the lunch/dinner menu and the brunch menu (both menus are available at brunch). I'm a big fan of this place, mostly for their pancake. It is absolutely gigantic, and the honey-flavored syrup served with it is unlike a typical maple syrup. It might be the best pancake I've ever had, and I've had my fair share of pancakes.   I've also ordered their vegetable fajitas, chicken enchiladas, queso fundido with chorizo, huevos rancheros, and the potato/egg/cheese/chorizo brunch dish. Everything has been good, with the standouts being the queso and the fajitas. The fresh tortillas provided with the fajitas were delicious, good enough to eat on their own with the complimentary salsa. The only downside is that the prices are pretty high, although the quality is excellent.   I want to go back and try their cocktails, but I love the pancake so much that it will be difficult to pull me away from their brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. A lot of different brunch menu items - fajitas, tortillas, pancake, potatoes

B3SsINBrKn0Yvw0vqy-thg.text: This was my best 2nd choice! Originally I wanted to try a restaurant next door but it was too busy & loud so I checked out Superica. Best.Choice.Ever! From the sangria to the warm , thin chips to the fresh salsa to the chicken mole enchiladas!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. I honestly came to this part of Charlotte to visit a restaurant next-door which was too busy and loud for me. I ended up at Superica...Wow!

Ag9feZz8V8vtkVyisxmCog.text: I love this place! It has a great mix of authentic Mexican and modern decor. The queso is amazing. I get the nachos and the tacos! Everything I've had there is wonderful. They also have a huge tortilla soup which is incredible!!! I love eating at Superica!!

g3UCN47NXbavj67ktvkVUw.text: LOVE the complimentary salsas and chips. They are so delicious and amazing. They also have a great drinks list. Their lunch menu is well priced and filling. Even though they got my order very mixed up and I had to take it to go because we had to leave after being there for a while they gave me my order on the house! I really did  appreciate this. Once I did it eat it was very good. I had the veggie enchilada and nachos lunch order. I've also been back for the veggie enchiladas for dinner and Frey were delicious and no service issues. I'm going back again for the third time next week! Love this place! And their queso is delicious!  The only thing I have to say is that it takes a long time from ordering your food to receiving it. I would say about 45 min wait time on average. Great service, great staff, but there is something quite slow happening in the kitchen, so prepare for that when you come in!

dqupkvJFonhGLyRKy_eR3w.text: Hands down best Tex-mex in Charlotte. This is coming from a Texas girl . Staff is great. Atmosphere is fit for first date, family night out or girls night out. The Tequila menu is enviable. The food is amazing.

hSnSv8Cf_r5PealQW9TV7w.text: Truly a 5 Star restaurant . Food is outstanding, atmosphere is fun, and service is friendly and warm. This will be a regular spot for me .

8LqNxn3vSw7Wq8iAHIZvRw.text: I wanted to like this new Tex Mex restaurant but couldn't. I had the soup which was not very good at all. It tastes like I was eating a can of red enchiladas sauce, very salty, inedible. My daughter has three tacos, the worse tacos we've ever had and it's hard to mess up tacos. Plus it's was expensive. On the plus side the chip and two sauces were excellent , so it gets two stars for that.

nrZ9KVfZEt26jLtylmGyAQ.text: Wanted to eat there... but after paying 5$ for parking we were told that it was an hour and twenty minutes wait time... that's ridicules... and it was in the middle of the week... not even the weekend... ended up going to another Mexican restaurant instead...

lPErZ3j82jTux2U3fvt2BQ.text: Everything you would want in a TexMex restaurant. We arrived around 6:30 on a Wednesday evening and were sat within ten minutes, even though the bar was packed and the restaurant was already crowded. We had great service throughout the night.  Recommend: the steak fajitas- the steak alone was  and the chorizo con queso was flavorful, a little spicy but not overwhelming, and a nice addition to the complimentary salsa they provide. We also tried the puffy taco trio (chicken, beef, guacamole- you can choose to mix & match) on a puffy taco (bc I needed to know what a puffy taco was) and it was good, but not as great as the other dishes we tried. If you do decide to try it out, the smoky hot sauce at the table is recommended and helps liven it up. We will be going back. Great option for any size dinner party.

WcHuTaKrLxCP4rwX5MjRoA.text: A hangry girls night out...  I'll keep it short and simple.  The food here, is absolutely amazing. To start out with the chips come out hot, and the salsa is some of the best I have had.  If you like playing with your food, go for the queso fundido, and have a "pull" contest at your table, taste great too.  We all ordered the fajitas and were extremely pleased (split them).  The not so fun part started with the water that was clearly collected from the drain pipes.  This made our extensive wait for a drink order all the more miserable.  The whole service line of Superica was clearly in "sloth mode". We ordered a guacamole app with our dinner, and told our waitress to bring it out before the main entrees. 30 minutes later and the first signs of hanger started to appear - Staring down every waiter carrying food, mean mugging every table that had their food, and checking our phones every minute.  Our waitress was no where to be found, so we flagged down a manager to ask the status of our order.  He gave us "the 5 more minutes" line, and then we started checking our phones like maniacs again (hanger). 10 minutes later we asked the waitress to cancel our guac, and after a whole hour we finally received our fajitas, with the wrong beans.  We then had to flag down another manager to get our order of beans, and spent the whole night with no refills on our drinks.  ***Totally would have been 5 stars, if this was all about food*** - Pro tip, bring a protein bar to hold off the hangry.

4A8eTokZI1IH0I4wsO6xjw.text: Awesome atmosphere! Great food! Service was really good. Our waitress Maggie was very helpful and very engaged. Great place to grab dinner and drinks. Definitely going back!

JeqJvMjEgfdg_Rq6TI6M6Q.text: Best Mexican food I've had since being in Austin, Texas! Guac, queso, margs, salsas and fajitas were all incredible.  Fun atmosphere and great, attentive staff.

P19Binjdh4s1fz-Mlx2iVQ.text: Came back in the other night for the third time and lucked out and had Anna again!! The servers in this place are top notch! Each person who gave us chips and salsa and water were polite and attentive!! Anna gave us great suggestions and explained each dish eloquently! Also had the pleasure of speaking with AJ who is an absolute delight! Have recommended this place to friends and family religiously! Can't wait to come back and try their brunch!!!

5htFJ5tE91zUuu-qdaxuxA.text: Disappointing experience! I have been to the Atlanta location many times. Some of the worst margaritas I have ever tasted! The lime juice was so sour, I pointed it out to the bartender who tried it and agreed that it was bad. They did nothing to correct the issue. Good atmosphere, food wasn't terrible, but please fix your margaritas!!

58WO2aGEHX_RhfN1lA3yQw.text: The suspense! I saw this restaurant featured in Charlotte Agenda. Looking forward to trying out the newest Tex Mex spot in Charlotte, I was excited to hear that a good friend was having her birthday dinner there.  We arrive, complete party present and were bustled around the restaurant twice for adequate seating (they do not have reservations, regardless of the size of the party).   Once finally seated, our waitress was great (I think her name was Christina). I had the Chicken Mole Enchiladas (sauce is on the sweeter side, very tasty).   The cutest thing, you get a postcard with your check. And they mail it off for you. A cost effective way to promote your restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

ViCKVFUkEBMssHlWkGfsrA.text: This restaurant has a lot of great things going for it (Besides the popularity and wait time.) Located in the trendiest restaurant section if Charlotte, Superica provides high quality Tex mex food and drinks. We all started by downing their margaritas, including a jalapeno one. The Tequila Tonic was also a delicious cocktail. Once we got to our table, we hit the chips with a vengeance. The two green salsas were both to die one. (One is a tomatillo and the other a green tomato.)  The best dish I tried was the shrimp fajitas as the Shrimp had a chargrill on the outside that really added a flavor layer! Their pinto beans are also the best Ice ever had.  Service was great too! They have a flow to get tables checked, and our particular waitress was super nice and friendly!

__YXmXcD2diLuVxH2Pvsqw.text: Yum!   The wait was about 35 minutes, so not crazy considering it was 6:15 and our friends weren't meeting us until 6:30 anyway.  Service was good. Never needed to ask to have my water refilled and they made sure we had adequate chips and salsa, etc.  The queso was very flavorful and it was their base queso. Definitely ate too many chips to start... almost ruined my need to eat dinner, but then the fajitas arrived. Presentation was really nice. The food was amazing. Anything extra needed while we ate the fajitas was brought quickly (like extra tortillas). We all thoroughly enjoyed our food and the overall experience.   Would definitely return!

Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love a good brick wall!

t2Ch8AQ0fkrsqumJBbjBvQ.text: Their lunch special is where it's at! I want to come back for dinner with a group so I can sample more menu items.   I highly recommend the pozole. It's topped with pork rinds and full of luscious pork chunks. All lunch special items come with beans and rice which is one of my favorite parts of a Tex Mex meal. The house salad is a refreshing balance to all the richness but I've had the enchiladas and pork and steak tacos and those all went into my belly quickly too.   This is a great place to come with friends who love to Instagram. Head to Jeni's for ice cream after.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

a5hYSG9GJK1haphadJp8_g.text: Came here on a Friday night with a girl friend. Wait was an hour and 15 mins at 7pm. Ouch, but not their fault and expected.  We ordered some drinks at the bar while waiting. I ordered the Mezcal margarita. At $14 it was expensive, but I liked the flavors. I probably would've liked the drink a lot better if it had been a bit cheaper.  I also later ordered the Light Rail at $13. Bourbon, blood orange liquor, agave, and chilli bitters. This drink was also good. Again, just pricey but basically on par with other cocktail prices in Charlotte (unfortunately)  We finally got seated. We split the queso fundido. At $10, again a bit expensive. Everyone seems to love the cheese pulls. It was good, but for some reason I think I prefer the more traditional queso. They have that as well, which I may try next time.   The salsas were delicious and brought out right away. One was more of a smoky chipoltle and the other was a green salsa. Excellent and the chips were great as well.   I ordered the pollo con mole aka chicken enchiladas with mole sauce. I really enjoyed this entree. The mole sauce was very good. Great chocolate and cinnamon spice flavor. Came with a side of rice and beans.  Overall, it was a good meal and our service was fantastic. Shout out to Holland for a great night. I think next time I'd order something like the fajitas to share with someone else.   I've said it a few times, but I'll say it again- this place is expensive. 2 drinks, half a queso, and an entree and I was at $50 by myself before tip. I can walk to this place from my house and will probably be back, but I think Bakersfield is on par with this place or better and is cheaper.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pollo con mole
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso fundido and chips and salsa

OfNulQjUJrke_NWJyMb-YA.text: Superica (pronounced Super-eeka) has been on our list for a long time, but we waited until now to visit, given their popularity and long waits.  We ventured out one Sunday evening for dinner, and then again the next weekend for breakfast, and finally understand the hype.    What's great?  Well, quite a lot!   * First, their salsas are homemade, and some of the best we've ever had.  Their avocado-tomatillo has a nice tang and is their mildest.  Their roasted salsa has a medium heat, and is my favorite.  Their breakfast salsa is mild-medium, and tastes wonderful on eggs. * Their food is thoughtfully created and prepared.  I'll share more about that in a bit. * The atmosphere and decor are modern and comfortable.  Tables are reasonably spaced, seating is comfortable, and the music is also some of the best we've heard.  According to the manager, they have someone create their own mix to be played at all of their locations.  Think rock, bluegrass, country, you name it.  It's an eclectic mix, and just works.  * Service is friendly and helpful.  We've not wanted for anything during either of our visits.  Now onto the food.  I'd give dinner four stars.  For our appetizer, the queso fundito with chorizo was bursting with flavor.  And they aren't skimpy on the chorizo, either.  The El Lopez is a great combo plate if you want to try everything.  My hubby shared his puffy queso taco with me, and while I love the concept and taste, it was a little hard to cut given the thickness of the tortilla.  The cheese enchiladas and beef taco were quite delicious.  My Shrimp Tacos Dorados was a bit of a disappointment, however.  The three tacos were small and full of fried shrimp, cabbage, and sauce.  But the taco shells tasted like they were made earlier, and then sat around before being assembled.  I wouldn't get this again.  With each meal, you get rice and beans, family style, and they were awesome.    For breakfast, I'd give it an EASY five stars.  I have to tell you about their coffee.  They use Honduran coffee, which has an unusual--but absolutely delicious--flavor.  Maybe cinnamon or something else?  I had the Migas Plate, which was scrambled eggs with chorizo, onions, jalapenos, tortillas, and topped with cheese.  It was a huge pile, served with three warm (and handmade) flour tortillas that made wonderful wraps.  I would get this dish again and again, and frankly think it's the best egg dish I've ever gotten at a restaurant.   My hubby got the huevos rancheros.  He asked for his eggs medium, and they were served on top of two crispy homemade fried tortillas, topped with beans and sauce, and served with avocado and wonderfully crispy bacon.  Here's where the breakfast salsa really shined - it was a perfect topping for his eggs, and I used it on mine, too.  Lucky for us, they serve their beans for breakfast, too.  Yum!  We returned for breakfast another weekend, and I got the Huevos Mexicanos, and my husband got the potatoes, chorizo, and eggs.  The Mexicanos is good if you want a vegetarian option, but the Migas Plate is still my favorite, as the chorizo adds a ton of flavor.  My husband loved his plate, and would definitely get it again.  We might try getting just one pancake to share, too.    Just a couple of tips - don't sweat over the parking.  If you can't get a free spot on the street, there's a $5 lot literally across the street from Superica's entrance.  And come early or late to avoid the big crowds and a long wait.   And FYI - Jenni's Splendid Ice Cream is just around the corner.    All in all, I'd give Superica 4.5 stars, rounded up.  I hear they may be trying to find a location in Lake Norman, but until then, we'll be frequent visitors at this location!

MHjy2fYjxLLUXgpdfChjhA.text: We didn't eat here YET, but will return because the menu looks bomb! We came in here for drinks on a Sunday. They didn't have any drink specials but there frozen house margarita was good and strong. A highlight of this spot in my opinion is the staff! They were all cool as hell and we got to talk with one of the managers, who gave us a brief history of and recommendations about Superica! Their chips and housemade salsas were delicious! One is a spicy one and the other is avocado based, both delicious and the chips are made fresh (and yummy) there! Can't wait to return to actually eat  lunch or dinner!

haROaRinxycPlN8ULkNVAQ.text: First, I love the chips and green salsa mixed.  This was my third time and can't say I was wowed...the chicken Suizas was just OK this time and didn't bother taking leftovers.  Secondly, my friends ordered the soup and it was upper dark this time and salty.  The guacamole was stringy.  Maybe it was just an off day but not the same as last two visits.  I was pleasantly surprised there was not a wait on a Sunday around 5:45p and service was great.

4PeHjE135HAYzQUyVvirRQ.text: Stopped in with the wife for a date night. We arrived at about 6:30 on a Saturday and there was about a 35 minute wait so we cozied up to the bar. The bar was busy but we were quickly served. The bar has a nice selection of cocktails.   We were seated before finishing the first drink. The main seating area is open and lively. The menu has a lot of good looking dishes. My wife chose the campechana and I got the steak tacos al carbon rico's way. Rico likes sauces and cheese.  There was a short rib dish that looked fantastic but I wasn't that hungry.  Overall the atmosphere was nice, the service friendly, and the food was good.

7dvq3gO_kB7px62SBB5q9Q.text: I got to check out Superica with a group of 12 folks on a Monday night for a birthday celebration. They don't take reservations, but we were seated rather quickly.   The service was the best I've had for a large party. Everyone's food and drinks were correct and the server was great, ya know...just the right amount of talking but enough distance since she's wasn't apart of our party. Y'all know what I mean.   The food was good. Chips and two types of salsa as we were seated and they provided more chips as we devoured them.   I ordered the chicken verde enchiladas, they were good. Everyone enjoyed their food. I already have a favorite Mexican spot and it hasn't been replaced, but I'm looking forward to coming back to try the famous pancake.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

46lGAD4SPSlDEfrcenmkqg.text: Shortest wait of any of the restaurants at the design center because this place is huge. Great atmosphere and great service.   But the food was just okay. We had the tamales to start out and the meat was a bit dry. The chicken mole enchiladas were odd because the mole was super sweet (like dessert sweet). The shrimp dorado tacos were so bland that I ended up dumping a ton of salsa and hot sauce on it. For the price, I would expect better tasting food. I will say that their salsas were pretty good. Hands down the highlight of our meal.  I've heard brunch is better than dinner here so maybe I'll give them another shot and try their brunch menu.

C8HK2ksU8XdpmBmvs_qdPA.text: Tex-Mex and ummm Frozen Rose'  - Yes!  This is a fun spot for tacos & mex at lunch. Lots of tables. The most impressive thing to me though was the frozen Rose' - finding new ways to drink Rose' is always welcome.  I had the barbacoa tacos and they were so good! Really nice rice and beans on the side. Very fresh and fast service.  It will be nice when they have a patio or outdoor area as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Frozen Rose&#39; vs still... both are yum

X4L6_TZzbzBWyXpahUmXHg.text: I was very hesitant to go here since it seemed so expensive, but it is well worth it. I tried the carnitas taco al pastor with their lunch special one day and fell in love! It was so good that I came back for dinner another night and was more than willing to pay full price for those tacos. The only downside to this place is that sometimes I feel like I'm being rushed, but good if this kind of quality is so worth it.

7i_46NsHAfnEVpg28ouDsA.text: I came here to celebrate a friend's birthday dinner and was met with a pretty long wait so we grabbed some drinks at the bar.   I ordered a margarita and it was tasty but definitely not strong at all.   When we got to our table we started with the salsas and  fundido. I don't know which salsa I prefer I kept sampling both to pick a winner and couldn't. The fundido was also very tasty. I like that you have to grab it up with the fresh tortillas. It the real deal.   For dinner I wanted to sample some tacos so I ordered the shrimp taco and two puffy tacos. I really enjoyed the shrimp taco it's deep fried and loaded up with flavor and then topped with avocado. Sooo good. You have to try this! The puffy tacos didn't do it for me. Not sure what I was expecting but they didn't wow me.   My friend ordered the chicken fajitas and they were very good. When I return, I'd absolutely order them. I really like how the sides are endless and family style so you can share, enjoy and repeat over and over.   I also really like they little postcards that they give you after your meal. What a cute way to advertise and and a sweet note to someone!   I am excited to give this place a try for brunch. I hear the pancakes are awesome. So stay turned for my brunch update!

Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Puffy Tacos
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Taco Dorados

s_nwabm8_f42R6VgYlm3kQ.text: There has been a ton of hype about Superica. I was a little worried it wouldn't live up to it, but it definitely did!   We went on a Saturday afternoon and it was not at all crowded. We came after a show, so it was a bit of a weird time. I've heard it's pretty crowded during normal hours. We were seated right away. Our server was very friendly and walked through the menu with us since we hadn't been there before.   Based on research, we knew we had to get the queso fundido. We decided to add chorizo and it was incredible. Sure the cheese pulls are fun, but the flavor really brings it home. I ordered El Lopez and my husband got the steak fajitas. We both loved our meals.  It's definitely upscale Mexican/Tex-Mex and the prices reflect that, but the portions are generous and the quality is high. I really enjoyed the decor if the restaurant as well.   This is some of my favorite Tex-Mex in Charlotte. If you haven't had a chance to check it out yet, I highly recommend you do (and then go get ice cream at Jeni's). We will definitely be back!

-Mbs24YeiSfaUi73S7LIVg.text: Waited a while to try this place out since it was always crowded when it first opened. Thankfully there wasn't a wait and the service was great. The restaurant is very clean with a nice lively atmosphere. The food was tasty but a little pricey, especially compared to other restaurants with similar food choices in the area. Overall, it's a trendy restaurant but I would revisit.

Mtqk1LsZCoEP2K4kUd52Uw.text: This new tex-mex restaurant is definitely a friend of mine because of their chips (the chips you get with your salsa definitely makes a difference), chorizo queso, enchiladas, and their tres leches dessert!   Set inside an old warehouse in South End, the dining room is spacious, with high ceilings, and nice and spread out, so you don't feel on top of anyone else. The staff is really friendly and food is known to come out timely and quickly. I also think the portion sizes are perfect for someone who eats a basket of chips -- literally by myself -- as an appetizer.   - Drink: Mexican coke for you non-alcohol lovers and for those looking for some alcohol the Chelada -- Dos Equis over ice, with fresh lime juice and a salt rim - Dessert: Unique take on tres leches (and a MUST GET): cake soaked in cream and topped with fresh whipped cream and passion fruit drizzle. The passion fruit drizzle is a unique

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tres leches

o6vFCuRkodv1sb4eUYyEqw.text: Had heard so many good things about Superica and I love Mexican food so off we went.  Grabbed some lunch on a weekend and it was really tasty.   Really like the decor as it has a southwest feel but is open and airy.  Lots of light and inviting.   There is a lot of room but from what I hear, this place can fill up.     Service was really good and our waitress provided a lot of good suggestions to try.  She was spot on with her recommendations and she was very attentive to our table.    From a food standpoint, everything was really good.   We started with the Campechana de Mariscos (cevechie with shrimp, crab and octopus).  The flavor was out of this world.  My only complaint would be the container that it was served in.  For our mains, we got the Chicken Verde enchiladas and the Tacos al carbon (carnitas).  The Verde enchiladas had a good spice to it.  It had good heat that built up over time (just like I enjoy).  The Carnitas tacos were different than the norm but again had good flavor.    Overall this was a good experience.  One complaint that I have is that there are a number of items that seem to be overpriced.  But I will be back.

Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Campechana de Mariscos

WjZ9k9ja8700w8KqHVgPJg.text: I went back and forth if Superica should get a 3 or a 3.5 star review. I've been here about 5 times (3 for dinner and 2 for brunch)  The space is really cool. There are a ton of large windows that let in a lot of natural light during the day and at night time the ambiance is gives off a chic western feel. The tables and chairs are all wood and the booths are a plush cognac leather. There is a massive projector that separates the two areas in the restaurant. They play movies and concert sets. The music is typically very loud. So much so that it feels like you have to scream to the people on sitting across the table. There is a really large patio area. I personally haven't sat out there, but there are string lights and it looks really fun.   There is a very large bar that runs across the entire front of the restaurant and a smaller one in the other room. The bar is stocked from wine, beer, to margaritas and they have a vast amount of liquor to wet your whistle.  For dinner I've tried the fundido, queso, salads, and tortilla soup  For brunch I've had the huevos rancheros and tried the pancakes  Brunch is BY FAR better than dinner.   The cheese dips are both very good. I actually think I prefer the queso though. The salad I had was actually very good. It wasn't anything special though. The tortilla soup is a salt lick. Not worth ordering.   The huevos rancheros are some of the best I've had. They typically fry the corn tortilla that comes with it, but I ask them not to. There's bacon and avocado.... delish! What is truly a surprise though... is how amazing the pancakes are. They are a stand out. They come with a toffee-like butter as a syrup. MMMM so good!  Service has always been pretty good. Definitely better during the day than at night. The last time I was there (a few nights ago) we ordered queso twice and twice we were left chip-less so when we did finally get chips re-ordered the queso was cold. No one was happy  So overall, brunch is your better bet.

L8_hyrtvdwF0SFcjuV88gg.text: I'm going to put Superica down as pretty 'super' in my book. However, I will stress that what you order is liable to change your experience so it's pretty important that you take heed of my next piece of advice:   ORDER THE FAJITAS.  Once you go in with that bit of knowledge, you'll be operating at a 50% better advantage than your fellow dining patrons. That's a free math equation for you guys.  I've been to Superica twice and the only thing memorable from the first visit was the chips and salsa. They provide two complimentary salsas (green has a more garlic flavor and red is the spicier one) which are delish and even better when mixed. I've found the chips are on the saltier side than other restaurants but still good in my book.  On my first visit I ordered the Tommy's margarita which I found a bit weak and the shrimp ceviche. The ceviche tasted fresh but was just 'meh' to me. I also got to try the infamous queso but I wasn't blown away (I much prefer Bakersfield for queso).  This second visit, I went with a friend during the lunch time and sat at the bar. The restaurant wasn't busy but was definitely getting there. I was very pleased to find out that they bar hooks and outlets at the bar.  I started off with a sangria (it was also during their brunch hours) and placed my order for chicken fajitas. The sangria was pretty weak; I've yet to find the 'right' drink of theirs that has a bit more kick.  While we were waiting for our food, we got to speak with the bar manager who let us know their tortillas are made in-house. We also got to chat about various restaurants in Charlotte and he really elevated the experience for me.  I do feel the need to mention that there seemed to be a bit of a mix up/miscommunication between the servers regarding which orders belonged to whom at the bar. Once that was figured out, we received our food (both different orders of fajitas) and dug in. Everything from the presentation to the flavor, the chicken fajitas were on point. Yes, the fajitas are the more expensive menu item (maybe most expensive?) but WORTH IT.  The fajita come with 'bottomless' rice and beans which may be my other favorite thing about Superica. The bar manager let us know that two people typically share fajitas but I had to laugh at that because I wouldn't dare share these fajitas.   There's a large outdoor back patio and the parking situation sucks. I've lucked up with decent street parks. My only advice is to either get there super early or be patient and keep circling for an open spot!

We were seated immediately and the manager served our chips and talked with us. You don't often get that personal effect in a restaurant. The red salsa was my favorite with a great spicy taste. The green salsa was good as well. The food was delicious. We look forward to visiting again.

C8ge9I9gSmtjSBE8DJhWyg.text: Came here with fiance on a friday night expecting a good dinner and ready for something new. We loved the west coast beach atmospher created right away when we walked in. We had to wait as there seems to be about a 20 to 30 minute wait most weekend nights. We seated and immediately order the tamales followed by two entrees, the pollo con mole enchiladas, and the shrimp tacos. The tamales were very dry on the inside without much flavor other than the sauce they were soaked in. The sauce flavor was good but the dry meat was hard to get past. Then came our entrees. They were plated well and looked tasty. I bit into the enchiladas and could taste the strong cinnamon  and cumin  flavors mixed in. I lime mole but the flovars didnt seem to blend well as i could taste the strong over used seasonings. My fiance was not happy with the tacos. The shrimp was dry and lacking flavor. The service was excellent and professional but the food just didnt seem to match the reputation. We hear brunch is really good and will have to come back and try it to see if we chamge our minds about the pkace.

sdyA5WJ7ELjqHPbcIYgovQ.text: We wanted to try this new restaurant and Tex mex isn't usually my favorite, but what the hell. Let's do it. This is one of Southend's newest restaurants. Once we parked we walked in to an open area with details down to the T.  We had a little wait because it was a Sunday and they also had brunch. No problem, because our wait wasn't that long. We are seated and someone takes our drink order. We asked for more time to look over the menu. The chips and the guacamole salsa dip was A1. We ordered i got the shrimp tacos.  The Tacos came out crisp and in a decent time with the crowd. The sides of rice and refried beans come family size and were popping hot.  We ordered a margarita it wasn't really anything to get hype about, but it wasn't bad either. I had an overall good experience here.  I would try it again with friends.

IuLNwavsCGuXf9b4tC3J6A.text: To start, I would like to say they really have the best guacamole in Charlotte, but everything here is soo heavy. I have come a few times and it's just too much cheese, salt, and oil in my opinion. The wait service has always been good but what i've noticed every time is that the hostess staff aren't. It's tough to come here with a large group since they don't take reservations. Knowing this [the most recent time I was here], my family came at about 5:30 and it was not too full there were noticeably open tables but it took 15 minutes for them to put our table of six together. I'd come back in another year once they're a little more settled into Charlotte.

y7D4zsOJ_w1Sd3y4w_lmDw.text: Everything was on point! Hit it for brunch, had the tortilla soup. Filling enough after smashing their delicious chips and salsa. Everyone in my group enjoyed their meal and service. Great atmosphere and decor.

The refried beans no.longer come with cheese on it. The chips were chewy like they been double dipped in oil.   They changed things up but not for the better.

bM9GHZRxbex9L1IpN-IjUQ.text: Loved my veggie enchiladas so much and the service by Amy!  Sat near the back ~ which I would request in the future because it's quieter!  They were out of puffy item so my son couldn't get entree he wanted and no olives so I didn't get my dirty martini, but the experience made up for it and our waitress was really accommodating! A great experience!

zD8lUyxrPvMdIRnm9hJ1Yg.text: The drinks were good, service was excellent, the food...(short ribs - $35) was the bomb. I just found my Charlotte go to spot.

TACNpI-vb3U44j-QcT2JqA.text: I went to Superica on Friday night with a friend. We did have to wait about an hour for a table, but were able to grab some of their margaritas at the bar. The margaritas were delicious! You could tell the bartenders were very busy and working hard, but nonetheless had incredible service. Because they were so busy, the bar manager told us to have a seat outside and he brought our chips and guac to us outside on the patio- even though it was supposed to just be bar service.   Once we were able to sit, I ordered the shrimp tacos. Service was really fast once we were sitting. Our drinks made it to us within 5 minutes, and our food within 15ish minutes. The tacos were incredible and so filling! The bottomless beans were also incredible, and I love that they are bottomless. The bar manager that had served us earlier even came over to us a few times to check on us and make sure we were situated okay.   Overall, food was delicious, restaurant is beautiful (but yes, very crowded), and service was very attentive and personable! I'll definitely be going back soon!

G4t1ZJgVbF3P2AnXeYbrbg.text: We visited for drinks on the second night they were open and again for lunch the following day.   As for drinks, we had La Paloma (El Jimador Blanco, fresh lime, glass bottle of Squirt and salt) and El Frio (El Jimador Blanco, Stirrings triple sec, fresh lime, served frozen).  Both drinks were great and I especially loved that you get the whole glass bottle of Squirt with your Paloma!  You can tell they use fresh ingredients in their drinks.  For lunch, we had the lunch special which included your choice of two lunch items (taco, salad, soup, enchilada, or nachos) plus family-style retried beans and rice.  The mole on the chicken enchilada was phenomenal; very rich with amazing flavor.  Nachos are stellar as well; they dress their nachos individually, so that every chip is sure to have beans and cheese on top. That's the kind of attention to detail that makes this place so good. Even the house salad isn't your run-of-the-mill house salad; it has toppings like crispy tortilla strips, radish, cheese, cilantro and cucumber.   The staff was very friendly and attentive during both visits, which is hard to do in your opening week.  This place is kid-friendly with kid menus for food and drink, crayons for drawing and a louder ambiance that will make parents of smaller kids a little more likely to relax! We live close by and can see this place being a staple!

uGGp9F6Rijbe_cy536iBow.text: The ceviche I had here was so fresh and delicious, as well as the salsas. But what has prompted me to write this review is this... I have had a lot of veggie fajitas. They are usually very boring and flavorless - basically peppers and tomatoes without the meat that usually goes with it, maybe a few mushrooms. Not the case at this place. They are chockfull of great stuff like cauliflower, carrots, sweet potatoes, red cabbage. And the flavor is so wonderful! My new favorite spot for fajitas, especially when I am feeling a meat-free day.

3X04fCtKbngG0FjRQysUKg.text: The food here is very good. It's one of my fav places to go. From the old cool building to the nice wait staff and good food, this Mexican restaurant will not disappoint.

E5NIP0jCKwK-RAHwruhgxw.text: After a number of meals here (brunch/lunch/dinner) my 3 star review stands.  The food has always been GREAT as long you like Tex-Mex.  One issue with brunch; there's only one dish that isn't "eggs"; the pancakes which (I love) are huge & served with a syrup/buttermilk combo. Excellent quality and service has been consistent.  The major issue we continue to have is the seemingly lack of efficiency at the "check-in"/entry station and staff.  Currently waiting "25-30 minutes" along with many others while there are a number of tables that remain empty/available.  At least they're willing to text you when it's your turn for a table. Avoid coming at traditional supper time. Earlier is easier.

pIGYVjJZFU55JAweruQvxg.text: Y'all, I promise this is my last update, but I had to brag on how great Superica's customer service is. After my first review, I got a really nice message from the manager. After my updated review with the bill overcharging shenanigans, I got a message from the food group manager who refunded my entire bill. Holy moly!! This is obviously a company that puts a high importance on customer service, which is incredibly rare these days. I'll definitely be back.

hWUVqxwp05H2WKvDhniauQ.text: Had brunch this morning at Superica and as usual, it was wonderful. Ashley Z waited on us and was so pleasant and helpful. My wife and I split a double stack of hot cakes with a side of applewood bacon. The hot cakes are delicious and so fluffy and the house made buttermilk syrup is incredible. We asked for the bacon to come out crispy and it was perfect! I love the regular menu but it's hard to pass up the brunch. The GM, Michael, always is making his rounds and makes sure things run smoothly. We come at least once a week and the food and service are always first rate.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Back room at Superica looking out into the patio.

E8KEb4HXvznvWF9_GtStrA.text: Aesthetically, a beautiful looking restaurant. The decor is great, a new western ~*vibe*~  Entrees are pretty expensive but then you'll realize they're actually for two people and come with sides. So, $25 for two to eat in this pretty place is good. This place does come up as a suggestion for "cheap eats" ...That's really not gonna be the case with this place, considering you're probably going to order a drink and appetizer. If you want cheap eats go to Tacos El Nevado ( good al pastor tacos, homemade tortillas,  and better, no frills queso -but, no atmosphere).  First time in, service was great and food was GREAT.  It was lunch. Queso was OK but the heritage pork belly was amazing. It came out sizzling on a fajita plate with warm, soft tortillas. The sauteed onion with the fiery grilled peppers and butter slathered in the tortilla with pork belly was just heaven. They hadn't been open for even 72 hours and it was impressive.  Second time in, for dinner we felt that our server was trying to rush us out, and the same dish came out different than the original visit. The plate wasn't hot so not the same theatrics with the ~*sizzle*~ the temp came more like warm so half way through it became cold. The tortillas they gave this visit were not like the first time, they were not fresh and were quite tough/stale.   First visit was perfect, 2nd was disappointing. Thankfully, if things aren't going so good, management is involved and cares. Worth a revisit just because of that. We all recommended this place after the first visit to everybody and we will continue to because of customer service.

gMGNL7b3-xpB1t229dc1BA.text: I don't understand what the hype is. The atmosphere is cool and the staff is friendly but the food here just straight up isn't good at all. It's tasteless I really want to like this place because of how cool it is on the inside but I just can't. I've also never ever been to a Mexican restaurant with prices that are this high it's shocking how much they charge for a taco.

H3WRpxVXqFsmQe2QDGExUQ.text: Great place for friends & family. The food was everything that other reviewers had said on a positive note and then some. The service was spot-on and truly this is a welcoming eatery. My wife's cocktail ( Extra Fresca) was excellent. My cocktail (Under The Volcano) flavor was fantastic however, it's volume in the cocktail glass was only half full. Needless to say, at $14, one would expect your cocktail glass to be filled somewhere in the general area of 3/4 or more. Other than this small disappointment, our over all experience was marvelous and highly recommended.

Gv12CmwgMidyDC4C_nNkPw.text: Love this place! Bartenders are great, food is pretty awesome-- been here several times and food has been consistent. Get the OG! Spicy Marg is simple, no frills, just the way I like it.

bz9MzYW8HGyCNjjbMhSC3g.text: We are from Texas and we have been living in the Carolinas for about 9 months now. I love living here, except for two things: 1. You can't find good beef in the deep south. It's all pork all the time.   2. They don't know a damn thing about Tex-Mex in the deep south.    Well, I can cross number two off that list now. After our visit to Superica yesterday I finally have a Tex-Mex place to go in the Charlotte area. Since we have only been here once I'll give you an overall impression and a blow by blow on the things we tried.  Overall The food is really good. The Chef knows what he is doing, and the food is prepared in an authentic way using high quality, authentic ingredients. Now, that's not to say that everything is perfect, because it's not, for me. This Chef has a sweeter palate in Tex-Mex than I prefer. For example, the enchiladas seem to be finished with a chocolate sauce. It's good, but it's a little sweet for taste. I prefer red sauce on my enchiladas.     The service was over-the-top excellent. The staff were all super friendly, attentive and helpful, as was the manager on duty. They took the time to explain the food and then menu, which was a little odd for us, but it makes sense when you consider that the food is probably unlike anything the locals have every had. After all, most Tex-Mex in the deep south is really bland and consists mostly of tacos and enchiladas.  The restaurant is very cool and has an authentic southwestern feel to it. The tables and chairs are nice and comfortable and there is plenty of seating. The space is very open with really high ceilings and lots of windows. There is lots of parking across the street, which I think they will be needing in the future.   Specifics I had the Parilla Deluxe which is grilled steak and chicken and camarones brochetas. The steak fajitas were among the best I have ever had. They were perfectly marinated to maximum tenderness, but not to the point of being chalky. They had a great grilled flavor as well. The chicken fajitas were super tender and juicy. They had some kind of BBQ sauce on them that was a little heavy on the poblano(?) and bit too sweet for me. But they were still very good and perfectly prepared.  The camarones (shrimp, wrapped in bacon with cheese and jalapenos inside) were really good. They could use a bit more jalapeno bite and a little less grill time, but they were good. The fajita fixins were a little on the small side, but that is easily remedied by asking for more. The tortillas were good and looked as though they were made in house and very fresh. The refried beans were outstanding. If you are a fan of refried beans you have got to try these!   My wife has the picadillo enchiladas. They were very good, however, as I mentioned above the chocolate sauce is too sweet for my taste I would recommend that they add an option to get them with a red or green sauce as well.   My son had the BBQ Brisket sandwich, holy cow was that thing huge! It looked beautiful and he said the taste was amazing. I would have tried it, but it had a ton of guacamole on it and I hate that stuff.   If you are looking for authentic Tex-mex in the Charlotte area this is your only option, but it is a good one and you won't regret it.

_9ID_EM2r9YSO7v9z2cfvQ.text: This place was AH-MAZING! From the service to the food you really feel like you are having a dining experience and not just eating out. Can't say enough about this establishment and look forward to coming back soon!

bQ-FDSDYYV42UgBRhxj8fA.text: Love this restaurant. Amazing food, margaritas and atmosphere. They often have a wait so try to get to restaurant early.

BTrey6mcqzv5DoyLAjPOwg.text: This is definitely my new favorite Mexican place in town! Everything we had here was amazing and they have some really unique options that you can't find anywhere else in Charlotte. The atmosphere is awesome and it is definitely a great spot to hang out with friends. The price point is a little higher than I'd like for a Mexican restaurant, but this is definitely upgraded from your basic Mexican cuisine. I highly recommend the puffy tacos! They're a bit difficult to eat but definitely worth it- chicken tinga was by far my favorite.

GdAlah76s6t8hegQT0uBqg.text: Food is really good but it is extremely expensive for Mexican food. Service is always great and the quality and freshness of the food is apparent. I just wish the fajitas weren't almost $30

5VCISMkpImtl9Ekae_u6ag.text: How can I give a negative zero. I had my family in town and suggested this location. WHAT A MISTAKE!! Food is mediocre at best and the service is even worse. They need to learn how to talk to people and how to handle speaking to customers. We wanted to sit outside at a minimum have a drink outside while it was raining and had our drinks put in plastic cups, had I known this was a mistake I would have taken glass out to their patio. We were told we had to have our drinks before we walked out although we JUST ordered them but tried to be respectful and sat up front. The management was I CREDIBLY RUDE AND SO UNPROFESSIONAL!! They tried to talk to me after the fact but their message and the ""rules"" were not In line. We sat by the front desk, with out cups!! The manager approached me and the more I tried to explain the more he was unprofessional. What could have been a simple conversation and him accommodating us, the more he made it seem like he wanted us to leave for no reason.

GxcXyDUtnGqwSnSo4v9ssQ.text: When you wake up still thinking about what you ordered you know its good. I had the Tacos Dorados de Camaron. Delicious!!!! Each bite better than the last. The gauc salsa was awesome. This was just the bar menu. Cant wait to go back when the dining room is open.

7UPBdskaTybty9uLBDYEkQ.text: "From the food to the service, to the decor ...I'm hooked!"  We went to Superica on a Saturday around 3:30 pm. We didn't need to wait.  The place is amazing! Best Tex-Mex around.   The decor and vibe are awesome, the food is to die for and the service was top notch!   Should put to Leo who was one of the best servers I've ever experienced!  Leo was very knowledgeable of the menu and made excellent recommendations which turned out to be delicious. He asked us if it was our first time and if we want to know about the menu.   Amazing job Leo!  Reading other's reviews you can notice that all servers are amazing, so that's what I called 5-star customer service experience. Good job for management!   I got chicken fajitas al carbon. Omg! I can't describe the taste of the chicken but hands down to the best tortillas I've ever had in my life. No kidding.   My first impression was actually, that it was not going to be enough because my husband ended all the chips with the salsas that come with our drinks. I was not able to finish my second fajita!   I got a margarita. Not the best one, however, our experience was incredible.  My husband Got the chicken suizas enchiladas. And there were no leftovers for him.  The portions are BIG, so keep that in mind when looking at prices.   Some of the best food and service you'll ever get  This will definitely be a regular spot for us!

G4spXFxLgMCgMf3Ef8_CEQ.text: We have been here several times. It's loud, there can be a wait depending on when you go, but the food is always great. I love the chicken enchiladas and the steak fajitas. And they've some of the best salsa around. One current tip: check the parking situation, the lot across the street has been closed for construction.

jPZQz3j4gBAqzESmk2yqwQ.text: We visited Superica for brunch on a Sunday. We were pleasantly greeted at the door by the hostess which is always a great first impression. The wait was about 15 minutes,not bad at all. Once seated, we were approached by our waitress shortly after. Our waitress was full of positive vibes and very sweet.  We enjoyed the complimentary chips and dip and we liked how two salsas are offered. On the other hand, my meal was so so. I ordered the enchiladas. I can't recall the exact type but pesto was a part of it. The overall taste was not my favorite and I only ate some of it. However, my rice and refried beans were great. I am rating Superica a 3 due to not being pleased with my entree. I plan to go back again and order something different. I'll update my review at that time!

pkkGN1-iAH-ap6dpwnzTLw.text: So I'm not one to ga-ga over Mexican food.   My friends had been wanting to go and I wouldn't' find the urgency. I was wrong, this place is worth checking out.   The restaurant is spacious but it's popular. So come early or late, or be prepared to wait. I would describe the decor and tex-mex modern. The service was warm and speedy, but the food... mmmm!  I don't know if they make their salsa from scratch, but if they don't they do a good job hiding it. Rookie mistake eating all the chips before the food came.   I ordered the steak fajitas... they were enormous. They can absolutely be shared with two people, but if you're hungry you might be able to chow it all down. On top of the steak prepared medium rare and the charred veggies that went great around the four tortilla, the revelation in the dish was the Mexican butter... it elevated the dish to me to a whole new level. I would drink it if it wouldn't give me a heat attack.   The margaritas were excellent the the michelada was quite refreshing.   I think this place will be a southend staple for a long time.

rhSR0EPMei-HLNqzfWAFGg.text: We came for dinner and went early (around 5pm) because we knew it would get crowded. Heads up, they don't seat you until your whole party arrives.   The menu was very limited, which was the biggest draw back. None of it was very traditional, so it was difficult for us to decide what to order. The food was good, but the atmosphere and location is why I'm giving it 4 stars.  By the time we left at 7, it was very crowded with no where to wait on a table, making it difficult to leave. Overall, we liked the restaurant, but had very high expectations because of the other reviews and we weren't blown away.

jdQeJFZfUTs9bKTI-A6jVQ.text: (3.5 stars) we came here for a double date night with friends of ours since it's been on my list to try for awhile. Heads up, they won't seat you until your whole party has arrived. The vibe of the place was very good and it was a lot bigger than expected. We sat back by the kitchen and our table was comfortable. I ordered the Matador and at $10 I was hoping for a slightly larger drink but it was good, it did come with some cilantro in it so if you think cilantro tastes like soap make sure you pick it out. The Tecate light was $5 a pop for approximately a 10oz glass (12oz tops) which is wildly overpriced The service was okay, but it took us a hour to order drinks and receive our food.   When we got our food it was mediocre. I would have liked more pineapple on my tacos al pastor but I did appreciate that the tacos were double tortillas so they didn't tear apart easily. My husband got the grilled Chile rellenos and was happy with the portion size. I guess overall we were looking for more flavor. Now that we've been there we can check it off the list but we wouldn't rush back.   Side note, the menu online was slightly different than in the restaurant.

q0FnWGFaxgGvs9aHX8cRJA.text: WOW!! I was really blown out of the water by this more authentic Tex-Mex restaurant!! I went in on Saturday where our experience started with a very friendly hostess. Even while the hostess was on the phone she made sure to address us and let us know it would be just a moment. She took our name down with a "text when table is ready" system. She told us it would be an hour wait. We grabbed drinks at the bar, where we were served very promptly!   They have a nice waiting area next to the bar that has a sofa and some chairs so we took a seat and it wasn't even 15 mins before we had a text that our table was ready. As we walked into the main dining area I was pleased to see a very open, bright space! It's got a rustic feel to it and gosh the patio looks amazing, of course it was too cold to eat outside Saturday but I'll definitely be back to enjoy it.   Our server approached our table very fast and warmly welcomed us. He made sure to ask if it was our first time and it was so he explained the two salsas that they served and walked us through the menu. He was extremely helpful because the menu is a bit overwhelming.   We ordered a grilled pepper that was stuffed and a mix of tacos to share with a side of rice and beans. We enjoyed our beverages while we waited. The manager did come by the table and let us know our food would be ready shortly and made sure we had everything we needed.   Our food was a HUGE portion and I'm glad our server told us that items were large enough to share! The grilled stuffed pepper was my favorite, very smokey flavor. The tacos were great flavor but I'm not a fan of the corn tortillas. Wish they offered both and if they do then that should be asked when ordered. I also thought the tacos were a little small for the price. This was really my only disappointment in our experience.   Our server came back to check on how often and boxed our food for us. I would suggest this restaurant looking for real Mexican flavors in a little nicer setting! Y'all really should check this spot out :) it's a great addition to Southend!

0aKE7f3THzXcWCzV4BkwZQ.text: This has definitely been a hot spot since it came to Charlotte and I finally got a chance to check it out today.  My company did a staff lunch with a group of 18--Superica does not take reservations and your whole group must be present to be seated. They handled our large group with grace and had us seated quickly. The service from beginning to end was phenomenal, shout out to our super-waitress Nicky!  The chips and salsa to start were great, really salty which is my favorite. They serve two different salsas, options are always good. We also ordered guac and queso. The guac was super fresh with huge chunks of avocado--it didn't last long on the table.   Most of our group ordered from the lunch special section where you get your choice of two items (plus rice and beans) for $11.99. Just a heads up, the portion size for lunch is very large. The soup especially is served in a bowl regardless.   I ordered the soup and chicken suizas enchilada and could not speak more highly of it. It was really flavorful. We had the tres leche cake for dessert and it was ah-maze-ing. Please order that!

JgjJeouPy_7d1N2FmI8I3w.text: This place is quickly becoming one of my favorite Tex Mex places! Centrally located in South End it's super easy to get to and the space itself is massive with a large out door patio. Parking can be difficult as the only available spots are across the street in a metered lot. They do not take reservations, however we went out. A Friday night at 7 and were seated within 20-30 minutes, so I that as a win!  The margaritas are the jam. The OG and Tommy's are the two my fiance and I order regularly. Both are made with reposado tequila and the Tommy's is made with agave vs simple syrup which gives it a slightly sweater edge.  Food is delicious! According to my fiance the mole is amazing and probably done the the most authentic. I've had the skirt steak fajitas and the catfish...both are  very tasty! Needless to say we had nothing to take home. It was busy when we went and had to wait a bit for drinks, but we'll worth it. Will definitely be back for more!!

5k2JrhFfdLK-mB7S2WJMzw.text: Well, well, well - my long and exhausting search for a good Tex Mex spot in Charlotte ended tonight. Superica knows no peers in Charlotte. This place stands on a hill all her own.   After a long beatdown type of day at the bank I refused to cook. I pulled up my Yelp and scrolled through local digs. In the mood for Tex-Mex, Superica caught my eye.   Located in a vintage warehouse looking location Superica's ambiance provided plenty of stimulation for the eyes. I loved the decor of the place and the vibe.   Oh yeah...the food rocked!   I ordered the "Parilla Deluxe" (Grilled Steak, Chicken and Shrimp Fajitas) and the "Pollo Con Mole" (Chicken Enchiladas smothered in a delicious mole sauce). Both dishes sizzled with spices, flavor and freshness. I only wish they increased portion sizes. I just couldn't get enough of this food. Even the Salsa surprised me. The flavor profiles on their salsas, look, listen - I can't even really describe it. You've just got to try it.  The servers and bartenders here are also really nice and attentive. Tanner was especially nice and great at her job! You rock Tanner!!  You're not going to get better Tex Mex here in Charlotte. Is this place better than Tex Mex in Texas? No Sir (Or Ma'am), but it's clear winner in this town.n

yzpxYJ9RO2pOgcjndsQIZA.text: I wanted to try somewhere new and exciting for my 30th birthday dinner, and my husband and I landed on Superica. I'm so glad we chose this spot to celebrate this special occasion. Our server (whose name has slipped my mind, unfortunately) was fantastic - super attentive, friendly, and helpful as we navigated the menu. The space itself was super-spacious -- not sure what we were expecting, but wow -- ample space for smaller, intimate groups or large parties. We didn't go outside but the patio area will be a great option when we're back in the warmer months.   We started our meal with the classic chili con queso, which was everything I expected it to be - cheesy gooey goodness. Next time I want to try the Queso Fundido, though I suspect this might be a better option for a small group, rather than 2 people. The salsas that are brought out for every table free of charge were also super yummy, and also pretty unique -- we particularly enjoyed the avocado-based dip.    My husband and I both tried the tacos for our main course and ordered three apiece, plus beans (black beans for him, refried for me). I tried the Tacos de Barbacoa (SO yummy - probably my favorite), the Tacos Al Pastor (very close second -- made with pork belly), and the Shrimp Tacos Dorados (reminded me of a small quesadilla in how it's served, also quite tasty).   Pro tip: parking can be a little tough to find in this area as there's not a designated lot, but street parking is free after 6 pm.   Overall, I highly recommend this place and look forward to our next meal there!

0EBQWx9lnjd_LCBpF43dHA.text: I have been wanting to check out Superica for a bit now and finally got the chance this past Saturday. So glad we came by as Superica could quite possibly be the best Tex Mex in Charlotte!!!  We came on a Saturday and there was about a 30 minute wait, which wasn't too bad! The space is pretty large and open!  We both ordered the house level marg and they were quite delish! We were immediately brought out a basket of chips and two different types of salsa....one was a green tomatillo avocado salsa and one was a roasted tomato salsa. Both were insanely good. The avocado salsa was my favorite!  We started with the chorizo queso. I should say that I'm lactose intolerant, so if a queso isnt "worth it", I stop eating it. This queso was AMAZING. There was something about it that was unique compared to all the other quesos in the city.   My husband and I split the mixed fajitas. It came with steak, chicken, and bacon wrapped shrimp. Before I go into this meal, I wanna say that I am SO glad we split. The portion was really big and we both left so full. Ok, back to fajitas. The fajitas came with these nice warm tortillas, cheese, guacamole (absolutely delicious guac!), pinto beans, and lettuce. All the meats were nicely cooked. I think the steak may have been my favorite! The bacon wrapped shrimp were huuuge! The fajitas were made even better with the garlic butter sauce. All the flavors were just amazing. Just took fajitas to a whole new level!  If I HAD to give one small critique, it would be the beans. There was probably only one tablespoon of beans in our cup and the rest was just bean sauce. Though with that being said, I put the bean sauce on my fajita and it was amazing tasting ha.   Overall, insanely fantastic meal!

0fv4-pHJCSRUPeDHSgHXCA.text: Four stars and I'd add another 1/2 star if I could. The food was excellent! Great flavors all around. The starter chips and salsa are great. Our waitress reccomended mixing the Avacado & Tomatillo salsa with the Roasted Red Pepper salsa and the combination is super flavorful. I had the Tacos Barbacoa , beef brisket on a flour tortilla with queso fresco and cilantro.  Add a side of really flavor packed beans and rice and the dish was stupendous! Every thing was great. The only issue is parking, and you need to be patient, get lucky or be prepared for a short walk. I really enjoyed the food and I ll definately return!

42WCYmxODjcEnkyN4zJ-xg.text: I loved this place.  The salsas were unique but very good.  The queso was excellent and everything we tried for our main meals were soooooo good!! I had the Barbacoa tacos and they were delicious. Tender meat, great flavor, served at the perfect temperature. Others tried the skirt steak fajitas and cheese enchiladas and both were awesome.  They served bottomless rice and beans family style to the table which was a nice change from the traditional.   Our server was friendly and there were so many other items on the menu I would love to try.  We waited over an hour so be prepared as this place will likely stay packed for a long time.  Parking is a little tricky if you don't want to pay. Overall, great experience. Can't wait to come back. I highly recommend.

lbPEOJWlNgRKj5WKaJV2vg.text: Great atmosphere, good appetizers, bad entrees. Went there twice.  Carne Asada - $36 for a piece of burnt meat Gulf Red Snapper - tasteless deep fried fish

19_IbGzmHmUhFQLsTWl9og.text: I was really psyched to try Superica and we decided to go there for our monthly "Girls Night." The place is really neat inside - it's very Tex Mex and you can see that in the theme. The menu is a little pricier than I was expecting for tacos, and I was hoping to be able to order tacos a la carte. Be aware - you cannot do that. I ordered the tacos al pastor. I ended up being served shrimp tacos. Honest mistake, and the kitchen remade it for me. Our service was so good throughout the whole things that I'm not even concerned about the mix-up. When I did get my al pastor tacos, I didn't find them to be that great, to be honest. I've had a lot better and also paid a lot less for them. I'm giving Superica the benefit of the doubt because they're new. I hope they are working out some kinks, and I look forward to trying them again soon!

Qw3YA7TttP8EyNVQ2DHstw.text: Yesterday, me and my super cool wakeboarding friend Scott went with a group to celebrate the 23rd birthday of our good friend, Tony, the Hitman whatever the hell his last name is. u0cFUM8N2H5hvEQZBENdaQ.text: Many thanks to our amazing server Megan who helped make our day after a long day of travel ending in Charlotte! Margaritas were sooo good and much needed!

2goZK-Q2UJHts3hho5tuww.text: Food was great. The steak in the taco was super tender & juicy. Our server Ashley knew the menu very well & gave great suggestions. Will definitely return. My friends mention the OG Margarita was strong but tasty.

aZm68IzcfMCAscnLkk34Cg.text: As an avid Lunazul drinker, Tommy's Margarita never disappoints. And if you're sitting at the bar, ask for Meg. She always takes great care of us and genuinely seems to love her job, which is refreshing.

WtdTosiJunkddMRLg2cnjw.text: I'm a super fan of anything and everything Tex mex. If you are too, then this is the place you need to go. I got their enchiladas and their quest dip. They were amazing.
