EKLSizeFz5etRTXBRayQgg.text: A red neon sign blinks near dusk on Worthington in South End: Tex-Mex Superica. You turn the corner to enter a massive, former textile mill turned into a dining area that has retained the openness of the former industrial center. The design is different shades of white, brown and orange with a wood floor for accent. A projector plays Pixar's Coco on a large wall separating the bar area from the main dining room. Neon signs hover over different areas pointing to "el bano" and "el patio." The wait staff are dressed in chambray shirts; some waitresses are sporting red bandanas, completing the homage to Rosie the Riveter.   The menus are designed with fonts that seem plucked right out of the limited imagination of a millennial advertiser's idea of the southern United States border during the mid-twentieth century. Prices of entrees range in the low teens to the $35 short rib tacos which are highlighted because once they are gone, they are gone. The alcohol is also marked up to a laughable degree. Typically, a 24 oz. can of Tecate from the convenience store will set you back about $2.25. At Superica, 12 oz. from a Tecate can is $5.  Chips and the fire roasted salsa as well as avocado tomatillo salsa verde ("a mouthful, I know," the waitress says) are offered free of charge. And, to be clear, the fire roasted salsa is the star of this whole bizarre experience of cross-cultural signifiers. It's beautiful and fresh. A kick without being overwhelming. From there, the tacos de barbacoa entree offers no added value. If anything, it diminishes the experience even further. The barbacoa is sliced in thick slabs and served in corn tortillas that seemed like they should've been placed in the fryer to become chips rather than the base of a main course. On top of the barbacoa, the bright minds of the Superica kitchen (which has locations in Houston and Atlanta) added, in True Tex Mex fashion, a heap of cole slaw to the top of the taco. However, this slaw overwhelms the dish and fumbles out of the tiny tortilla as if it is the star whose shine is too big to be contained. The result is a taco platter that is fine but borders on insulting when you remember that you're about to pay $15 for three cole slaw tacos.   The Superica experience is one typical of high-end fast casual. It's a machine. Drinks, chips, entrees then the check come at you in less than an hour's time on a Friday night. A flurry of wait and bus staff zip around the expanse in a fluid, worker bee-like drone. It's all one perpetual motion that serves its well-heeled, well dressed young professional patrons before showing them out to nightlife that awaits around the corner. It's factory dining that hints at a cultural experience with prices that don't forsake the South End clientele's sense of aspiration. This is another place, like the neighboring Hawkers, where street fare is painfully curated into a product that projects the liberation of our palettes but is nothing more than a generic, mass commodity that keeps the street from which it arrived at arm's length.

kzNJfyA6U0-MoJA9uVd9Hg.text: I would give 10 stars if I could. This is definitely our go-to place since moving to Charlotte. It is always consistent and provides the best drinks and food. The chicken fajitas are the best I've ever ate. We usually sit at the bar because Mandy and Michael are the best around. The wait times usually go quick, but again, if you sit at the bar, you won't be disappointed - best bar staff ever!

vSvvViIFCJXpyOLvxsLZfQ.text: Best Tex mex in town!!  Fajitas are legit and the margaritas too!!  Never disappoints.

ggepX3PChU8uIe2gwxdAmg.text: The cheese dip is delicious! Also a big fan of the steak nachos. Usually a long wait if you go right at lunch or dinner so try to go early or later.

MBHJENJ84u_8Tfp6JmA2vg.text: I thought service was a bit slow, food took a while to come out (45 minutes) to be exact. But when it came out, boy oh boy were we satisfied. Ribeye, short rib, and and something else that came with steak and chicken, I can't remember cause the short rib and steak were sooooo good! So like I said, service was just eh, that's why the 4 star. But you don't go to a restaurant for anything else but the food, and they do their job very well. Go get you some!!!

PqJuP6U9ANO9GEpPQ-MIeA.text: Had the most amazing dinner tonight. Would definitely recommend coming here. Ask for Ashely Z. as your server.. she was amazing! Queso fundido was on point!

AEIx_05smGINSoaysX4cag.text: I love Superica!  If you are looking for an excellent place for lunch specials, this is it! They have an $11.99 menu that's so filling you will take food home. You choose two items from their selective list, but the portion sizes leave your table looking as if you ordered the entire menu. Today I ordered a salad, and it was so big yet so delicious! I had to take part of it home. However, I will say apart from other restaurants, and they load you up on chicken in your salad. I had a piece of chicken with every bite.   However, I must advise right now with the massive construction that's taking place in Southend. I would not recommend coming precisely at 12 or 12:30 pm. Either come before the lunch rush or after or ride the train. Seriously! Parking is BANANAS in this area and with the old parking lot turning into the new Lowe's building. I'm not sure when better parking will become available.  But aside from parking, don't let that stop you from the yummy goodness this restaurant offers. You will be so glad you stopped in.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

4VYgnyjK9NNXwdAIPsKWKQ.text: ok this. did. not. disappoint!!!!   I'm from TX, home to some great Mexican food, and this place was FAB! I ordered the Suiza chicken enchiladas.. they were great! (Esp if you like sour cream based dishes). We ordered queso for the table.. also super good with a nice kick to it! Ordered a pineapple marg (not frozen), didnt have a fruity taste but still alright. The chips and salsas were very flavorful as well.   Huge venue as well, so the wait wasn't too bad either. I highly suggest this place!! I have a new favorite spot in Charlotte!

YQLGMmz8rBh-kzGAu9-83Q.text: Everything thing about this restaurant is awesome! They place is a warehouse with huge ass windows and they didn't shy away from being in a warehouse instead they flaunt it shamelessly with large walls of murals, high ceilings and some oversized vintage furniture thrown in random places. The ambiance is polarizing, you might love it all or hate it completely.  Even though the restaurant was huge with lots of tables, we were asked to wait for about 30 mins - quite understandable on a Friday evening. They have a text alert system so you can leave your number and name and roam around and check out the beautiful neighborhood. We were notified and once inside our waitress escorted us to our table. You get complimentary awesome thin nacho chips and two sauces - we were famished from the waiting and rummaged through the first bowl and our waiter was kind enough to offer a refill!   The menu is stupid simple - love when restaurants don't torture their patrons with a hundreds of options to choose from. The Mexican dishes are standard- fajitas, tacos and enchiladas. Surprised to see the fried fish menu! We ordered some Fajitas and Enchiladas And the turn around time was quick. The food was hot fresh tasty and full of flavors. I especially loved the Mexican butter that came along with my Fajitas. BTW, the Fajitas are huge and if you are a couple it's definitely shareable.   This is a great restaurant that's definitely worth checking out - unique ambiance, great list of wines and cocktails, great tasty food and great service. My only gripes to this restaurant as others have mentioned are the car parking problem which if you go in circles around the block you would find a slot soon and the other problem being the large and loud halls makes quite conversations impossible.

qXVAmmexZ9c-ONmq3nSRbg.text: Great food. Great Ambiance. Great experience.   This tex-mex restaurant, located in the exciting south end area, made for a great Saturday afternoon lunch. During the day the dress code was casual and there was an abundance of seating. The ambiance of the restaurant was great with large windows and an out door seating area.   All guests receive a baskets of fresh tortilla chips and two different types of salsa (always a big sucker for the free tortilla chips). We ordered a bowl of queso to split amongst four people and found the size to be just right.   For the entrees we ordered: Tacos Al Pastor, The puffy taco dinner with picadilo (spiced ground beef) and the hamburguesa superica. All of which were very satisfying.   Seems like a great place for happy hour to grab a few drinks and eat some queso. Would definitely come back.

AcfuElivbtz7_LRagLAbuQ.text: Holy guacamole! This place is something special. My friend and his now wife hosted their wedding rehearsal dinner here and IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT. Where to begin? Cocktails - sure. The cocktails were out of this world. I went a little crazy on ordering them, but I regret nothing...  The O.G. - standard margarita but to the point - no mix here Mezcal Margarita - if you like smokey mezcal, get this drink (after ordering this I went on a mezcal kick for the rest of the night Light Rail - bourbon based drink with chili bitters (spicy and awesome) The Highwayman - an old-fashioned but with mezcal (my favorite drink of the night) Vampire Weekend - not just a good band, but a frappuccino-style horchata cocktail that was delish!  The guacamole was on point, flautas, tamales, you name it, it was delicious. They brought out some bone-in beef dish that was wildly satisfying. Geez. I wish I wrote this review sooner because I can't remember the name of it... anyway, I left super full and very tipsy (but thanks to uber got home safely, of course).  Cocktails - 6 out of 5... can I do that? Food - solid 5 out of 5 Service - 5 out of 5 (people are nice) Overall - GO HERE 5 out of 5

A7VF_BpY0MqKdHUxoaM-Rg.text: Superica is ... a grinning Luchadero in a purple mask with a Rhinestone cape and a feather boa that jumps off the ropes and presents you with a steaming platter of fresh made nachos only to reveal that they are Chef/Owner Ford Fry!! Whew - just like in the telenovellas!!  Okay, let's keep it simple ... so maybe they just wear a cape with an S on it. And actually I think Chef Tina Aleandri  oversees daily operations in the kitchen...   The scale alone here is impressive - two massive indoor sections plus a patio occupy a brick building the size of a warehouse. The ambiance is a little kitsch meets hombre who turns around and smootches cowgirl. The decor breathes life and energy into the space and just makes you feel good.   I have always had a huge crush on Tex Mex and this place I dare say elevates the basics, both ingredients and techniques, to a whole new level. From the Guacamole, to the fresh made/roasted Salsas to the secret spicy green sauce (wink, wink) you have to ask for - they are well crafted.  I had a really enjoyable lunch on a Friday with some of my bestest compadres. The Chicken Suizas Enchilladas were reminiscent of those my mom used to make growing up and really made me smile.  Then there's "La Paloma" - an amazingly refreshing drink made with Jimador Blanco tequila, fresh lime juice, salt and the Big Daddy of all sodas "SQUIRT"!  The servers here have oodles of personality and do a good job of paying attention to the details.  Yes, as many have noted, the food is on the pricey side - that being said, I think they have listened and offer weekday lunch specials for $11.99 now.   Give 'em a try and I bet you'll be hooked!

Lixcg4A9pTdrSNFxdK3dZw.text: After two recent visits to Superica, this is by far the best Tex Mex in Charlotte, and worth the hype that you've been hearing about.  My first visit was for drinks, specifically the frozen Margarita, and Queso. The Margarita was on point and although frozen, which people think is filling, it wasn't, and had a nice touch of Tequila. But, be careful, they can sneak up on you. As for the Queso, words cannot describe it. Cheesy goodness...and be sure to add the Picodilla!  My most recent visit was an evening on the patio. Of course we started with Frozen Margaritas and Queso, but enjoyed a good variety of food items, including the Fajitas, Puffy Taco and Chili Arellano. Everything was so good, hot, great flavor and good portions. The space is a lot larger than I thought and very inviting and service is top notch. If you're a Tex Mex lover, be sure to check them out. And, even if you think you aren't, you will be after a visit here!

moQcrB_6KM2g_6ohP5nrBg.text: Excellent experience at Suprica.We had a going away dinner/happy hour for a co-worker. We went on a weekday at 5 p.m. right when they opened. I had asked in advance if we needed to reserve a table or anything since there were 12 of us, but they don't reserve tables and said we would be okay at that time. And everything was good. There was plenty of space. We had people coming at different times and our server didn't seem to mind and was very accommodating.   While we were waiting for our while party to arrive, we dug into some apps. We did a chile con queso and queso fundido. The queso was one of the best I've had. The fundido was interesting. It was a stretchy cheese that you put on a flour tortillas and a spicy sauce that came with it. It was flavorful, but I enjoyed the regular chile con queso more.   For my meal, I ordered the picadillo enchiladas which came with rice and beans. Everything was good, but I did have food envy of some of my friends plates. The pricing is a little high, but the portion sizes are decent. I think there are decent lunch deals.   What I most liked was our service and they handled a large group well.

E_1Hrecb3doSQdkTXSEvtA.text: Came here for dinner and we only had to wait 15 mins or so. We sat inside at a cozy table. I was with three others and the only one that has actually been here. One thing I wish they did was to go over the salsas they had and explain the hot sauce on the table to others.   Our server was ok. She was attentive at first but disappeared afterwards. We ordered our food and started with the queso fundido. The queso was good and thick and creamy at the same time. The warm tortillas really added a nice touch to it. We each ordered our meal-we mostly got tacos and enchiladas with rice and beans. They were all good. But, our server was missing. Our drinks were seriously low.   When we were ready to leave we asked for 4 boxes. It took her over 10 mins just to get that to us and when she finally came, she only gave us 3 boxes. We had to wait again for the extra box and the check. Me and my husband were together and we told her that but it took another 10 mins for her to get us our check and the box and she put us separtely for our checks. She never came back to pick up the credit cards but someone else did.   Overall, the food is good but the service can be better. They get so busy so I'm surprised they don't try to turn their tables quicker.

7ooxZfIWcohp4OsMPH2Pgw.text: Although Mexican isn't my favorite international cuisine, I do crave it every few months. When the cravings hit nowadays, I usually think Superica.   This time, I had the "Picadillo", the more generic Beef Enchilada meal. It wasn't as fancy as the "Puffy Hard Taco Dinner" that I had last time, but every bit as delicious. What's more, I had the most sensational drink ever, "Vampire's Weekend". Absolutely LOVED it!!  From its big, lofty ambiance, to an intoxicating menu of drinks and even a slightly eccentric menu of Mexi/Tex-Mex specialties, this place has what it takes to please just about any diner! Did I mention that this place even offers rare, non-traditional menu items (for a Mexi/Tex-Mex restaurant, that is!) like Hamburgers and Short Ribs??   So...again, it was another great dining experience here at Superica...and am sure to return soon!

OO_bNrr85iAEfufU2ZhWpw.text: Oh my dear Superica! The Keto dieters of the world appreciate your accommodations.   This was my first time being able to get into Superica. Nights and weekends are typically a packed house. After a friend shared her negative experience at Superica, I decided to try it for myself. I'm glad that I did.  The space is beautiful, rustic and equipped with 2 bars, including a beautiful outdoor patio space. It's located near the light rail which makes it a convenient stop if you're hanging out in Southend.   The hostess' personality left a bit to be desired. However, the waitress made up for what the hostess lacked by being very accommodating.   The food was absolutely amazing. It was, by far, the best fajita chicken that I've had in Charlotte. It's a basic dish but Superica elevates it with a dry rub smoked chicken that will have you coming back for more. The fajita meal with no tortilla or rice and extra guac salad is a great option for Keto dieters.   And then there's the margaritas. I'm a fan of a good margarita. While I'm not a fan of the Superica's glass size, I am a fan of The OG and Tommy's Margarita.

rv_WYHztPWhpCNmmGLP1yQ.text: What a wonderful place with excellent margs, food, and vibe!! We came on a Tuesday night and were sat immediately but the crowd was steady throughout the night. I don't give 5 stars often- and Superica deserves it! Go if you are debating it!  Our service was WONDERFUL- our server was so friendly and attentive throughout our entire experience. There was also another server who saw our table was just recently finished our glasses and came right over to inquire about ordering more.  The decor was so different but so neat! There was a lot to look at. I also loved the area that the bartender was at. The outside patio I wish we could have sat at but it was HOT!  They gave complimentary chips and salsa which was amaaziiing!!! I had the beef and vegetarian (guacamole) tacos on a puffy shell which is kind of like a chip. I normally prefer bowl type Mexican foods and this was the closest thing I could find and I didn't regret it!!  The only complaint about the margs were that the glasses were small- but the content was heavy!!! I think a pitcher would be a great addition to this restaurant.

YFXfY5KGfI_EV-llDBYLqw.text: Just not a fan and here is why.  For me, it's mostly about the food.  I also factor in atmosphere and service.  The atmosphere was really great.  The service was average.  The food was not up to my standard.  I ordered the lunch special with a chicken enchilada with mole sauce and a cup of the chicken soup.   Normally, I love sopa de pollo in Mexican restaurants.  This soup had a dark broth and was more salty than the Atlantic Ocean. At first, I thought it was beef broth, but they assured me is was chicken broth.  I have just never seen chicken broth so dark.   The enchilada with mole sauce was okay, nothing special.  It was served with re-fried beans with pork.  I don't eat pork, so I left the beans on my plate.  I also like unsweetened tea with sweet and low.  They didn't have sweet and low.  No, i do not like Splenda or Stevia!   I love this part of town and am so happy there are a lot of restaurants.   This one could tweak their recipes and provide a different culinary experience.  The bar area looked alluring and I can imagine this place is hopping in the evenings.  I am not into hopping, however.  I am into great lunches.  That just didn't happen today.  Just the opinion of one.

6RaioVytPhIeLwr6f8Hq3Q.text: Yesss !!! So glad I went back for a second round!! Everything you want in a dining night out. Seated quickly, greeted by the manager, John. He was so welcoming and accommodating of our birthday girl. Sadie our server kept up with our requests for the amazing salsa and was the perfect mix of checking in often but not too much.  The food was on point, delicious, served pretty quick, and hot. I had mentioned our birthday girl is expecting when I checked in  and mid way through dinner Sadie brought  her up over a mocktini. This was in addition to the tres leches birthday cake and card addresses TO the birthday girl by name. Lots of thoughtful touches, great service and of course great food and atmosphere. The original opening glitches have DEFINITELY been worked out and we will be back! Thanks Superica!

BlJ2rC-ugMTG4tCOVPMy5A.text: Good atmosphere but food was so average. Overpriced for the food we got and we left wondering what we paid 50$ for. Also the beer was 6$ and absolutely tiny. Probably never coming back.

2vQNPhWaqL24mJSdVXiEPQ.text: The waitress was great, but the wait was HORRIBLE for less than impressive food. I don't believe I will return. I don't know what was going on in the kitchen, but we arrived at 11:45 and didn't leave until 1 and started eating closer to 12:30. That's ridiculous.

5U3x7BH26xj1Z1TRag3WfA.text: Love love love Superica, great for lunch or dinner!  They do not offer reservations so if you have a large party I would suggest planning ahead if you're going at a peak time.  They do offer a large area of outside seating while you wait in the courtyard, we typically order a drink at the bar and have some chips and salsa out there until we are seated.  Their Fajitas are the best, worth the price for the portion size and quality.  We also love their Enchiladas, guacamole and both types of queso they offer.  A Tex-Mex favorite!

UyiN0aB0-E3voX0EsSEVOQ.text: Tried Superica for the first time. The salsas were amazing. They definitely fit the Tex mex style. I split the steak, chicken, and shrimp fajitas with my mom. It was plenty of food for the two of us. The meat was very tender and had great flavor. Highly recommend! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars was due to service being slow to clear plates, pre bus, etc. but the guy seemed busy and maybe new. Food came out quickly though.

gO0HnDTa_U9B5D0yfvvUXw.text: Every time I come here it's packed and that says a lot. The most recent time I was lucky enough to grab a bar seat. The cocktails were amazing! I've been on a Paloma kick lately and I love that you get a squirt bottle w your drink. I had a great time meeting Meg and she was an amazing bartender, so friendly and very helpful navigating the menus. I've always had great experiences at this restaurant and recommend it all the time.

qC6svpL2IXTY-xwIkvKV7w.text: Overall not impressed. The wait staff was friendly but it seemed none of them knew what they were doing... someone other than our waitress always brought our food and/or drinks and every single time it got delivered to the wrong table first. Not to mention we were there for over two hours (not by choice). I'd let all of that go if the food was amazing but sadly, it wasn't. I got the Al Pastor tacos and it consisted mainly of over fried pork fat.  Margaritas were good though! I'll give them that..

elWpvIPiw8o0TEDbN8Vx9A.text: The customer service was terrific! So good, I had to ask for the correct spelling of her name... Sarah Rodkey! My friend was GF. Sarah was incredibly helpful with suggestions to make a couple of changes here and there- instead of the regular rice and beans offered with the meal, she suggested black beans and brown rice- it was delicious.  We both had the shrimp tacos with corn tortillas, so good it will be hard to stray from this choice the next visit. Ohhh, the Guacamole. They nailed it...finally a Tex Mex restaurant in Charlotte that knows what their doing.  The salsa duo with super thin chips (my favorite) was on point and a great start to our lunch. Really fresh, great food in a cool, hip warehouse  in Southend. Can't wait to get back and try the margaritas.

FR26XcCeTgtTb9zWn-2cgA.text: The queso with chorizo, guacamole, and sour cream are to die for with their house made tortillas. I could eat that as a meal. This place can get pretty busy sometimes but the food is worth it. Also their margaritas are pretty good and strong. Sometimes they have blood orange ones that are amazing but not always available and on the menu.

as6ERCof3ZSbep2nzYTNtA.text: Superica is amazing, partially because it is about 100 yards from my house and then because it is just amazing. We've been 3 or 4 times now, including brunch.
