We might give it another shot, but we will wait a few months at least. I hope you make it!

wb8O0XYjDPFdPRbMxwlmtQ.text: Went here for the first time tonight and had an experience I've never had to deal with at any other restaurant. Now don't get me wrong, the food was excellent.  Me and two friends were seated in the back by the kitchen and out of nowhere during our meal one of the busboys sizes up at us. He is standing on other side of the restaurant at the end of the tables where we were sitting, we are at our table and he throws his hands up and says you got a problem, towards my friends and I.  He continued  to do so til one of my friends told him to come to where we were if he thought there was a problem. He continued mouthing off and goes over to bar area talking about us to the bartender not far from us. Apparently the busboy must be a homophobe and thought me and my friends were looking at him while we were there, mind you they sat us by the kitchen so everyone passed us as they come out the kitchen and we have no choice but to notice everyone that passes. By far the worst experience I've ever had at a restuarant since living in Charlotte, NC. We did nothing to deserve such treatment. Made us feel very uncomfortable and not wanted at the establishment.  It was unprofessional and that individual does not need to be working directly with the public. Apparently if you are gay or have a friend or family member that's gay this may not be the place to go because they have a homophobic busboy on staff there that shows issue with lifestyle choices. Sad experience for a restaurant with good food.

4BIZtXh0eGEqfnCRfF-aQw.text: Visited for first time this evening and I have a new favorite.  Both food and service were very good.  The only down side is that it's very loud, very difficult to carry on a normal table conversation.

gc9Q8cIjBZTfd0V78HPV7g.text: First this place is HUGE! There is so much room for you and many friends. second the food is amazing. Perfect place for lunch with co-workers or friends. The service is great and fast. Only bad things is the lack of parking. The bar is pretty extensive. However I do not hold that against them and it will not stop me from returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

B6r3ep7-17K61Bs3uHg2AA.text: Fantastic TexMex food, and great margaritas. Service is solid and they do a good brunch. Take out takes a little bit of time, but no complaints since everything is made fresh. Our go to spot.

Vb5fgTlB4f2QgP7lPIf0Ig.text: I don't know why this place is so popular because the food is SO greasy. The menu sounds great but it's been extremely greasy the two times we went. Won't be back.

OKy3qWJr9rtnGsijct_0mA.text: Popped into this place on a Saturday afternoon. My date and I were seated extremely quickly. Superica has two different types of complimentary salsas. Both were delicious, but the spicier of the two was my favorite.   Our waitress was patient with us as we looked through the menu. The prices skew toward the pricey side. This isn't your neighborhood Chilis. I had a difficult time deciding between their brunch menu and regular menu.   We ordered the shrimp tacos (comes with rice and beans) and the queso fondida with chorizo.   FYI: For those who don't eat pork, the beans are rendered down with pork.   Everything is served family style. The food is GOOD! If you're a cheese lover, the queso fondida is AMAZING! Order it!!!   I can't wait to try their brunch menu.

B5iVIAIZx6OBtZVI_KdaxA.text: Best salad in Charlotte!  Best pancakes in Charlotte!  Wow, this place hit the mark.  Been here for brunch, lunch, and dinner.  All meals were fantastic!  Sadie is a wonderful waitress!  Wait at dinner can be long, but that's cause it's worth it!

7ELw5cxjilzBjF5kede0EA.text: Really dope spot! The steak fajitas were amazing! You could cut the steak with your fork.  Try the cheesy puffy taco as a side.  The two salsas they bring out with chips are really solid. Go with the chorizo, queso fundito if you're looking for an app.  They also do a great brunch.  Anything with their brisket is worth a try.  Spicy margarita has some kick to it...in a good way.

5URfXzpx-AaOrB4Qaz1RvA.text: I so want to give this place 5 stars, but he inconsistency in the service unfortunately took away one star. But, the food is simply amazing. In my opinion, the best Tex Mex in Charlotte. I've been here almost once a week since they've opened and tried multiple enchiladas, fajitas and tacos, but the fajitas are without a doubt my favorite. Fresh, flavorful, and simply delicious. There is enough for 2 people, so do share. Also, the chips are thin, crispy and salty, which is what I love and both Salas taste fresh and are amazing. I haven't eaten anything that I wouldn't order again, which says a lot. Enjoy!!!

CmTzqkqbSAAwnl7EMmFXIQ.text: Amazing! I was visiting from San Diego, CA and so have high expectations for Mexican food. The fish I got was great, tasted mole sauce from some enchiladas which was also stellar. Very impressive!

iC99E9VVpDXo6xBR4OYqEA.text: Everything was amazing! The fresh salsa, ceviche, bottomless rice and cheese covered beans, the salad. The tortilla soup however was too salty.

RLcPq4gd-8afdVry5MFgFg.text: Love this place!! I am a huge fan of the Superica in Altanta so was very excited to check out the new Charlotte location and it did not disappoint! The food is amazing and the service is excellent but the drinks are the best part! I visited on my birthday and was given not 1 but 3 sweet dishes to try! Highly recommend.

_i2lCqvBuBfkx7ox1JBXWQ.text: Boyfriend and I came here for an early dinner before going out. We came in at 5:30pm and were sat right away. The place was quiet when we arrived , but pack at around 7pm when we left. We were greeted right away and brought over complimentary chips and salsa (darker spicier one was our favorite). Our server recommended us some drinks and my boyfriend got a tequila cocktail with squirt (not sure the name). Waiter gave us complimentary guacamole with chips. The chips it came with were delicious. However the quac was mediocre and would not recommend to anyone for $9, I make better quac on the regular. We then split an order of the steak fajitas. Food came out quick and very hot! The fajitas came with bottomless beans and rice, but we did not get another order. A single order of the fajitas filled us up and left us with leftovers. The star deduction is for the end of the meal. Server took a while to bring the check and when we finally got it, an order of guacamole was on the bill. We did not order this and even refused when someone came to drop it off at our table, only to find out the waiter "gave it to us because they were working on their guac and wanted us to try it". I had to ask for it to be removed, which is no big deal. However, it took him a while to bring the new check. Finally we got the correct check and gave him our card immediately. 5 minuted Passes...more time passes.. we watch him drop food to the table next to us...we watch him talk to friends and drop drinks..no check. Probably 15 minutes of waiting for a check. Only downside. Otherwise , 5 stars for the food.

R5A-upbiBiOaN1ps520ozA.text: Don't normally write reviews but I was overwhelmed at how awesome this place was! The decor and vibe is awesome, the food and drinks are to die for and the service was top notch! Should put to Holland who was one of the best servers I've ever experienced!

LLCYn2Tm4ZEDNkS-JKY4AA.text: We are from Texas but moved to NC 2 years ago. Despite numerous attempts we have not found Tex-mex until Superica. Awesome. I feel like I am home!

OZwIbD7lvV56-0DXmbsItQ.text: Easily one of my new favorite places for tex-mex! Their staff is well trained and there is nothing on the menu that I don't like! The atmosphere is very nice and is perfect for a date night or a group of friends. They also have great lunch specials! The chips are light and crispy with the perfect amount of salt. The salsas are also delicious! (But be careful with them - the entrees can be hard to finish if you've filled up on chips).

iPhOHaMyps87BNbiMtDVlw.text: The best! I'm in love with this place and the food is outstanding! I had the brisket tacos and the flavor was intoxicating.

OydgbpJdxAocuoP4DuUt2Q.text: Was so excited to come here for dinner, the wait on a Sunday wasn't too bad and that was 30 min. After we ordered our food which we each ordered the shrimp tacos and my boyfriend ordered the brisket tacos it took 45 min before we got our food. He asked for no beans and just rice. When the food came out they gave us beans, no rice because they were out and the server said it would be at least 15 minutes because they were out of rice so we said okay. The serve came back after 15 min and said they are still out of rice and that it would be an hour so we still had a drink to finish so we said okay. After waiting we told the server to not worry about the rice because we saw other meals being delivered to tables that had rice. Not sure how a Tex mex restaurant can run out of rice but they did according to our server. We were seated at 715 and left at 9. The whole ambiance is really nice but it was crazy how long it took to get our tacos, 45 min was absurd. It seemed like there was a lot of help but we noticed our server stacking cups so it seemed like she was overwhelmed.

j9Yy0Oebntw_PMyLRshjvw.text: In a word Incredible! All around. The wait staff very attentive and on top of everything. Lauren was our person. She's great. The food, fresh. Nothing out of a box  that is reproduced. Great flavors.

eANDf4zawsY5Qet1RmQAJA.text: Came in for lunch today as a first time patron and would definitely recommend this place.  Nicely decorated and a great vibe all around. Great flavors in the tacos and enchiladas. Endless chips and 2 different kinds of their homemade salsa. The waitress (Sam I believe) was super friendly and knowledgeable. The staff was very attentive when drinks and chips need to be re-filled. Great experience all around!

HahMzjKn3bbdnk3nUcY9nA.text: Just GO HERE! Everything I put in my mouth was disturbingly delicious. We showed up at 830 on a Saturday night and they quoted us an hour and 45 minute wait. I was not deterred, and we went to OMB for a beer; 45 mins later our table was ready. The avocado tomatillo salsa and the smoky red salsa were delish. The classic queso was spicy, cilantro-y and velvety rich. I ordered ground beef tacos, which were everything I ever wanted in this life - crispy housemade shells, delicious picadillo beef, and all the right toppings. The BEANS. They are how refried beans should taste - and topped with blistering cheese. The RICE. Smoky, umami, perfect. My boyfriend ordered the carnitas which were actually pork belly fajitas, and they came with melted butter... with hot, fresh house-made tortillas. He died. Even the Dos Equis we had on draft tasted suspiciously delicious. It's like this place has made the perfect version of every tex mex food/detail there is. And I'm from Texas! I was skeptical y'all. But now I'm back home and dreaming of the day I can go back here! Go!

IQc-7Cqjisjrewp0l3RMbQ.text: The food here is excellent!... the service is slow and the bathrooms were not up to par.

HmdWFLmx1XkvxHMK5qM_jw.text: This place is a happiness trifecta! Food, service, atmosphere all make Superica a winner. It's easy to get hooked on the avocado salsa. Thank goodness they provide as much as you want. The enchiladas are also fantastic. And the service is always top-notch. Never had better service at any other restaurant. Corey was our server tonight, and he was exceptional! Superica is a MUST!

e_3hM-ecPp4M5uKkpOu1Hg.text: Just ate at the fabulous Superica tonight, and let me tell you, this place has it all. We were warmly greeted at reception (it was MOBBED at 6 pm on Saturday night and still reception was kind and welcoming, not overwhelmed or brusque) and were told the wait for two would be between 30 and 45 minutes -- we were seated in 25 minutes. The homemade salsas and chips were creative, flavorful and delicious, and were delivered immediately. We didn't order  much -- just two entrees: skirt steak fajitas and steak nachos  -- but they were the best of their kind we'd ever had. We had a clear sight line to the kitchen and the pass, and the manager (John) has such a well-run shop that every dish was whisked away by a runner almost the moment it was placed on the pass, so every dish was delivered hot and fresh. The restaurant itself is beautiful -- industrial high ceilings with huge windows and the space is beautifully utilized. It was completely full, yet the noise level was more than acceptable. But all these terrific individual elements were brought together in perfect harmony by our fantastic waiter, Cassie -- She was warm, engaging, extremely quick and professional but perfect in every way. She made us feel like we could sit there forever -- with no alcohol ordered, no appetizers, no dessert -- and she was more than happy to have us there. That, my friends, is True professional service, and I have found it in very few places. (Shout out to John, the manager, as well, for his attitude was exactly the same as Cassie's.) We can't WAIT to go back to Superica!

gPpbXWY_NOpbfvE4Tlu5nA.text: I had the best lunch here today.  I met a friend at noon and we were seated immediately.  It was popular but the space is large to accommodate the crowd.  We debated whether to start with guacamole or ceviche and went with ceviche. When our waitress brought the ceviche she also brought us the guac to try.  Both were really good but the ceviche was so fresh and delicious.  Just then right spice.  I had the salad with chicken for my entree.  Also, really good.  It was really fresh, just the right combination and balance of ingredients.  Our waitress brought beans and rice but I couldn't touch them after so much food.  My friend said they were delicious.  Service was also really good.  Our server was training someone which can sometimes be distracting but this was not.  I am really happy they have come to SouthEnd- a great addition.

sfcXStJMfRquwAfuH0P6cQ.text: Having lived in Atlanta, we were thrilled to have a Superica open right down the street here in Charlotte, and it is as fantastic as we remembered. The food is amazing (fyi, the entrees are generally family style and huge, so very shareable between two people), the drinks are a perfect complement, and the space is stunning. Great for groups or a date night. Hope this is the first of many Ford Fry establishments in CLT!

Yx7zt6rvQt-Cldg18YSsYw.text: Sooo good. Tried the enchilada and hard taco lunch special. Great atmosphere with a lot of seating and unique decor. Definitely coming back.

w9OBXI6KSl4zkW8PiX66Sg.text: Feast for the senses!  I chose an off-peak time so I could scope it out.  Very fun decor and friendly wait staff.....and prompt service.  Two rooms of tables each with a bar.  They make their own salsas....the ones that come with the basket of tortilla chips.  Delicious.  The Vampire Weekend cocktail is deceptive because you can't taste the Kraken dark rum, so it would be easy to down it like lemonade.  The sizzle in this sip is the homemade "horchata," a type of non dairy milk from rice and almonds spiced with cinnamon and nutmeg. Yum yum. The campechana was listed under "salads," so I was surprised that it was a chunky blend of shrimp, crab, avocado, and octopus served over tostadas.....seafood salad, I suppose.  It was served in a parfait glass so I poured it out over the tostadas and ate it like nachos.  An all together happy excursion into tex-mex.  This place would be a destination night out from any part of Charlotte, if fun and tasty matter.  Very casual.  Already thinking about what to try on my next visit.

T3S3-kOtWpWTfaNYY5V54Q.text: Such a big fan of this restaurant! I am obsessed with Mexican and Superica is such a cool new spot. The food and margaritas are great, definitely try the fajitas! I also love the aesthetic. I went here on a Bumble date and it was the perfect environment. Definitely highly recommend this place for date night or just dinner with girlfriends!

VZH06ugDujvSdcTsiGK68Q.text: Tried this place for the first time today and it was worth the wait....the portions are plentiful and everything tasted great. The only issue I have is with the service...my dining partner asked for double rice instead of refried beans...the server corrected only after we had our food and I pointed out the error. For the price point you'd think the servers would be a bit more attentive to their tables. I will give this place another try and hope the service is better.

X4wkEE7pgjAJ3gmHUXtSxA.text: This place is amazing!! Everything was super fresh, and the staff was very friendly! It gets very busy on the weekends, but it is worth the wait!

cYAB-awBCyEGTZH-44yGKg.text: This restaurant does not seem to fail. The margs are strong, the meat is on point, and they even crush the brunch game. The pancake is unreal. I will never not get it. (But just get 1, they're huge)

HL-hLcABOC-6GiI8cqI5pw.text: Food was delicious and drinks were beyond amazing!! But what I'm really here to brag about is the service. From the moment we walked in we were greeted by very attentive hostesses, our server (Joana) was so helpful and honestly an amazing server!! We had a few other people come by the table to bus, serve drinks, and I really enjoyed every bit of it. The staff gets an A+ from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

UFUwEue_2wfyxRFF1-5HrA.text: Bomb dot com! We eat here every week just about. We're going to give it a break though so we don't get bored of it.

IkBd8s2IGdKC6Fs-HtdiyQ.text: Delicious! A tad pricey for mexican, but it is high quality food.

WHrN5e4-qqHq0t_TEfy9_Q.text: Service was good but everything we had was just ok and it was too expensive for what you got. Not worth the hype in my opinion.

9mCT1pAgpd4QXWu04tQlvA.text: I'm going to be sad when everyone finds out how awesome this place is. Great fajitas, enchiladas,  tacos, queso - a fantastic service. It's worth the wait (if you have to wait).

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seriously...best beans ever...
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy rice
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Enchiladas...fantastic...rice ... and the best beans ever!!!

7FSH0lc7DUvXjEV2n04sVw.text: I went to Superica today with some friends around 6:00. There was no wait and they were able to seat us immediately, and we were greeted by so many employees there that welcomed us and thanked us for coming. We had a very comfy booth. The decor was great and I appreciated that there was a bartender in a designated area to just make drinks for the dining room. That guaranteed we got our drinks quickly!  First, the drinks. I ordered Tommy's Margarita. It was super tasty, but sooooo tiny. In 3 sips it was basically gone. Sad face.   Second, the queso. We were going to order both queso and guacamole, but the waitress suggested we order a different queso that had sausage, guac, and sour cream in it. That queso was incredible!!! I would go back just for the queso and chips.  The main meals were all good. I had the Carne Guisada. It was a stewed beef in a tasty sauce and two warm tortillas. It was very tasty, but I had no idea how to eat them. Do I put them in the tortillas and make a wrap? Do I use the tortilla as a spoon alternative? The tortillas were soooooo good. They felt like they made them right there. I wish they had brought out a plate instead of the wrapped tortillas and a small bowl of my meat served on a wooden tray. I had no place to mix them up or anywhere to put the rice and beans that were family style. I wish they gave more rice and beans for the family style. We were 4 people and were given the same amount one person would get at a traditional Mexican restaurant. Oh well. Everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy their food. My husband ordered Tacos al Pastor and loved them. They were kinda small, but he was surprised how filling they were.   The service was really fantastic. Our waitress did a great job of checking up on us, refilling our water, and giving us time to enjoy the experience. We paid our bill and then sat there for another 20 minutes catching up, and the wait staff continued to refill our waters and never once made us feel rushed. We felt bad when we left and saw a huge line of people waiting to be seated, but the staff never once made us feel like we were an inconvenience.   Overall, it was a good experience. It was a bit pricey, but I think I'd go back.

LcyTbqU1sC3zI7kBbCnrlA.text: Cool place, always on a wait for some odd reason , last night 18 tables open, the hosties said it would be 30 minutes to one hour wait,same situation the first time,  first visit  the chicken relano was tasty but second time the fajeta was bad, the meat was like chewing leather, chicken was dry, shrimp was  rubber and over cooked, beans did not have any flavor, it took twenty minutes to get our food, fayitas for 28$ what a joke, two stars for bar staff, helpful and friendly

hNTWQtk57bCiy2Isys09Yg.text: Best place to go for a birthday celebration, fresh tortillas, fantastic service, fun atmosphere.

IltxMJsV6U2jIj3xiAM1jQ.text: Was wondering around trying to find a taco shop. This place is a Tex mex location. I ordered three tacos, chicken, steak, and pork belly. They were delicious and they came with rice and beans. The bartenders were nice and cared about the job. The restaurant is relatively new.

4RBuyWt4EcajpQdTZ3tm3g.text: I can't tell you how much I love this place.  We always sit at the bar and the bartenders are amazing no matter how busy they are (which is almost always.) The Hot House is my go to drink.  We have had the deluxe fajitas (bacon wrapped shrimp!), enchiladas and tacos.  The fajitas are my favorite but everything we have had is delicious.  Can't wait for Strawberry Hill to open so it will be super close to our house.

Cs2elFFZk8c3PHaqYnZJcQ.text: Hit up on a road trip through NC and what a great place!  The staff was so helpful and pleasant, knew everything on the menu and how things were prepared.  I had the El Lopez and was so pleased with all the items especially the enchiladas.

VpHyVeacBUrMgEw0Pa0OLw.text: Loved the homemade salsas, never tasted anything like them before, and chips were so fresh, light and warm. The enchiladas were delicious.  My girlfriend who is use to Dallas, TX Tex Mex was unsure if she'd really taste True "Tex Mex" as she's had in TX but Thanks to Holland, our server, with his recommendation we had the best food and the best service in Charlotte!! Atmosphere is fantastic. People are great! Thanks again Holland! Will definitely ask for you next time we're are in town.

WfOH0mfgePCO52LK5o-xhA.text: Great service, food was on point, and really cool atmosphere! There's cheese on nearly everything (at least what I ordered) which is amazing. The food is not presumptuous like so many places in South End, it's True to what makes it taste great. Fun decor, beautiful plants around the restaurant, great lighting.

ZbZm-jKCsGN2e4AQlLoM_g.text: We went here for my friends birthday recently. The staff was amazing and helped her feel so special!  We ordered queso for the table, everyone had margaritas and most had enchiladas. Everything was delicious, staff was very attentive and helpful. Will definitely go back!

8eBnFePf_1GUThzjlouuQw.text: Wow! Drove down from Mooresville last Sunday 7/22. Arrived shortly after 12....plenty of street parking. The Food and Service were incredible. Cannot wait for the outdoor patio to open. Funky cool interior! The Queso Fundido was delicious and you can order from the full menu, even with Sunday Brunch underway. Our neighboring table ordered the cerviche and I wanted to pass my plate over for a serving! We had the Tampiquena and the Carnitas. 5 star to all. Get here now. Please open an outpost in Mooresville :)

pJK_lae-ZA_ALpAgulVBpA.text: The best Tex Mex I've ever eaten. Great atmosphere. Try the chili con queso for an appetizer. Margarita's are awesome.

EcqbgKSzHjsjekMj9ljY_A.text: After months of hearing the raves, we finally visited Superica on a Monday evening for dinner.  Hopefully you can score free parking on the streets, otherwise be prepared to pay a flat fee ($6+tax) for the lot across the street - I felt that was rather expensive.  Superica is casual and the space is attractive, but the experience left much to be desired. Apparently the section we were seated had the bartender as the server. Although I am going to seriously slam the service here, I want to make it clear that the guy was set up to fail by having to take care of tables while tending bar during dinner hour in a busy restaurant. It was 15 minutes after being seated that someone came to my table and asked if I wanted water and put down chips and salsa "while you are waiting for your server."  He did finally come and take our drink order - the house margarita was nothing to write home about and my tequila/chilled/up had so many ice shards floating in it, it quickly became very watered down. Kind of a bummer when you pay the premium cost for anejo. Service remained very slow.  I ordered the grilled chicken rellano and my friend got a combo type plate. Rellano literally means "stuffed". A more accurate description is that it is a deconstructed version, which is actually a little more diet friendly than a traditional rellano, but it just lacked any richness whatsoever.  The combo plate was just a huge plate of very heavy, greasy yellow cheese enchiladas and other tortilla-and-meat items with no remarkable characteristics that made us think someone would order it again. It also had a "puffy" tortilla with cheese sauce over it that did not get with our meal until (the manager?) passed through checking on tables and rustled up for us. We were credited some money on our check for that, but it did not change the fact that it was, again, not anything either of us would seek out again. The rice and beans were non-remarkable also. Maybe Tex-Mex isn't my thing. Application of fresh herbs,citrus, etc is the joy of good Mexican food. Everything we tried seemed to lack those elements.  I did not check the menu before we went, so in all fairness, had I done that I also would not have been surprised with how pricey it was. The food was little different than most Mexican chains, but easily 30% higher priced.

uyokFGvdd4LmuP-JneLAEQ.text: Have been wanting to try this place to see what all the hype was about.  Overall a very pleasant experience.  Didn't have to wait at all on a Sunday evening, the staff was pretty attentive, and the food was good.  Ordered the OG margarita which tasted very fresh and delicious, so always a plus in my book if you get a good marg.  The salads are also very tasty and very fresh! The milder one is the green one and made with avocado. And then they have a spicier (although not over bearing) option which was equally as fresh and you can tell they make them in house.  Chips also came out hot which is a bonus, and they replenish them for you.   I ordered the ceviche as my entree (listed as an app) and honestly was plenty for me as a meal, as I wasn't starving.  And it was absolutely delicious!  Comes served on crispy chips and is delightful.   Enjoyed the experience and would probably go back.

Bu0xYwGnD7t7C8tbPIu8bQ.text: To start, the chips and salsa are amazing.  You really need to combine the two they give you.  The best...I had the shrimp tacos... They were excellent...definitely coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

KE4PT_4SzhmJ_PN-PUcbHQ.text: It's rare that I feel that a place is five stars right from the jump. The first time we tried to have dinner at Superica, on a Saturday,the wait was more than an hour and we left. Cut to the following Tuesday, my coworker and I decided to pow wow after work and I suggested we try Superica again. We had back up plans prepared just in case. Turns out we were super lucky to be seated right away and we secured awesome parking easily, too!   The atmosphere was very different than other places in Charlotte. We joked that there should have been tumbleweeds crossing on the video that was playing on the projector. The restaurant has great attention to detail from the complimentary matches to the beautiful bathrooms.   We each ordered a drink and got down to business with the menu. The sangria was not very strong but I would recommend their house blended margarita. Sneaky, sneaky. One more and I would've been giggly all night.   I love that we received chips and salsa to start. The chips were crisp and thin, both salsas were fresh and added flavor to our meal. The presentation of the salsas with descriptions of each was a nice surprise. Not just a filler item, no stale chips and jarred salsa here. We each ordered fajitas with queso fundido to start. It was an insane amount of food. You are definitely getting what you pay for and can choose to share an order of fajitas between two people. The mixed fajitas with shrimp would be my top choice for the shrimp alone! Each shrimp has a sliver of jalapeno tucked into the backside and then wrapped in bacon and I'm assuming deep fried. Ooh... just give me those skrimps! The queso is worth the hype and is great on its own but there are options for toppings. Both plates came with warm tortillas. The fajitas come with an array of toppings, rice and beans with cheese. Do not skip the beans. I "don't like" beans. Mm-hmm. Not anymore. Superica's refried beans are topped with cheese and popped under the salamander to become a melty, toasty, dip-able side. Friend, turns out I like refried beans.   Make sure to check out my picture of my to go box. I'm not kidding when I say I had a ton of food. I went home with enough to eat another meal. We spent a pretty penny: $108 before tip for two with an app, 2 meals and 4 cocktails. And still I say I can't wait to come back!   P.s. My food was so good, I somehow wound up using my pants as a napkin and I still didn't care. Take that as you will.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso fundido
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak and chicken fajitas

Ba4LHl2GlCZsWl3pVNKejQ.text: This is one of my new favorite restaurants in Charlotte. We went for my birthday and ordered the classic chili con queso, ensalada de la casa, and vegetable enchiladas. The chips here are incredible (thin with just the right amount of salt) and they give you two different salsas for dipping. The salad is ENORMOUS and I was able to get two meals out of it. We constantly talk about how good this place is - definitely worth checking out if you haven't.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable Enchaladas
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. House salad
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. House salad

KSN-2bvj7Rf1q5G6D-sjGQ.text: Sunday evening date night with my hubby. No wait but we sat at the bar. I haven't been here before but Hubs has and said it was good. Ordered two drinks to start, a Light Rail and a Highwayman - Highwayman was like a mezcal old fashioned, interesting but good.   Ordered flautas for an app, the portion is pretty large and the food was good. As soon as the app arrived we ordered our dinner, chicken enchiladas. Not even 30 seconds later a guy comes by to give us our dinner. We both said that it's what we ordered but no way it was ours as we had literally just ordered 30 seconds prior. The food runner said "well do you want it now or hold off a little?"  We asked for more time and the entree came as we finished our app. Obviously not our food when it came to us the first time (probably a entree that they didn't mean to make and were trying to just get it out).   Super disappointing and really put a sour on the evening. We finished our food and quickly paid. Not the bartenders fault, she was nice but I'm not sure if I'll be back

jQZ1fJGWwXZN6HDbLgHbUQ.text: We visited Superica of Charlotte yesterday evening to celebrate my birthday. I could go on about how wonderfully incredible the meal was, but instead I'd like to focus my review on the staff. Michael and his team are unbelievably honest. I left my purse, with my license, credit cards, cash, and a few sizable gift cards, behind at the restaurant. I didn't realize it until today, and called in a panic. The staff had found it and put it in a safe location for me to pick up. Every single item was in my purse when I retrieved it. If you want to support a restaurant that has delicious food and has honest, hard working, friendly employees, then Superica is your ideal choice. Thanks Michael and team. You made my birthday great and reinforced that there are super people in this world!!

TExXdKmZGBEQ8lmELlDdBA.text: This was my 1st time visiting. The chips and salsa were great! This is the 1st Mexican restaurant I've been to that doesn't offer a red based salsa, so I was pleasantly surprised at how good it was.   I ordered the 3 chicken taco option. I liked that you could mix and match the tacos for variety. I had 2 wood grilled chicken tacos which is basically chicken fajita meat and 1 fried shrimp taco.  My order came out wrong but it was quickly corrected. I had a corn tortilla shell for one with was horrible. Me nor my boyfriend liked the corn tortillas. For the other 2 I had the puffy shell which wasn't what I expected. My boyfriend raved about the hard taco shell and said it was the best he's ever had!   The tacos were good, not great. I hate to say this but I prefer Chipotle's better.   So I likely won't return. The vibe was awesome. I was just underwhelmed at the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos

uzr2zjOqMZwd8K0xwI-tSA.text: Hi Sean,   I hope this message finds you well! I am a resident of Charlotte and attempted to go to Superica in the southend neighborhood. I have never in my life been treated with such disrespect and lies. I approached the front desk and was told there was a 3 hour wait although there were numerous open tables. I asked about the open tables and was told I could leave if I didn't want to wait. I asked for a manger in which the person standing next to the hostess was represented by "the manger". He did not tell me his name and told me I could leave. I think your organization is a horrendous excuses for a professional business and the front of house staff needs a major overhaul. I work directly next door and am very sad you have chose people like this to represent your brand. You could do much better.

AKmWqceuocVsu2Gc4AOXRg.text: Great tasting food with a variety of menu options to choose from. Staff is quick with service and friendly. Prices are reasonable.

uYUtKOibkQ5BbPSIsp_0Tg.text: I have been wanting to go for a while because everyone who has been has told me how great it is. I finally got to go during lunch one day and we were sat right away. Service was so great! We had water, chips and salsa within 5 minutes of sitting.   The inside was an upscale western vibe with cool chandlers made from different/crazy recycled metals and awesome paintings. It was a great place for a date or a night out with the family. They even have some creepy crawlers for your kids to see while you wait for your table (Don't worry, its enclosed in a habitat).  One of my favorite aspects is that they had a lunch special. For $11ish, you can pick 2 from the list below: -NACHOS -ENCHILADA (choose: Cheese, Picadillo, Mole, Chicken Verde, Chicken Suizas, or Vegetable) -HARD SHELL TACO (Picadillo, Chicken Tinga, or Guacamole with lettuce, tomato, and cheese) -SALAD -SOUP (cup of Chicken Tortilla Soup or Pozole Verde) -TACO AL CARBON (pork carnitas with guava glaze, grilled chicken, or steak, with smoked onions on flour tortillas)  Is that a deal or what?! Definitely a great spot for your mid day lunch crunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

9Y77LwGty175buw0SZLJAQ.text: Great trendy Tex Mex!  I enjoyed Superica's puffy taco dinner.  I did not enjoy so much trying to gracefully eat it because it suffers from a plating issue.  A little larger plate would be nice so it doesn't feel as if the accoutrements piled high on the tacos are going to wind up all over the table :(   I did mention to our server as well so looking forward to this being rectified.  The potatoes that come w/the Carne Asada are huge wedge fries.  This makes them really soft in the inside w/no crunch.  If you like soft potatoes more like a cut up baked potato this is your jam.   Be prepared when ordering the guacamole taco it is literally guacamole on a taco shell.  The ground beef was seasoned well.  I would have liked a little sour cream on the side for the tacos.  I enjoyed the decor :)  Fair warning for Tex Mex this will shoot your grocery budget for the week!

hV5BaOcY5y3TtSNnKVtILQ.text: Amazing. The brisket tacos were phenomenal.  Get there before 6 or be prepared for some waits.

OgBM-92JWzC0219euMI5-g.text: I have been hearing the hype, so I was excited to have a girls lunch here today. In general, I would say it was good but not anything that blew my mind. Parking is its own beast here. I parked three blocks away and walked. The interior is beautiful - from the exposed brick to the high ceilings to the cool bathrooms (including the leather sign details). Also, every employee we interacted with was really nice, which is a plus.   Where this spot was less than stellar to me was the food. Chips and salsa were just okay to me. There was a weird residue on the chip that I didn't totally love (I know everyone raves about their queso, but we didn't order any). I thought the salsas were okay but nothing too amazing. We each ordered different variations of the lunch special. I had the chicken suizas enchilada and a soft steak taco. The enchilada was better than the taco mainly because of execution. The taco came with onions and the onions were mostly raw. I think they would've tasted better carmalized. The bottomless rice and beans were pretty good.   Overall, I thought this spot was good but not great. I wouldn't pick it as a spot to come back to on my own but if a friend wanted to come here, I wouldn't necessarily be opposed.

3fbJepyTZ6D9kmmTy13VpA.text: I've been here 3 times in three weeks - needless to say I definitely enjoy it!  They start the meal with two homemade salsas that are both very unique. They have a bit of a kick to them. We ordered the Queso to go along with the chips and love it! I don't eat meat so I didn't opt to add that in but it still has a great, rich flavor! And the chips are yummyyy.   Their menu is slightly limited and a little funky. I've only ever ordered tacos ... little overpriced and a little difficult to modify. They don't really give you many options and are kind of strict on mix/matching. However, all entrees come with rice and beans that are bottomless. Cool concept but it can be a little annoying having to ask for more frequently.   Margaritas have been hit or miss for me.. one of them I literally had to have the waiter pour sprite in it because the sours were wayyy too strong.   Atmosphere here is very fun, trendy, and unique! Its a perfect spot for dinner with friends, date night, or family brunch (I've done all 3 haha).   Overall, I really like it. But, I wish they had a few more options and weren't so limited in mixing the taco selections.

AxerZg0__XkI9XxFH951bA.text: Hola! Howdy! I'm usually not a fan of TexMex restaurants but this place is an exception. I was hooked after trying the chips & salsa...  the fundido is addictive and I'm told the steak and eggs is a favorite option for brunch (I don't eat steak so I couldn't confirm).  Definitely recommend this place. Good location, free parking limited but $5 for parking lot a few feet from restaurant.  Service was great! Bar is stocked and lots of seating available...

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

2WdsPbOCnhpL0k8WiWblDg.text: LOVE Superica! Fav place for mexican food! Salsa is incredible!  Service is always stellar and drinks are perfect!

MT41ZvKb-Y18aQYDDZxeRQ.text: Great place for drinks and food! I recommend getting the fajitas and splitting it. It feels two people comfortably. Great staff and yummy drinks

FSLQWCLC4Vo_RxGFiG6FZw.text: After a busy day, I ventured here with my hubby and a couple of friends for a nice dinner...  I must say, I really enjoyed their salsa options... very unique, very tasty, and who doesn't love bottomless chips and salsa?! My hubby and i split the Parilla Deluxe Fajitas, and thank god!  That was TRULY enough food for two people!  AND they'll bring you more beans, rice, and fixins as you need them... no muss, no fuss, no extra charge! Their drink menu was pretty good, and I was pleased to see a rose hard cider as I kinda wanted to try one!... it was yummy! :) I probably could've used a wheelbarrow to get to my car after dinner as the waitress conned us into sharing (4 ways) their decadent tres leches... I was stuffed to bursting!!  It was a little more expensive than I'd hoped, but that's never stood between me and meal with friends... this place is a nice addition to South End!

bReJM3aiR6nnvRU3RjkgDA.text: I absolutely loved Superica! I went on a Friday night at 6:30pm. We took an uber because the parking around there is tight. The wait was quite long but we were able to grab two spots at the bar. Even though the bartender was extremely busy she was very sweet, helpful, and attentive. We ordered the hot house cocktail and OG margarita. They were both strong and yummy. After the first round she made us a custom cucumber jalapeno drink which was amazing. To eat we ordered queso fundido, el lopez, and tacos de camarones. The queso fundido was thick and very salty. I loved the tortillas but wasn't a fan of the greasiness and saltiness. The Enchiladas, tacos, and puff taco that came with the el lopez were all amazing. They taste like familiar Tex Mex food but have their own identity still. The shrimp tacos were also very yummy. The rice and beans come as family style so they brought out a plate of each for us to share. I love this idea as I fell like so much rice and beans get wasted at Mexican restaurants and this solves it! If you want more, just ask and they will keep bringing it.   Overall, great night, great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. el lopez
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

7xX1K5LapSV_eHiixMsw4w.text: First things first, definitely make a reservation or come eat here when it's not super busy. My friends and I came around 7:30 and the wait was about an hour and a half long for a table for 4 people. The good thing is that there's places you can walk to to kill time. They text you when the tables ready so you don't have to worry about rushing back.   Let's talk about atmosphere: I loved the decoration of this place and it's layout. They have cute plants everywhere and couches where you can sit and chill. There's a bar right when you walk in so if you are going to wait it's perfect.   Food and drinks: I got the O.G. Margarita ($9) and it was pretty good - smaller than I expected but you can definitely taste the alcohol so it's nice to know they didn't skimp out on that. The bartender recommended us to get the Deluxe Fajitas and share ($28). So we did, and it was great! It came with bacon wrapped shrimp, chicken, and beef. I would definitely recommend that dish. I'm a big fan of fajitas and this is up there. They give you a side of butter with the fajitas and it's a real game changer! The free chips and salsa were great too! The chips were fresh and crisps - not to salty and not to oily.   Service: Our waitress was great! She was so nice and friendly. I believe her name is Evan. She made sure our chips were refilled and always asked if we wanted more drinks. She was a complete sweetheart. We did wait pretty long for our food however, but that's out of her control.   Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. Good food, good drinks, and good service! The only reason I gave is 4 stars instead of 5 is because it's a little overpriced. I've had fajitas before with chicken, shrimp, and beef in a larger portion and better taste for less. The menu items are pricey as well. However, this is definitely more of a luxurious experience and feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deluxe fajitas
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deluxe fajitas

3XCUeDCukhCJrnmSeluPmQ.text: Best text mex we had in a very long time.  The 2 sauces they give you are delicious.  Just the quality of food is amazing.  The spicing of everything was spot on.  Best fajitas I ever had.  I do with with the fajitas there were peppers and not 1 large pablano pepper. The place is huge and the atmosphere is great.  Its very expensive for Tex mex.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

uIW5iOThedc2XAjpMEoa5Q.text: Overpriced, not good service (the time we were there), and the food was not good. There was barely anyone there and my husband asked for no dairy on his food, well it was covered in cheese. We are not going back.

nWo0ewIKHVdH-7x_7BB9wQ.text: Let me start by saying, I love Tex-Mex but this is not the place for it. They bring out chips and salsa. Cool. The salsa was a little bland. The chips were so salty I could barely eat them. I ordered Chicken Fajitas.. let's see how I can sum this up so it's not an essay... First, it comes out with with all the fixing. Maybe a tablespoon of guacamole, a half of a cup of sour cream on top of lettuce, and not even teaspoon of pico de Gallo. Now that I've seen that, I move on to the fajitas... onions and chicken.. so no peppers? Really.... I mean REALLY?! All this for $22. A little much for such little food. After that I decided to try a taco because, can you really eff that up? Apparently yes. I had the tacos de camarones. It came with shrimp so I thought you definitely can't mess that up. Wrong. The shrimp was horrible. The taco was so overwhelming with flavor. Normally a good thing but this was not the case. It was not good at all. That taco was roughly $4.50. Absurd. The only good thing about this place is the host was super friendly and the waitress was attentive.  To be honest, I should I have just gone to Fuzzy's Tex Mex or an authentic Mexican restaurant. I would have paid less and known my food would be good.  Oh well. I can say I've been here, I've tried it and I probably won't return.

BFyTq_qMUa3YznF0pj11Ew.text: I went to Superica on a Thursday evening around 6:15 for dinner.  There was a small wait for a table, but we (2 people) were able to grab the last two seats at the bar for immediate service.  The restaurant did fill up very quickly - by 7:00 there were probably 25+ people waiting for tables.  The bartender was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about all of the cocktails options and food recommendations.  For cocktails, we started with the Red Headed Stranger and The Highwayman.  Both were AWESOME.  After our cocktails, we switched to wine/beer.    The chips are served with 2 salsas made in-house.  A smoky salsa and a green avocado salsa - both were outstanding.  For an appetizer, we opted to try the campechana de mariscos - a tomato-based ceviche with octopus, crab, shrimp and avocado.  It was slightly sweet and oh so tasty.  This is definitely a repeat order!    For dinner, we ordered the whole red snapper and the vegetable fajitas with an addition of some chicken.  The red snapper was juicy and pulled easily from the bones.  The vegetable fajitas were amazing - they have a rich smoky flavor that is really unique.  Both are served with rice and beans and a side plate of lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacomole and flour tortillas.    The portions for the entrees are really large.  I would recommend ordering one appetizer and one entree to split between 2 people, or skip the appetizer and limit your chip intake!  This will also help keep your bill in-check, as the prices are a bit higher than expected for a tex-mex restaurant.    Overall, we LOVED our meal and look forward to checking out brunch next.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Campechana de Mariscos
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Veggie Fajitas
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whole Red Snapper

vtvHvGiVp4tpCM1qYiDXbg.text: Really good food, awesome esthetic. Cute area there was a sidewalk fair in the alley when we were there.

IDzZa3NtStympraM1QMf9g.text: Went for lunch, OMG was the food awesome.  Taking my wife tonight and everyone at work is talking about the place!

MKSlSxj0fRivsSOIu5iCLQ.text: Came here with my family on a recent trip to Charlotte and as a whole, we had a good time here!  Drinks: A The frose, margaritas and other blended drinks were lovely, albeit a little pricey.   Service: A The staff here is great! Everyone was attentive, friendly and nice.  Food: C The favorite thing about my meal was the chips and guacamole. Otherwise, tacos failed to peak my interest, so much so I didn't finish my meal. Ceviche was so-so, too.  Ambience: A This is a fun, loud spot that's good for a festive night out. It gets crowded though, so come early!

Qgp-b9maGgreKoBdIncIMQ.text: So far this is my favorite Tex mex restaurant in Charlotte. The location of the restaurant is in the heart of southend and offers a lot of seating inside and outside. Which is helpful since this place is always busy! The chips are made in house and are out of this world! They are thin and crispy and pack a lot of flavor! If you don't like spicy food then I recommend staying away from the salsas because both are spicy. But if you do love spicy food then you're going to love them! I ordered the veggie enchilada and it was delicious! Filled with yummy veggies like potatoes, mushrooms, corn etc. The dish came with rice and beans, one thing to note is it does not automatically come with vegetarian beans. My server pointed that out and I appreciated him asking if I would like black beans instead. Overall the food and pricing were great for what you got and anytime I'm craving Tex mex I'll be stopping here!

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable enchilada

dLLz3wvLzQ53mVzNLfC-wQ.text: Very differs, very eclectic are the words I would use to describe this Tex-Mex restaurant. I'm not very use to Tex-Mex in general, but I get the feeling Superica does it well.   The decor is even Tex-Max Posh ( if that's a thing, I'm making it a thing ). Industrial/modern/western design, leather couches, interesting lighting and a large window . I think there may be a patio in the back . There is a bar and a dining area , in the front. Then towards the back there is more seating near the kitchen wear you can see orders coming up.  Our servers were great, made good suggestions and explained the menu well. We ordered chips that came with two types of salsa , not your traditional salsa, one was green due to being mixed with avocado and the other was dark red and spicy . We also order guacamole which was ok, came out already made with tostadas which where very salty.  For my entree I had chicken Souizas enchiladas . Rich , rich, rich . Tender shredded chicken covered in sour cream poblano sauce and Monterrey jack cheese ....a lot of it! It came in a either a small skillet or a very hot plate , I cannot remember . It also came with rice that I didn't eat because I was getting too full.   I'm interested in coming back at lunch to try more menu items , as well as drink menu items. Being that it's in South End , it's something you can walk to, and there's plenty of other things to do around it.

P5-hDJcptzF8IBAL7vHdVQ.text: The food here is pretty good Tex Mex, the first few times I visited I was not overly impressed with their flavors but recently I came for Sunday Brunch. Now i know you're thinking, Sunday brunch at a Mexican restaurant...but it was really good. Their pancakes are the size of a plate and taste as authentic as you mom making them. They have a homemade syrup, and when paired with butter you have a delicious sweet breakfast. The pancakes are a must try!!!

doeTGJwkTxKoCcRk9FMAmA.text: If we lived a little closer, this would be our go to place. The whole family loves it! The food is fresh, unique and plain ol' delish! The cocktails are great too! So glad a location is opening in Strawberry Hill this fall. We will be there!

3gRyKVLHzoyapwhgN3zwhA.text: The food was totally delicious. My friend and I split the fajitas and they were really amazing. It came with this butter that I am still dreaming about. Next time I'm in Charlotte I will definitely be back.

BnO7kVWToJ72mkniRLLsXA.text: I went to Superica for the first time last night. It definitely won't be my last. The atmosphere is great and the food was delightful. I got the chicken tinga tacos, which were delicious. My friend got the fajitas, which she let me sample, and they were also delicious. also, the OG margarita was really good. I highly recommend Superica.

qGiVdcmdovmMWildhIvaYw.text: Don't think I've ever gone here and the food was bad. The drinks are just as delicious. Waitstaff is wonderful and knowledgeable of what to recommend to eat. The atmosphere is super cute and it's perfect for date night or weekend brunch. Also great for large parties too. Would totally do a baby shower there. Highly recommend this place.

ox127dGYmKUhlsbqJnmuvw.text: The steak fajitas are amazing. The meat is beyond flavorful, tender, and juicy . A little pricey for Mexican but worth it. It gets packed on weekends so prepare to wait.

4UWaP1iT8bU2rwK5szi52g.text: My husband and I had an amazing time here! We've heard the hype and finally decided to check it out on a Sunday night on the earlier side of dinner. No problem at all getting a table and we found that there were a good number of families there (read: family friendly) but not overly so that it detracted from the classy ambiance.   This place definitely is a step (or two) up from your usual Mexican joint. It's got an edgy industrial feel that fits well with South End and the prices are slightly higher than average Mexican. That being said, this isn't average.   Upon being seated, our waitress brought us a bowl of piping hot chips (perfectly salted) and two kinds of salsa. One is green tomatillo and mild and the other is a very dark red that she called "spicy" but I only have a mild tolerance and I thought it was nice. Both were unique and neither tomato-y. She also brought us refills of everything because we of course devoured it!  For my meal I ordered the veggie fajitas which appear pricey on the menu, but the portions on fajitas are always huge and I planned to get multiple meals out of it (I got 3 for reference). The veggies in it are so different than what you'd expect: purple cabbage, sweet potato, cauliflower, onions, and carrots roasted to perfection with a drizzle of a creamy yellow sauce. So much flavor! This came with brown rice and black beans. My husband ordered the mole chicken which I tried and also thought was very good.   As we were finishing our meal, the manager came over to chat, refreshed our drinks, and brought us to go boxes. He stopped back multiple times (in a non-annoying way) and even brought us a big of to-go chips and salsa to "complete our meal" of leftovers.   We departed full and happy!!

qwT8eaUDJGGcf07fK54wIg.text: Went for lunch and was so impressed with the portion. If you are concerned with portion control this is not the place for you! Food was so good! Salad amazing with house made dressing.   Go there now!

ZotzKnPkVnYzt2H9-91jNg.text: DELISH!  New favorite Mexican spot.  Loved the red snapper, pricey but so worth it!  The deluxe fajitas are a must.  Their salsas are some of the best I have ever tasted.  And they make their tortillas in-house...which are AMAZING!  Their portions are great and the atmosphere is fabulous.  The service was exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Superica - Charlotte, NC, United States

cp5B6UbRzhHVvfG9UTrNww.text: This place is as good as it gets, seriously no place compares in Charlotte from right when you walk in the door, till right when you leave the staff is lit up with smiles and always willing to help - You can tell management really had improved here, my grandmother always asks about Mr. Johnson aka Team, he really lights the place up with enthusiasm and you can tell it shows in his staff - The restaurant is packed and boy is it delicious - fresh ingredients, fresh food and impeccable service - I bring all my clients here and my staff on a regular basis and it always seems to impress me - we will be back because its hands down about as close as you can get to perfect!

_gv_Nk9rr6MTThzES8h0fA.text: What a fun place! Their drink specials and cocktails are delicious and I have never had anything that wasn't delicious! Tacos, fajitas, carnitas, and pork belly are my favorite! Enjoy!

DeTAygJP0MMnh9p-64TN8g.text: The wait sucks, but the food is totally worth it.  Highly recommend the veggie enchiladas.

67KG1raC5op7cTMLGcPokQ.text: Had an early dinner, cheese and beef enchiladas, excellent as well as the pork belly taco. Great energetic atmosphere with an interesting decor. Probably the best Tex Mex ever, you decide?

ZnDZwZFA6K3ku7Q8hUBQOg.text: Expensive options for Tex-mex. Mediocre at best. I had the barbacoa tacos w/ grilled pineapples. I also had the OG margarita and it was weak. Our server was sweet and attentive. Nice atmosphere but not in my top 10 of fav restaurants in Charlotte

sJv2GoaA506BOLFWWmT0tA.text: This place has the best food ! I am obsessed with their ceviche ! I came here for an office holiday party and they truly accommodated us. I came back a few days later to get the ceviche because it was just that good! Best ceviche I've had hands down. Okay enough about the ceviche Im getting flashbacks lol I want to go pick up some haha

rz2BZ3rK_yUbel4nXM1EcQ.text: Great food but louder than a shuttle launch; I've been to Blue Oyster Cult concerts that were not as loud; great place to go if you have a good looking date who you don't want to listen to; bought the Bose 30 A noise cancelling headphones while I watched my dates mouth move up and down in slow motion-the food was above average but the noise was unbearable; I guess they have never spoken to a sound engineer who could give them the best of both worlds with some well placed and affordable sound attenuation panels!

ObFB5uq4SJ8RwVa8I7-V4Q.text: This place is incredible. From the food, to the service, to the decor to the drinks...I'm hooked! My fiance and I decided on Superica for dinner last night after hearing amazing things. It was an hour wait, but WELL worth the wait. We ordered the chicken fajita tacos and chicken/steak/shrimp fajita combo to share. Everything was INCREDIBLE. The complimentary chips and salsa were incredible as well. I believe our servers name was Holland (I'm terrible for not remembering because he was fantastic). He was very attentive and gave us honest recommendations, which did not steer us wrong. I was so impressed with the entire experience I almost couldn't wait to write this review. We've gone to a lot of new places in the area over the last few months that were hyped up and we left disappointed. Superica was an all around 11/10.

dEwqyjyUwbnvPRE2fVMeJA.text: I am in love with this place, the decor is beautiful, the food is made with so much flavor we haven't tried anything that we weren't obsessed with. The drinks are really good too. We went there on our anniversary, let me tell you something about my server named Tracey, she was so sweet, she literally made my husband and I feel so special we felt like the only ones in the restaurant. Try to sit at her table ! Overall best experience and I dream about this food!

uEqif_JGmu5BIgEjn6AtDg.text: Parking is not great, so we bit the bullet and paid.  The place is nicely done-warm and open. Also, the bathrooms were large, clean and modern.   Kim did a very good job as a server and asked if we needed help or recommendations. The food is a dollar or two above a typical Mexican spot more in line with Tex-Mex Paco's Tacos . My Pollo con Mole was very tasty with the sauce; however, I am not sure I had chicken, maybe beef/pork? lol. The "chicken" was not as delicious as the sauce. Loved the thin chips and house-made sauces-per Kim made fresh daily. Another plus is the bottomless beans and rice. Some places skimp on these very affordable carbs.They put love into their entrees and that's a good thing. Kids meals are generous and include a drink. Will try  these Lunch Specials for a feel of some of their other offerings. Also  will plan to take the rail in/ take a very early lunch.

oN7NegZWst7KMNqiNOaeaQ.text: We have been to this place a few times now. The service has been consistently good and attentive.  The flavors of the dishes are always spot on making you eat more than you thought. The prices seemed high but when you look at what you get with unlimited rice and beans for most dishes, were justifiable.  Would recommend.

D_so1YDNJZEiGE-5T6t4mw.text: Nice establishment to visit for Tex-Mex.  Fresh salsas and homemade chips start the meal. The appetizers was amazing. Had Red Snapper whole Fish to share and still had another meal for later.

IfZqSPG_VuAFVW-UX2c8ig.text: This place is so underrated!! Food is freshly prepared to order! The staff is so joyous and very knowledgeable about the food. My server Leo had a great personality and was on top of everything! We will definitely be back for more. Margaritas are the BEST IN CHARLOTTE!! Just make sure you save room for dessert!!!

LPrWYm6rZxF6X0szXRXDtQ.text: Just popped into this joint last night . I ve been craving a good tex- mex restaurant. This place hit the spot. The food was delicious and the service just as good. Our server, Ashly, knew her menu and made our time here enjoyable. Highly recommend if you enjoy delicious flavors and experience.

wDmI8Lo7F3lvEsqr2-mjPQ.text: Love the food here!!! I lived in Houston for years and this is the closest Charlotte gets to good Tex Mex!  Service is pretty decent, idk if they take reservations, but if they do then definitely do it bc sometimes the wait can be long to get a table. They also have a really good cocktail w Horchata mixed in which is a plus for me!

EqztSL9DWZDcwE2fTfJVSQ.text: Came by for lunch today. I was by myself and sat at the bar.  30 minutes in bartender told me lunch would be free. 40 minutes after ordering they still didn't manage to put a plate in front of me. Lots of people came in after me and got served. I had to get back to work so I didn't manage to eat here.

P-3llUkm6IiBOwiivCNxnw.text: Yep, rightfully popular. Like the bottler was beans and rice concept and really good sample salsas with endless chips. Overall dishes we ordered were nice too. Like to see a place like this in Charlotte.

jsJd4czF8a8M2b7gNUuSDQ.text: Wow! Great food...great atmosphere...great service. Sadie was amazing! We'll definitely be back.

aLctGnuSkr73h6sd0UUJzg.text: Sadie was an excellent server.  Very attentive and kept up with my refills, which is no small task.

cUTKhH3Pkw-oRJHm56zzyQ.text: Visiting Charlotte for the first time and a colleague took us here for dinner.  His first time as well and gotta day that it was pretty good being a Mexican food connoisseur and from Texas.  I take Mexican food really serious and this place met up to my standards.  Love the staff and management, who came up to table to check on us!   Great decor and atmosphere!  I had the enchiladas verdes and they were delish! Along with their great thin & warm tortilla chips with the avocado creamy salsa!

ainnvY_yPFcDGdNo4qnUTg.text: Leaving this 1 star review because my credit card got charged multiple times (and the wrong amount), and I have called and left my name and number twice to get this resolved. It's been 48 hours since I had lunch there, and I still have heard back from no one. Very disappointed in this service.   I'm updating my review from 1 star to 5 because I returned today after one of my friends convinced me to give it a second chance. Food and service were both amazing!!!! I'll definitely be back.

7Py-6_odZftwrQbe2SWcGQ.text: We have been to Superica two times and love the food, especially the fajitas - That Mexican Butter is so good.   More importantly, our bus person (I think his name was Ramon?) was amazing!! He was attentive when our waitress and her trainer were not.  He convinced us to take our leftover queso and thoughtfully made sure we had the right vessel to reheat it in and more chips.  He was happy to be there and talk to us and that made us want to come back again...which will probably be soon.

9iY9n-txG2VKGqbqfnq5Zg.text: Although I've been many times, their food options are mediocre, I mean the menu is really lacking and a few additions would make such a difference. But at this point it doesn't even matter because I am never going back. I got the steak nachos last night with my husband, and although I get them every time I've been in the past, this time the steak tasted a little off. Well, last night my husband and I spent the whole night suffering from the nachos. And yes it was the nachos because it was the only item both of us shared and it was evident. So, after a night of hell, I don't think I'll ever feel safe eating from here again in fear of suffering a night of food poisoning again. Superica, you need to step up your game, change your menu, and make your food way better, y'all have a prime location yet the food is horrible and now may lead to food poisoning, so I'm good. I will not be going back ever again!

mvx5AJKVVvRCGC4RMAztyQ.text: Great concept, nearly flawless execution! Food was fresh, unique, and que rico?! I was really impressed with the flavors incorporated into the various tacos (the shrimp dorado is obscenely tasty). I also had the Matador: a quirky tequila cocktail with pineapple, cilantro, and lime...absolutely delicious. Wait staff, on all fronts, was top notch; Pharoah undoubtedly made our experience one of a kind. Definitely give this joint a whirl if you enjoy tequila, Tecate, and tacos!

5A5H00o1F56SfXFr-Uz-GQ.text: Food was amazing and service was even more incredible! Defiantly ask for Sadie she was the absolute BEST !!!!

5PEm1VVhkguJRu5hSmcJ-g.text: One of the best Tex-Mex restaurant I have eaten before. It was delicious, portions were perfect for Me. The chips and salsa with the tomatillo sauce is best eveeeer. They are so addictive. Will be going back soon

WsP096AODWZrYvhPoBGGMg.text: Damn, I love this place. Maybe it's the leftover tex-mex affinity I gathered from my time in Oklahoma, but Superica takes this and does it a step better. The puffy tacos are delicious and I can attest to the greatness of the queso fundido. They also keep some good local beers around, not just the standard OMB Copper etc. you see so many Charlotte places keep in an attempt to be local without offering anything out of the ordinary. You can ball out and get some of the great appetizer dips, but even the two salsas they bring for the table are fantastic - a fire roasted red and an avocado green (I'm partial toward the green). Tie that up with a beautiful southwestern interior and a nice western music mix and a tumbleweed-laden southwestern landscape on the big screen and yeah, it's going to be busy as all hell if you're there on the weekend and yeah, you have to find street parking, but Superica is worth it.

1CZUU0vFSGPts6aFy9fv0Q.text: We dined here on opening night as well. Overall nice interior and people were relatively friendly. The wait staff struggled a bit (most likely first time nervousness) but you can tell they are not used to carrying trays yet.   Food was excellent. I did receive a cup of salsa all over my pants from a server attempting to carry the tray, but after that the food was really good (short rib).   The manager did come by after the salsa spill and tell us he'd bring margaritas, but I was a little surprised to see it charged on our bill. Drinks are delicious but a little smaller than a traditional Mexican restaurant.   All in all, good to try and really good food, but I think they might have some growing pains until they get things rolling.

PkVmSAaPT253rCcRhkobfA.text: My girlfriend and I came here during the first week of the grand opening. We arrived around 7 and had a 15 minute wait. Once seated the service was excellent, no complaints there. We ordered guacamole and it was delicious. We liked that it came with tostadas. I ordered the Matador margarita and it was unique and delicious. My girlfriend ordered Tommy's Margarita and really liked it. We both thought they could be served in larger glasses. I ordered the Chili Relleno and it was awesome! My girlfriend got the Shrimp Tacos Dorados and loved them. We love this place and will definitely be back! Great atmosphere, food, drinks, and service. Doesn't even compare to the other South End Tex mex restaurants - it's the best!

2zq7S6JOEPESzzjUP_41Tg.text: So thrilled this place opened near us. The atmosphere is awesome. Great design and overall vibe. The staff is attentive, helpful and friendly and food was awesome! The fundito queso with chorizo is unreal. Drinks were delicious. Love the outdoor patio as well. We'll be back soon for sure.

DVba8wOQxVpw74R0q6lQUQ.text: One word Yummy! Mexican and Tex Mex is my favorite type of food. I have been here now in NC for 4 months and still trying out different places to eat. This place stands out above all Mexican places starting with their chips and salsa. Chips are fresh and lightly salted. I could not get enough. They bring with it their own recipe of salsa. Very tasty just right! If you want alittle bit spicer, they have some extra sauce on the table for you. They think of everyone! Plus they have a creamy very tasty avocado sauce for your chips to try. Delicious! Free too! I ordered Traditional Steak Fajitas. Tones of fresh, large strips of skirt steak with all the toppings. Came with beans. Not a real fan so I asked for rice instead. No problem the waitress said. Rice was moist, fresh and tasty too. Husband ordered Steak Tacos. He loved them! Place is clean and decorated very cool. Staff very nice and efficient. I can not wait to go back.

Uc2ECG-6oWHPuOWjMWE89w.text: I was very impressed with this place! The food is a little pricy but delicious and unique. Recommend the ceviche.

zIVgvJ6naWRe638px1d33g.text: Delicious tex mex, drinks, and amazing service! Thank you Holland! We will be back and look forward to trying out brunch!

54DviJ6eY40sNhwIXo0F7w.text: Great food!! A bit pricey but definitely worth it. I recommend the short rib!! Homemade tortillas are great and the portions are big enough to take some home.

hdZrf_5y_ii6JSUpGHZ6dQ.text: One of the only places in Charlotte that does Tex Mex...good tamales. Most Charlotte Mexican joints are really not that good. People need to get better palettes if they think cantina is good Mexican.

F3OnQRCOlwkUgNCJmQFlmw.text: Took my family of seven here for lunch; the hostess was very attentive to my seating preference and our waiter Marquis provided the best table service I have ever had in my entire life's experience dining in Charlotte.  We all had the lunch special with a variety of choices:  nicely browned/cheesy enchiladas, tender chicken verde enchiladas, and a very keto friendly and flavorful pozole verde soup with pork rinds floating on top and a huge side salad option.  The chips and multiple salsas were delicious, fresh and unique.  The atmosphere is young and fun but not too loud and this is our new favorite spot to walk to in our Dilworth/South End neighborhood.  The tequila shots are generous in size but start at $8; they have $6 Hop Drop and Roll IPA drafts which is a pretty good deal.  The location is also an easy walk from the East/West Blvd. light rail station.

pGWgc5Ix6YI8nG49yJcmTQ.text: My new favorite in Charlotte. We drove by on Saturday evening and there was a lot of people waiting for a seat, which is a good sign but we did not feel like waiting. So we went today (Sunday) around 4pm and did not have a wait. The service was a bit delayed with drinks but I expected this because of the other reviews. However it did not bother me because it is a brand new restaurant and of course you will have a few rough spots in the beginning. The wait for our food was short and the food was AMAZING, I mean it was perfection! Our server was such a doll. We tried the Parilla deluxe, Flautas, and the Queso Fundido. Definitely some of the best food I have ever had in Charlotte. So excited to have this excellent restaurant in our city! Thank you Superica for coming to the Southend and knocking us off our feet. I really was hesitant about posting this review because I would rather keep this place a secret!!!!!

dXgRSzTMiDCeJ179qwAVGQ.text: Definitely plan on waiting at this spot. There is a place with tables outside in the back where you can wait and have drinks. Whatever they tell you about the wait add about 30 minutes to. The drinks are good and the food is great. We ordered 6 different meals and 2 desserts and everything was good. Chips and salsa as well as the queso with chorizo was amazing - must order. I would definitely recommend this place but don't go when you're in a rush.

Nb_QPMtISTTKh2QBCjhndA.text: Went for a late lunch today with friends. It was not initially my choice because of friends that went two weeks ago, received slow and poor service only to have their entire meal comped. They also specified that the price point was a little high for the food. Still, I'll give anywhere a chance. Unfortunately, my visit confirmed the poor service and the high price point. The restaurant really should have $$$. $11.99 lunch special for two items (I had enchiladas) plus "family style" rice and beans. While the food was good, the price point was about $2-3 too high. We went at the tail end of the lunch rush so kitchen volume was low but still didn't get the appetizer until we reminded staff twice (which was then comped). We also had to ask for the craft beer twice only to have the response be the name of a brewery and not the kind of beer so had to ask a third time (bartender and server issue especially at the end of lunch). On the whole, I can't recommend the restaurant and do not plan to return. It pains me because I love TexMex food and usually complimentary to any good restaurant (as can be seen from my other reviews). Charlotte also has some good TexMex but could alway use more. While the restaurant is new, if the service doesn't improve then I think it will struggle. 2 stars only because the taste of the food was decent.

Y6ozZ658F3FjZaCwMOxkAA.text: Gorgeous new restaurant in south end. The drinks are great as the food even better! This is a must go to! Chicken suizas enchiladas and the chicken fajita nachos along with the Queso is amazing!

JZGr2PNSdeLQwfnjWsYf_A.text: We dined at the bar yesterday for lunch. I can't remember the bartender's name... maybe Tyler?.. he was great - attentive and knowledgeable of the food. He asked us if it was our first time, which it was, and gave us a quick rundown of the menu- not over-the-top - just enough information. Drinks were good. We got the chili con queso with chorizo- it was decent- a little thinner than queso at Mexican restaurants- next time I think we'll try the queso fundido. The food was pretty good - I never really have high expectations of Tex Mex food but Superica was on point. The only place I've had better Tex Mex was at Rocco's Taco down in South Florida. We got a fajita dish with chicken- seasoned very well, bacon-wrapped shrimp- amazing, and steak- only complaint here is it was cook all the way through. Not a big deal though as most steak fajitas are usually thin - there's was thicker and other places they're cooked-through. We definitely had left overs too. We'll be back for sure!! Ohh and that frothed garlic butter, yum!!!
